13:27 Should the priest, upon examination on the seventh day, find that it has spread at all on the skin, he shall declare the person unclean; it is a scaly infection.
13:28 But if the blotch remains the same without spreading on the skin and is faded, it is merely the spot of the burn; the priest shall therefore declare the person clean, since it is only the scar of the burn.
13:29 When a man or a woman has an infection on the head or in the beard,
13:30 should the priest, upon examination, find that the infection appears to be deeper than the skin and that there is fine yellow hair in it, the priest shall declare the person unclean; it is a scall. It is a scaly infection of the head or beard.
13:31 But if the priest, upon examining the scall infection, finds that it does not appear to be deeper than the skin, though the hair in it may not be black, the priest shall quarantine the scall-stricken person for seven days.
13:32 Should the priest, upon examining the infection on the seventh day find that the scall has not spread and has no yellow hair in it and does not seem to be deeper than the skin,
13:33 the person shall shave, but not the scall spot. Then the priest shall quarantine the scall-diseased person for another seven days.
13:34 If the priest, upon examining the scall on the seventh day, finds that it has not spread on the skin and that it does not appear to be deeper than the skin, he shall declare the person clean; the latter shall wash his garments, and will thus be clean.
13:35 But if the scall spreads at all on the skin after the person has been declared clean—
13:36 should the priest, upon examination, find that the scall has indeed spread on the skin, he need not look for yellow hair; the individual is unclean.
13:37 If, however, the scall has remained unchanged in color and black hair has grown in it, the disease has been healed; the person is clean, and the priest shall declare the individual clean.
13:38 When the skin of a man or a woman is spotted with several white blotches,
13:39 if the priest, upon examination, finds that the blotches on the skin are pale white, it is only tetter that has broken out on the skin, and the person therefore is clean.
13:40 When a man loses the hair of his head, he is simply bald on the crown and not unclean.
13:41 So too, if he loses the hair on the front of his head, he is simply bald on the forehead and not unclean.
13:42 But when there is a reddish white infection on his bald crown or bald forehead, it is a scaly infection that is breaking out there.
13:43 If the priest, upon examination, finds that the infection spot on the bald area on the crown or forehead has the same reddish white appearance as that of a scaly infection of the skin,
13:44 the man has a scaly infection and is unclean. The priest shall declare him unclean; his infection is on his head.
13:45 The garments of one afflicted with a scaly infection shall be rent and the hair disheveled, and the mustache covered. The individual shall cry out, Unclean, unclean!
13:46 As long as the infection is present, the person shall be unclean. Being unclean, that individual shall dwell apart, taking up residence outside the camp.
13:47 When a fungal infection is on a garment of wool or of linen,
13:48 or on the warp and woof of linen or wool, or on a hide or anything made of leather,
13:49 if the infection on the garment or hide, or on the warp or woof, or on any leather article is greenish or reddish, the thing is indeed a fungal infection and must be examined by the priest.
13:50 Having examined the infection, the priest shall quarantine the infected article for seven days.
13:51 If the priest, upon inspecting the infection on the seventh day, finds that it has spread on the garment, or on the warp or woof, or on the leather, whatever be its use, the infection is a harmful fungus; the article is unclean.
13:52 He shall therefore burn up the garment, or the warp or woof, be it of wool or linen, or any leather article which is infected; since it is a harmful fungus, it must be destroyed by fire.
13:53 But if the priest, upon examination, finds that it has not spread on the garment, or on the warp or woof, or on the leather article,
13:54 he shall give orders to have the infected article washed and then quarantined for another seven days.
13:55 If the priest, upon examination after the infection was washed, finds that it has not changed its color, even though it may not have spread, the article is unclean. You shall burn it with fire. It is a fray, be it on its inner or outer side.
13:56 But if the priest, upon examination, finds that the infection has faded after the washing, he shall cut it out of the garment, or the leather, or the warp or woof.
13:57 If, however, the infection again appears on the garment, or on the warp or woof, or on the leather article, it is still virulent and you shall burn the thing infected with fire.
13:58 But if, after the washing, the infection has disappeared from the garment, or the warp or woof, or the leather article, the thing shall be washed a second time, and thus it will be clean.
13:59 This is the instruction for a fungal infection on a garment of wool or linen, or on a warp or woof, or on any leather article, to determine whether it is clean or unclean.
14:1 The said to Moses:
14:2 This is the ritual for someone that had a scaly infection at the time of that persons purification. The individual shall be brought to the priest,
14:3 who is to go outside the camp. If the priest, upon inspection, finds that the scaly infection has healed in the afflicted person,
14:4 he shall order that two live, clean birds, as well as some cedar wood, scarlet yarn, and hyssop be obtained for the one who is to be purified.
14:5 The priest shall then order that one of the birds be slaughtered over an earthen vessel with fresh water in it.
14:6 Taking the living bird with the cedar wood, the scarlet yarn and the hyssop, the priest shall dip them, including the live bird, in the blood of the bird that was slaughtered over the fresh water,
14:7 and then sprinkle seven times on the person to be purified from the scaly infection. When he has thus purified that person, he shall let the living bird fly away over the countryside.
14:8 The person being purified shall then wash his garments, shave off all hair, and bathe in water, and so become clean. After this the person may come inside the camp, but shall still remain outside his or her tent for seven days.
14:9 On the seventh day this individual shall again shave off all hair, of the head, beard, and eyebrows—all hair must be shaved—and also wash his garments and bathe the body in water, and so become clean.
14:10 On the eighth day the individual shall take two unblemished male lambs, one unblemished yearling ewe lamb, three tenths of an ephah of bran flour mixed with oil for a grain offering, and one log of oil.
14:11 The priest who performs the purification ceremony shall place the person who is being purified, as well as all these offerings, before the at the entrance of the tent of meeting.
14:12 Taking one of the male lambs, the priest shall present it as a reparation offering, along with the log of oil, raising them as an elevated offering before the .
14:13 This lamb shall be slaughtered in the sacred place where the purification offering and the burnt offering are slaughtered, because the reparation offering is like the purification offering; it belongs to the priest and is most holy.
14:14 Then the priest shall take some of the blood of the reparation offering and put it on the lobe of the right ear, the thumb of the right hand, and the big toe of the right foot of the person being purified.
14:15 The priest shall also take the log of oil and pour some of it into the palm of his own left hand;
14:16 then, dipping his right finger in the oil on his left palm, he shall sprinkle some of it with his finger seven times before the .
14:17 Of the oil left in his hand the priest shall put some on the lobe of the right ear, the thumb of the right hand, and the big toe of the right foot of the person being purified, over the blood of the reparation offering.
14:18 The rest of the oil in his hand the priest shall put on the head of the one being purified. Thus shall the priest make atonement for the individual before the .
14:19 The priest shall next offer the purification offering, thus making atonement on behalf of the one being purified from the uncleanness. After this the burnt offering shall be slaughtered.
14:20 The priest shall offer the burnt offering and the grain offering on the altar before the . Thus shall the priest make atonement for the person, and the individual will become clean.
14:21 If a person is poor and cannot afford so much, that person shall take one male lamb for a reparation offering, to be used as an elevated offering in atonement, one tenth of an ephah of bran flour mixed with oil for a grain offering, a log of oil,
14:22 and two turtledoves or pigeons, which the individual can more easily afford, the one as a purification offering and the other as a burnt offering.
14:23 On the eighth day of purification the person shall bring them to the priest, at the entrance of the tent of meeting before the .
14:24 Taking the lamb of the reparation offering, along with the log of oil, the priest shall raise them as an elevated offering before the .
14:25 When the lamb of the reparation offering has been slaughtered, the priest shall take some of its blood, and put it on the lobe of the right ear, on the thumb of the right hand, and on the big toe of the right foot of the person being purified.
14:26 The priest shall then pour some of the oil into the palm of his own left hand
14:27 and with his right finger sprinkle some of the oil in his left palm seven times before the .
14:28 Some of the oil in his hand the priest shall also put on the lobe of the right ear, the thumb of the right hand, and the big toe of the right foot of the person being purified, where he had sprinkled the blood of the reparation offering.
14:29 The rest of the oil in his hand the priest shall put on the head of the one being purified. Thus shall he make atonement for the individual before the .
14:30 Then, of the turtledoves or pigeons, such as the person can afford,
14:31 the priest shall offer one as a purification offering and the other as a burnt offering, along with the grain offering. Thus shall the priest make atonement before the for the person who is being purified.
14:32 This is the ritual for one afflicted with a scaly infection who has insufficient means for purification.
14:33 The said to Moses and Aaron:
14:34 When you come into the land of Canaan, which I am giving you to possess, if I put a fungal infection in any house of the land you occupy,
14:35 the owner of the house shall come and report to the priest, Something like an infection has appeared in my house.
14:36 The priest shall then order the house to be cleared out before he goes in to examine the infection, lest everything in the house become unclean. Only after this is he to go in to examine the house.
14:37 If the priest, upon inspection, finds that the infection on the walls of the house consists of greenish or reddish spots which seem to go deeper than the surface of the wall,
14:38 he shall go out of the house to the doorway and quarantine the house for seven days.
14:39 On the seventh day the priest shall return. If, upon inspection, he finds that the infection has spread on the walls,
14:40 he shall order the infected stones to be pulled out and cast in an unclean place outside the city.
14:41 The whole inside of the house shall then be scraped, and the mortar that has been scraped off shall be dumped in an unclean place outside the city.
14:42 Then other stones shall be brought and put in the place of the old stones, and new mortar obtained and plastered on the house.
14:43 If the infection breaks out once more in the house after the stones have been pulled out and the house has been scraped and replastered,
14:44 the priest shall come; and if, upon inspection, he finds that the infection has spread in the house, it is a corrosive fungus in the house, and it is unclean.
14:45 It shall be pulled down, and all its stones, beams and mortar shall be hauled away to an unclean place outside the city.
14:46 Whoever enters a house while it is quarantined shall be unclean until evening.
14:47 Whoever sleeps or eats in such a house shall also wash his garments.
14:48 If the priest finds, when he comes to the house, that the infection has in fact not spread in the house after the plastering, he shall declare the house clean, since the infection has been healed.
14:49 To purify the house, he shall take two birds, as well as cedar wood, scarlet yarn, and hyssop.
14:50 One of the birds he shall slaughter over an earthen vessel with fresh water in it.
14:51 Then, taking the cedar wood, the hyssop and the scarlet yarn, together with the living bird, he shall dip them all in the blood of the slaughtered bird and the fresh water, and sprinkle the house seven times.
14:52 Thus he shall purify the house with the birds blood and the fresh water, along with the living bird, the cedar wood, the hyssop, and the scarlet yarn.
14:53 He shall then let the living bird fly away over the countryside outside the city. Thus he shall make atonement for the house, and it will be clean.
14:54 This is the ritual for every kind of human scaly infection and scall,
14:55 and for fungus diseases in garments and houses—
14:56 for marks, lesions and blotches—
14:57 to give direction when there is a state of uncleanness and when a state of cleanness. This is the ritual for scaly infection.
15:1 The said to Moses and Aaron:
15:2 Speak to the Israelites and tell them: When any man has a genital discharge, he is thereby unclean.
15:3 Such is his uncleanness from this discharge, whether his body drains freely with the discharge or is blocked up from the discharge. His uncleanness is on him all the days that his body discharges or is blocked up from his discharge; this is his uncleanness.
15:4 Any bed on which the man with the discharge lies is unclean, and any article on which he sits is unclean.
15:5 Anyone who touches his bed shall wash his garments, bathe in water, and be unclean until evening.
15:6 Whoever sits on an article on which the man with the discharge was sitting shall wash his garments, bathe in water, and be unclean until evening.
15:7 Whoever touches the body of the man with the discharge shall wash his garments, bathe in water, and be unclean until evening.
15:8 If the man with the discharge spits on a clean person, the latter shall wash his garments, bathe in water, and be unclean until evening.
15:9 Any saddle on which the man with the discharge rides is unclean.
15:10 Whoever touches anything that was under him shall be unclean until evening; whoever carries any such thing shall wash his garments, bathe in water, and be unclean until evening.
15:11 Anyone whom the man with the discharge touches with his unrinsed hands shall wash his garments, bathe in water, and be unclean until evening.
15:12 Earthenware touched by the man with the discharge shall be broken; and every wooden article shall be rinsed with water.
15:13 When a man with a discharge becomes clean of his discharge, he shall count seven days for his purification. Then he shall wash his garments and bathe his body in fresh water, and so he will be clean.
15:14 On the eighth day he shall take two turtledoves or two pigeons, and going before the , to the entrance of the tent of meeting, he shall give them to the priest,
15:15 who shall offer them up, the one as a purification offering and the other as a burnt offering. Thus shall the priest make atonement before the for the man because of his discharge.
15:16 When a man has an emission of semen, he shall bathe his whole body in water and be unclean until evening.
15:17 Any piece of cloth or leather with semen on it shall be washed with water and be unclean until evening.
15:18 If a man has sexual relations with a woman, they shall both bathe in water and be unclean until evening.
15:19 When a woman has a flow of blood from her body, she shall be in a state of menstrual uncleanness for seven days. Anyone who touches her shall be unclean until evening.
15:20 Anything on which she lies or sits during her menstrual period shall be unclean.
15:21 Anyone who touches her bed shall wash his garments, bathe in water, and be unclean until evening.
15:22 Whoever touches any article on which she was sitting shall wash his garments, bathe in water, and be unclean until evening.
15:23 Whether an object is on the bed or on something she sat upon, when the person touches it, that person shall be unclean until evening.
15:24 If a man lies with her, he contracts her menstrual uncleanness and shall be unclean for seven days; every bed on which he then lies also becomes unclean.
15:25 When a woman has a flow of blood for several days outside her menstrual period, or when her flow continues beyond the ordinary period, as long as she suffers this unclean flow she shall be unclean, just as during her menstrual period.
15:26 Any bed on which she lies during such a flow becomes unclean, as it would during her menstrual period, and any article on which she sits becomes unclean just as during her menstrual period.
15:27 Anyone who touches them becomes unclean; that person shall wash his garments, bathe in water, and be unclean until evening.
15:28 When she becomes clean from her flow, she shall count seven days; after this she becomes clean.
15:29 On the eighth day she shall take two turtledoves or two pigeons and bring them to the priest at the entrance of the tent of meeting.
15:30 The priest shall offer one of them as a purification offering and the other as a burnt offering. Thus shall the priest make atonement before the for her because of her unclean flow.
15:31 You shall warn the Israelites of their uncleanness, lest they die through their uncleanness by defiling my tabernacle, which is in their midst.
15:32 This is the ritual for the man with a discharge, or who has an emission of semen, and thereby becomes unclean;
15:33 as well as for the woman who has her menstrual period; or one who has a discharge, male or female; and also for the man who lies with an unclean woman.
16:1 After the death of Aarons two sons, who died when they encroached on the s presence, the spoke to Moses
16:2 and said to him: Tell your brother Aaron that he is not to come whenever he pleases into the inner sanctuary, inside the veil, in front of the cover on the ark, lest he die, for I reveal myself in a cloud above the arks cover.
16:3 Only in this way may Aaron enter the inner sanctuary. He shall bring a bull of the herd for a purification offering and a ram for a burnt offering.
16:4 He shall wear the sacred linen tunic, with the linen pants underneath, gird himself with the linen sash and put on the linen turban. But since these vestments are sacred, he shall not put them on until he has first bathed his body in water.
16:5 From the Israelite community he shall receive two male goats for a purification offering and one ram for a burnt offering.
16:6 Aaron shall offer the bull, his purification offering, to make atonement for himself and for his household.
16:7 Taking the two male goats and setting them before the at the entrance of the tent of meeting,
16:8 he shall cast lots to determine which one is for the and which for Azazel.
16:9 The goat that is determined by lot for the , Aaron shall present and offer up as a purification offering.
16:10 But the goat determined by lot for Azazel he shall place before the alive, so that with it he may make atonement by sending it off to Azazel in the desert.
16:11 Thus shall Aaron offer his bull for the purification offering, to make atonement for himself and for his family. When he has slaughtered it,
16:12 he shall take a censer full of glowing embers from the altar before the , as well as a double handful of finely ground fragrant incense, and bringing them inside the veil,
16:13 there before the he shall put incense on the fire, so that a cloud of incense may shield the cover that is over the covenant, else he will die.
16:14 Taking some of the bulls blood, he shall sprinkle it with his finger on the front of the arks cover and likewise sprinkle some of the blood with his finger seven times in front of the cover.
16:15 Then he shall slaughter the goat of the peoples purification offering, and bringing its blood inside the veil, he shall do with it as he did with the bulls blood, sprinkling it on the arks cover and in front of it.
16:16 Thus he shall purge the inner sanctuary of all the Israelites impurities and trespasses, including all their sins. He shall do the same for the tent of meeting, which is set up among them in the midst of their uncleanness.
16:17 No one else may be in the tent of meeting from the time he enters the inner sanctuary to make atonement until he departs. When he has made atonement for himself and his household, as well as for the whole Israelite assembly,
16:18 he shall come out to the altar before the and purge it also. Taking some of the bulls and the goats blood, he shall put it on the horns around the altar,
16:19 and with his finger sprinkle some of the blood on it seven times. Thus he shall purify it and sanctify it from the impurities of the Israelites.
16:20 When he has finished purging the inner sanctuary, the tent of meeting and the altar, Aaron shall bring forward the live goat.
16:21 Laying both hands on its head, he shall confess over it all the iniquities of the Israelites and their trespasses, including all their sins, and so put them on the goats head. He shall then have it led into the wilderness by an attendant.
16:22 The goat will carry off all their iniquities to an isolated region. When the goat is dispatched into the wilderness,
16:23 Aaron shall go into the tent of meeting, strip off the linen vestments he had put on when he entered the inner sanctuary, and leave them in the tent of meeting.
16:24 After bathing his body with water in a sacred place, he shall put on his regular vestments, and then come out and offer his own and the peoples burnt offering, in atonement for himself and for the people,
16:25 and also burn the fat of the purification offering on the altar.
16:26 The man who led away the goat for Azazel shall wash his garments and bathe his body in water; only then may he enter the camp.
16:27 The bull and the goat of the purification offering whose blood was brought to make atonement in the inner sanctuary, shall be taken outside the camp, where their hides and flesh and dung shall be burned in the fire.
16:28 The one who burns them shall wash his garments and bathe his body in water; only then may he enter the camp.
16:29 This shall be an everlasting statute for you: on the tenth day of the seventh month every one of you, whether a native or a resident alien, shall humble yourselves and shall do no work.
16:30 For on this day atonement is made for you to make you clean; of all your sins you will be cleansed before the .
16:31 It shall be a sabbath of complete rest for you, on which you must humble yourselves—an everlasting statute.
16:32 This atonement is to be made by the priest who has been anointed and ordained to the priesthood in succession to his father. He shall wear the linen garments, the sacred vestments,
16:33 and purge the most sacred part of the sanctuary, as well as the tent of meeting, and the altar. He shall also make atonement for the priests and all the people of the assembly.
16:34 This, then, shall be an everlasting statute for you: once a year atonement shall be made on behalf of the Israelites for all their sins. And Moses did as the had commanded him.
17:1 The said to Moses:
17:2 Speak to Aaron and his sons, as well as to all the Israelites, and tell them: This is what the has commanded:
17:3 Any Israelite who slaughters an ox or a sheep or a goat, whether in the camp or outside of it,
17:4 without first bringing it to the entrance of the tent of meeting to present it as an offering to the in front of the s tabernacle, shall be judged guilty of bloodshed—that individual has shed blood, and shall be cut off from the people.
17:5 This is so that such sacrifices as they used to offer in the open field the Israelites shall henceforth bring to the at the entrance of the tent of meeting, to the priest, and sacrifice them there as communion sacrifices to the .
17:6 The priest will splash the blood on the altar of the at the entrance of the tent of meeting and burn the fat for an odor pleasing to the .
17:7 No longer shall they offer their sacrifices to the demons with whom they prostituted themselves. This shall be an everlasting statute for them and their descendants.
17:8 Tell them, therefore: Anyone, whether of the house of Israel or of the aliens residing among them, who offers a burnt offering or sacrifice
17:9 without bringing it to the entrance of the tent of meeting to offer it to the , shall be cut off from the people.
17:10 As for anyone, whether of the house of Israel or of the aliens residing among them, who consumes any blood, I will set myself against that individual and will cut that person off from among the people,
17:11 since the life of the flesh is in the blood, and I have given it to you to make atonement on the altar for yourselves, because it is the blood as life that makes atonement.
17:12 That is why I have told the Israelites: No one among you, not even a resident alien, may consume blood.
17:13 Anyone hunting, whether of the Israelites or of the aliens residing among them, who catches an animal or a bird that may be eaten, shall pour out its blood and cover it with earth,
17:14 since the life of all flesh is its blood. I have told the Israelites: You shall not consume the blood of any flesh. Since the life of all flesh is its blood, anyone who consumes it shall be cut off.
17:15 Everyone, whether a native or an alien, who eats of an animal that died of itself or was killed by a wild beast, shall wash his garments, bathe in water, and be unclean until evening, and then become clean.
17:16 If one does not wash his garments and bathe, that person shall bear the penalty.
18:1 The said to Moses:
18:2 Speak to the Israelites and tell them: I, the , am your God.
18:3 You shall not do as they do in the land of Egypt, where you once lived, nor shall you do as they do in the land of Canaan, where I am bringing you; do not conform to their customs.
18:4 My decrees you shall carry out, and my statutes you shall take care to follow. I, the , am your God.
18:5 Keep, then, my statutes and decrees, for the person who carries them out will find life through them. I am the .
18:6 None of you shall approach a close relative to have sexual intercourse. I am the .
18:7 You shall not disgrace your father by having intercourse with your mother. She is your own mother; you shall not have intercourse with her.
18:8 You shall not have intercourse with your fathers wife, for that would be a disgrace to your father.
18:9 You shall not have intercourse with your sister, your fathers daughter or your mothers daughter, whether she was born in your own household or born elsewhere.
18:10 You shall not have intercourse with your sons daughter or with your daughters daughter, for that would be a disgrace to you.
18:11 You shall not have intercourse with the daughter whom your fathers wife bore to him in his household, since she, too, is your sister.
18:12 You shall not have intercourse with your fathers sister, since she is your fathers relative.
18:13 You shall not have intercourse with your mothers sister, since she is your mothers relative.
18:14 You shall not disgrace your fathers brother by having sexual relations with his wife, since she, too, is your aunt.
18:15 You shall not have intercourse with your daughter-in-law; she is your sons wife; you shall not have intercourse with her.
18:16 You shall not have intercourse with your brothers wife; that would be a disgrace to your brother.
18:17 You shall not have intercourse with a woman and also with her daughter, nor shall you marry and have intercourse with her sons daughter or her daughters daughter; they are related to her. This would be shameful.
18:18 While your wife is still living you shall not marry her sister as her rival and have intercourse with her.
18:19 You shall not approach a woman to have intercourse with her while she is in her menstrual uncleanness.
18:20 You shall not have sexual relations with your neighbors wife, defiling yourself with her.
18:21 You shall not offer any of your offspring for immolation to Molech, thus profaning the name of your God. I am the .
18:22 You shall not lie with a male as with a woman; such a thing is an abomination.
18:23 You shall not have sexual relations with an animal, defiling yourself with it; nor shall a woman set herself in front of an animal to mate with it; that is perverse.
18:24 Do not defile yourselves by any of these things, because by them the nations whom I am driving out of your way have defiled themselves.
18:25 And so the land has become defiled, and I have punished it for its wickedness, and the land has vomited out its inhabitants.
18:26 You, however, must keep my statutes and decrees, avoiding all these abominations, both the natives and the aliens resident among you—
18:27 because the previous inhabitants did all these abominations and the land became defiled;
18:28 otherwise the land will vomit you out also for having defiled it, just as it vomited out the nations before you.
18:29 For whoever does any of these abominations shall be cut off from the people.
18:30 Heed my charge, then, not to observe the abominable customs that have been observed before your time, and thus become impure by them. I, the , am your God.
19:1 The said to Moses:
19:2 Speak to the whole Israelite community and tell them: Be holy, for I, the your God, am holy.
19:3 Each of you revere your mother and father, and keep my sabbaths. I, the , am your God.
19:4 Do not turn aside to idols, nor make molten gods for yourselves. I, the , am your God.
19:5 When you sacrifice your communion sacrifice to the , you shall sacrifice it so that it is acceptable on your behalf.
19:6 It must be eaten on the day of your sacrifice or on the following day. Whatever is left over until the third day shall be burned in fire.
19:7 If any of it is eaten on the third day, it will be a desecrated offering and not be accepted;
19:8 whoever eats of it then shall bear the penalty for having profaned what is sacred to the . Such a one shall be cut off from the people.
19:9 When you reap the harvest of your land, you shall not be so thorough that you reap the field to its very edge, nor shall you gather the gleanings of your harvest.
19:10 Likewise, you shall not pick your vineyard bare, nor gather up the grapes that have fallen. These things you shall leave for the poor and the alien. I, the , am your God.
19:11 You shall not steal. You shall not deceive or speak falsely to one another.
19:12 You shall not swear falsely by my name, thus profaning the name of your God. I am the .
19:13 You shall not exploit your neighbor. You shall not commit robbery. You shall not withhold overnight the wages of your laborer.
19:14 You shall not insult the deaf, or put a stumbling block in front of the blind, but you shall fear your God. I am the .
19:15 You shall not act dishonestly in rendering judgment. Show neither partiality to the weak nor deference to the mighty, but judge your neighbor justly.
19:16 You shall not go about spreading slander among your people; nor shall you stand by idly when your neighbors life is at stake. I am the .
19:17 You shall not hate any of your kindred in your heart. Reprove your neighbor openly so that you do not incur sin because of that person.
19:18 Take no revenge and cherish no grudge against your own people. You shall love your neighbor as yourself. I am the .
19:19 Keep my statutes: do not breed any of your domestic animals with others of a different species; do not sow a field of yours with two different kinds of seed; and do not put on a garment woven with two different kinds of thread.
19:20 If a man has sexual relations with a female slave who has been acquired by another man but has not yet been redeemed or given her freedom, an investigation shall be made. They shall not be put to death, because she has not been freed.
19:21 The man shall bring to the entrance of the tent of meeting as his reparation to the a ram as a reparation offering.
19:22 With the ram of the reparation offering the priest shall make atonement before the for the wrong the man has committed, so that he will be forgiven for the wrong he has committed.
19:23 When you come into the land and plant any fruit tree there, first look upon its fruit as if it were uncircumcised. For three years, it shall be uncircumcised for you; it may not be eaten.
19:24 In the fourth year, however, all of its fruit shall be dedicated to the in joyous celebration.
19:25 Not until the fifth year may you eat its fruit, to increase the yield for you. I, the , am your God.
19:26 Do not eat anything with the blood still in it. Do not recite charms or practice soothsaying.
19:27 Do not clip your hair at the temples, nor spoil the edges of your beard.
19:28 Do not lacerate your bodies for the dead, and do not tattoo yourselves. I am the .
19:29 You shall not degrade your daughter by making a prostitute of her; otherwise the land will prostitute itself and become full of lewdness.
19:30 Keep my sabbaths, and reverence my sanctuary. I am the .
19:31 Do not turn to ghosts or consult spirits, by which you will be defiled. I, the , am your God.
19:32 Stand up in the presence of the aged, show respect for the old, and fear your God. I am the .
19:33 When an alien resides with you in your land, do not mistreat such a one.
19:34 You shall treat the alien who resides with you no differently than the natives born among you; you shall love the alien as yourself; for you too were once aliens in the land of Egypt. I, the , am your God.
19:35 Do not act dishonestly in using measures of length or weight or capacity.
19:36 You shall have a true scale and true weights, an honest ephah and an honest hin. I, the , am your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt.
19:37 Be careful, then, to observe all my statutes and decrees. I am the .
20:1 The said to Moses:
20:2 Tell the Israelites: Anyone, whether an Israelite or an alien residing in Israel, who gives offspring to Molech shall be put to death. The people of the land shall stone that person.
20:3 I myself will turn against and cut off that individual from among the people; for in the giving of offspring to Molech, my sanctuary was defiled and my holy name was profaned.
20:4 If the people of the land condone the giving of offspring to Molech, by failing to put the wrongdoer to death,
20:5 I myself will turn against that individual and his or her family, and I will cut off from their people both the wrongdoer and all who follow this person by prostituting themselves with Molech.
20:6 Should anyone turn to ghosts and spirits and prostitute oneself with them, I will turn against that person and cut such a one off from among the people.
20:7 Sanctify yourselves, then, and be holy; for I, the , your God, am holy.
20:8 Be careful, therefore, to observe my statutes. I, the , make you holy.
20:9 Anyone who curses father or mother shall be put to death; and having cursed father or mother, such a one will bear the bloodguilt.
20:10 If a man commits adultery with his neighbors wife, both the adulterer and the adulteress shall be put to death.
20:11 If a man disgraces his father by lying with his fathers wife, the two of them shall be put to death; their bloodguilt is upon them.
20:12 If a man lies with his daughter-in-law, both of them shall be put to death; they have done what is perverse; their bloodguilt is upon them.
20:13 If a man lies with a male as with a woman, they have committed an abomination; the two of them shall be put to death; their bloodguilt is upon them.
20:14 If a man marries a woman and her mother also, that is shameful conduct; the man and the two women as well shall be burned to death, so that shamefulness may not be found among you.
20:15 If a man has sexual relations with an animal, the man shall be put to death, and you shall kill the animal.
20:16 If a woman goes up to any animal to mate with it, you shall kill the woman and the animal; they shall both be put to death; their bloodguilt is upon them.
20:17 If a man marries his sister, his fathers daughter or his mothers daughter, and they have intercourse with each other, that is disgraceful; they shall be publicly cut off from the people; the man shall bear the penalty of having had intercourse with his own sister.
20:18 If a man lies with a woman during her menstrual period and has intercourse with her, he has laid bare the source of her flow and she has uncovered it. The two of them shall be cut off from the people.
20:19 You shall not have intercourse with your mothers sister or your fathers sister, because that dishonors ones own flesh; they shall bear their penalty.
20:20 If a man lies with his uncles wife, he disgraces his uncle; they shall bear the penalty; they shall die childless.
20:21 If a man takes his brothers wife, it is severe defilement and he has disgraced his brother; they shall be childless.
20:22 Be careful to observe all my statutes and all my decrees; otherwise the land where I am bringing you to dwell will vomit you out.
20:23 Do not conform, therefore, to the customs of the nations whom I am driving out of your way, because all these things that they have done have filled me with disgust for them.
20:24 But to you I have said: You shall take possession of their land. I am giving it to you to possess, a land flowing with milk and honey. I, the , am your God, who have set you apart from other peoples.
20:25 You, too, must set apart, then, the clean animals from the unclean, and the clean birds from the unclean, so that you do not make yourselves detestable through any beast or bird or any creature which creeps on the ground that I have set apart for you as unclean.
20:26 To me, therefore, you shall be holy; for I, the , am holy, and I have set you apart from other peoples to be my own.
20:27 A man or a woman who acts as a medium or clairvoyant shall be put to death. They shall be stoned to death; their bloodguilt is upon them.
21:1 The said to Moses: Speak to the priests, Aarons sons, and tell them: None of you shall make himself unclean for any dead person among his kindred,
21:2 except for his nearest relatives, his mother or father, his son or daughter, his brother
21:3 or his unmarried sister, who is of his own family while she remains single; for these he may make himself unclean.
21:4 But as a husband among his kindred he shall not make himself unclean and thus profane himself.
21:5 The priests shall not make bald the crown of their head, nor shave the edges of their beard, nor lacerate their body.
21:6 They shall be holy to their God, and shall not profane their Gods name, since they offer the oblations of the , the food of their God; so they must be holy.
21:7 A priest shall not marry a woman debased by prostitution, nor a woman who has been divorced by her husband; for the priest is holy to his God.
21:8 Honor him as holy for he offers the food of your God; he shall be holy to you, because I, the , am holy who make you holy.
21:9 If a priests daughter debases herself by prostitution, she thereby debases her father; she shall be burned with fire.
21:10 The most exalted of the priests, upon whose head the anointing oil has been poured and who has been ordained to wear the special vestments, shall not dishevel his hair or rend his garments,
21:11 nor shall he go near any dead person. Not even for his father or mother may he thus become unclean;
21:12 nor shall he leave the sanctuary and profane the sanctuary of his God, for the consecration of the anointing oil of his God is upon him. I am the .
21:13 He shall marry only a woman who is a virgin.
21:14 He shall not marry a widow or a woman who has been divorced or one who has been debased by prostitution, but only a virgin, taken from his kindred, he shall marry,
21:15 so that he not profane his offspring among his kindred. I, the , make him holy. 
21:16 The said to Moses:
21:17 Say to Aaron: None of your descendants, throughout their generations, who has any blemish shall come forward to offer the food of his God.
21:18 Anyone who has any of the following blemishes may not come forward: he who is blind, or lame, or who has a split lip, or a limb too long,
21:19 or a broken leg or arm,
21:20 or who is a hunchback or dwarf or has a growth in the eye, or who is afflicted with sores, scabs, or crushed testicles.
21:21 No descendant of Aaron the priest who has any such blemish may draw near to offer the oblations of the ; on account of his blemish he may not draw near to offer the food of his God.
21:22 He may, however, eat the food of his God: of the most sacred as well as sacred offerings.
21:23 Only, he may not enter through the veil nor draw near to the altar on account of his blemish; he shall not profane my sacred precincts, for it is I, the , who make them holy.
21:24 Moses, therefore, told this to Aaron and his sons and to all the Israelites.
22:1 The said to Moses:
22:2 Tell Aaron and his sons to treat with respect the sacred offerings which the Israelites consecrate to me; otherwise they will profane my holy name. I am the .
22:3 Tell them: If any one of you, or of your descendants in any future generation, dares, while he is in a state of uncleanness, to draw near the sacred offerings which the Israelites consecrate to the , such a one shall be cut off from my presence. I am the .
22:4 No descendant of Aaron who is stricken with a scaly infection, or who suffers from a genital discharge, may eat of the sacred offerings, until he again becomes clean. Moreover, if anyone touches a person who has become unclean by contact with a corpse, or if anyone has had an emission of semen,
22:5 or if anyone touches any swarming creature whose uncleanness is contagious or any person whose uncleanness, of whatever kind it may be, is contagious—
22:6 the one who touches such as these shall be unclean until evening and may not eat of the sacred portions until he has first bathed his body in water.
22:7 Then, when the sun sets, he shall be clean. Only then may he eat of the sacred offerings, for they are his food.
22:8 He shall not make himself unclean by eating of any animal that has died of itself or has been killed by wild beasts. I am the .
22:9 They shall keep my charge so that they will not bear the punishment in this matter and die for their profanation. I am the who makes them holy.
22:10 Neither an unauthorized person nor a priests tenant or laborer may eat of any sacred offering.
22:11 But a slave whom a priest acquires by purchase or who is born in his house may eat of his food.
22:12 A priests daughter who is married to an unauthorized person may not eat of the sacred contributions.
22:13 But if a priests daughter is widowed or divorced and, having no children, returns to her fathers house, she may then eat of her fathers food as in her youth. No unauthorized person, however, may eat of it.
22:14 If such a one eats of a sacred offering through inadvertence, that person shall make restitution to the priest for the sacred offering, with an increment of one fifth of the amount.
22:15 The priests shall not allow the sacred offerings which the Israelites contribute to the to be profaned
22:16 nor make them incur a penalty when they eat their sacred offerings. For I, the , make them holy.
22:17 The said to Moses:
22:18 Speak to Aaron and his sons and to all the Israelites, and tell them: When anyone of the house of Israel, or any alien residing in Israel, who presents an offering, brings a burnt offering as a votive offering or as a voluntary offering to the ,
22:19 if it is to be acceptable for you, it must be an unblemished male of the herd, of the sheep or of the goats.
22:20 You shall not offer one that has any blemish, for such a one would not be acceptable on your behalf.
22:21 When anyone presents a communion sacrifice to the from the herd or the flock in fulfillment of a vow, or as a voluntary offering, if it is to find acceptance, it must be unblemished; it shall not have any blemish.
22:22 One that is blind or lame or maimed, or one that has running lesions or sores or scabs, you shall not offer to the ; do not put such an animal on the altar as an oblation to the .
22:23 An ox or a sheep that has a leg that is too long or is stunted you may indeed present as a voluntary offering, but it will not be acceptable as a votive offering.
22:24 One that has its testicles bruised or crushed or torn out or cut off you shall not offer to the . You shall neither do this in your own land
22:25 nor receive from a foreigner any such animals to offer up as the food of your God; since they are deformed or blemished, they will not be acceptable on your behalf.
22:26 The said to Moses:
22:27 When an ox or a lamb or a goat is born, it shall remain with its mother for seven days; only from the eighth day onward will it be acceptable, to be offered as an oblation to the .
22:28 You shall not slaughter an ox or a sheep on one and the same day with its young.
22:29 Whenever you offer a thanksgiving sacrifice to the , so offer it that it may be acceptable on your behalf;
22:30 it must be eaten on the same day; none of it shall be left over until morning. I am the .
22:31 Be careful to observe my commandments. I am the .
22:32 Do not profane my holy name, that in the midst of the Israelites I may be hallowed. I, the , make you holy,
22:33 who led you out of the land of Egypt to be your God. I am the .
23:1 The said to Moses:
23:2 Speak to the Israelites and tell them: The following are the festivals of the , which you shall declare holy days. These are my festivals:
23:3 For six days work may be done; but the seventh day is a sabbath of complete rest, a declared holy day; you shall do no work. It is the s sabbath wherever you dwell.
23:4 These are the festivals of the , holy days which you shall declare at their proper time.
23:5 The Passover of the falls on the fourteenth day of the first month, at the evening twilight.
23:6 The fifteenth day of this month is the s feast of Unleavened Bread. For seven days you shall eat unleavened bread.
23:7 On the first of these days you will have a declared holy day; you shall do no heavy work.
23:8 On each of the seven days you shall offer an oblation to the . Then on the seventh day you will have a declared holy day; you shall do no heavy work.
23:9 The said to Moses:
23:10 Speak to the Israelites and tell them: When you come into the land which I am giving you, and reap its harvest, you shall bring the first sheaf of your harvest to the priest,
23:11 who shall elevate the sheaf before the that it may be acceptable on your behalf. On the day after the sabbath the priest shall do this.
23:12 On this day, when your sheaf is elevated, you shall offer to the for a burnt offering an unblemished yearling lamb.
23:13 Its grain offering shall be two tenths of an ephah of bran flour mixed with oil, as a sweet-smelling oblation to the ; and its libation shall be a fourth of a hin of wine.
23:14 You shall not eat any bread or roasted grain or fresh kernels until this day, when you bring the offering for your God. This shall be a perpetual statute throughout your generations wherever you dwell.
23:15 Beginning with the day after the sabbath, the day on which you bring the sheaf for elevation, you shall count seven full weeks;
23:16 you shall count to the day after the seventh week, fifty days. Then you shall present a new grain offering to the .
23:17 For the elevated offering of your first-ripened fruits to the , you shall bring with you from wherever you live two loaves of bread made of two tenths of an ephah of bran flour and baked with leaven.
23:18 Besides the bread, you shall offer to the a burnt offering of seven unblemished yearling lambs, one bull of the herd, and two rams, along with their grain offering and libations, as a sweet-smelling oblation to the .
23:19 One male goat shall be sacrificed as a purification offering, and two yearling lambs as a communion sacrifice.
23:20 The priest shall elevate them—that is, the two lambs—with the bread of the first-ripened fruits as an elevated offering before the ; these shall be sacred to the and belong to the priest.
23:21 On this same day you shall make a proclamation: there shall be a declared holy day for you; no heavy work may be done. This shall be a perpetual statute through all your generations wherever you dwell.
23:22 When you reap the harvest of your land, you shall not be so thorough that you reap the field to its very edge, nor shall you gather the gleanings of your harvest. These things you shall leave for the poor and the alien. I, the , am your God.
23:23 The said to Moses:
23:24 Tell the Israelites: On the first day of the seventh month you will have a sabbath rest, with trumpet blasts as a reminder, a declared holy day;
23:25 you shall do no heavy work, and you shall offer an oblation to the .
23:26 The said to Moses:
23:27 Now the tenth day of this seventh month is the Day of Atonement. You will have a declared holy day. You shall humble yourselves and offer an oblation to the .
23:28 On this day you shall not do any work, because it is the Day of Atonement, when atonement is made for you before the , your God.
23:29 Those who do not humble themselves on this day shall be cut off from the people.
23:30 If anyone does any work on this day, I will remove that person from the midst of the people.
23:31 You shall do no work; this is a perpetual statute throughout your generations wherever you dwell;
23:32 it is a sabbath of complete rest for you. You shall humble yourselves. Beginning on the evening of the ninth of the month, you shall keep your sabbath from evening to evening.
23:33 The said to Moses:
23:34 Tell the Israelites: The fifteenth day of this seventh month is the s feast of Booths, which shall continue for seven days.
23:35 On the first day, a declared holy day, you shall do no heavy work.
23:36 For seven days you shall offer an oblation to the , and on the eighth day you will have a declared holy day. You shall offer an oblation to the . It is the festival closing. You shall do no heavy work.
23:37 These, therefore, are the festivals of the which you shall declare holy days, in order to offer as an oblation to the burnt offerings and grain offerings, sacrifices and libations, as prescribed for each day,
23:38 in addition to the s sabbaths, your donations, your various votive offerings, and the voluntary offerings that you present to the .
23:39 On the fifteenth day, then, of the seventh month, when you have gathered in the produce of the land, you shall celebrate the feast of the for a whole week. The first and the eighth day shall be days of rest.
23:40 On the first day you shall gather fruit of majestic trees, branches of palms, and boughs of leafy trees and valley willows. Then for a week you shall make merry before the , your God.
23:41 You shall keep this feast of the for one whole week in the year. By perpetual statute throughout your generations in the seventh month of the year, you shall keep it.
23:42 You shall dwell in booths for seven days; every native-born Israelite shall dwell in booths,
23:43 that your descendants may realize that, when I led the Israelites out of the land of Egypt, I made them dwell in booths. I, the , am your God.
23:44 Thus did Moses announce to the Israelites the festivals of the .
24:1 The said to Moses:
24:2 Order the Israelites to bring you clear oil of crushed olives for the light, so that you may keep the lamp burning regularly.
24:3 In the tent of meeting, outside the veil that hangs in front of the covenant, Aaron shall set up the lamp to burn before the regularly, from evening till morning, by a perpetual statute throughout your generations.
24:4 He shall set up the lamps on the pure gold menorah to burn regularly before the . 
24:5 You shall take bran flour and bake it into twelve cakes, using two tenths of an ephah of flour for each cake.
24:6 These you shall place in two piles, six in each pile, on the pure gold table before the .
24:7 With each pile put some pure frankincense, which shall serve as an oblation to the , a token of the bread offering.
24:8 Regularly on each sabbath day the bread shall be set out before the on behalf of the Israelites by an everlasting covenant.
24:9 It shall belong to Aaron and his sons, who must eat it in a sacred place, since it is most sacred, his as a perpetual due from the oblations to the . 
24:10 A man born of an Israelite mother and an Egyptian father went out among the Israelites, and in the camp a fight broke out between the son of the Israelite woman and an Israelite man.
24:11 The son of the Israelite woman uttered the s name in a curse and blasphemed. So he was brought to Moses—now his mothers name was Shelomith, daughter of Dibri, of the tribe of Dan—
24:12 and he was kept in custody till a decision from the should settle the case for them.
24:13 The then said to Moses:
24:14 Take the blasphemer outside the camp, and when all who heard him have laid their hands on his head, let the whole community stone him.
24:15 Tell the Israelites: Anyone who blasphemes God shall bear the penalty;
24:16 whoever utters the name of the in a curse shall be put to death. The whole community shall stone that person; alien and native-born alike must be put to death for uttering the s name in a curse.
24:17 Whoever takes the life of any human being shall be put to death;
24:18 whoever takes the life of an animal shall make restitution of another animal, life for a life.
24:19 Anyone who inflicts a permanent injury on his or her neighbor shall receive the same in return:
24:20 fracture for fracture, eye for eye, tooth for tooth. The same injury that one gives another shall be inflicted in return.
24:21 Whoever takes the life of an animal shall make restitution, but whoever takes a human life shall be put to death.
24:22 You shall have but one rule, for alien and native-born alike. I, the , am your God.
24:23 When Moses told this to the Israelites, they took the blasphemer outside the camp and stoned him; they did just as the commanded Moses.
25:1 The said to Moses on Mount Sinai:
25:2 Speak to the Israelites and tell them: When you enter the land that I am giving you, let the land, too, keep a sabbath for the .
25:3 For six years you may sow your field, and for six years prune your vineyard, gathering in their produce.
25:4 But during the seventh year the land shall have a sabbath of complete rest, a sabbath for the , when you may neither sow your field nor prune your vineyard.
25:5 The aftergrowth of your harvest you shall not reap, nor shall you pick the grapes of your untrimmed vines. It shall be a year of rest for the land.
25:6 While the land has its sabbath, all its produce will be food to eat for you yourself and for your male and female slave, for your laborer and the tenant who live with you,
25:7 and likewise for your livestock and for the wild animals on your land.
25:8 You shall count seven weeks of years—seven times seven years—such that the seven weeks of years amount to forty-nine years.
25:9 Then, on the tenth day of the seventh month let the rams horn resound; on this, the Day of Atonement, the rams horn blast shall resound throughout your land.
25:10 You shall treat this fiftieth year as sacred. You shall proclaim liberty in the land for all its inhabitants. It shall be a jubilee for you, when each of you shall return to your own property, each of you to your own family.
25:11 This fiftieth year is your year of jubilee; you shall not sow, nor shall you reap the aftergrowth or pick the untrimmed vines,
25:12 since this is the jubilee. It shall be sacred for you. You may only eat what the field yields of itself.
25:13 In this year of jubilee, then, each of you shall return to your own property.
25:14 Therefore, when you sell any land to your neighbor or buy any from your neighbor, do not deal unfairly with one another.
25:15 On the basis of the number of years since the last jubilee you shall purchase the land from your neighbor; and so also, on the basis of the number of years of harvest, that person shall sell it to you.
25:16 When the years are many, the price shall be so much the more; when the years are few, the price shall be so much the less. For it is really the number of harvests that the person sells you.
25:17 Do not deal unfairly with one another, then; but stand in fear of your God. I, the , am your God.
25:18 Observe my statutes and be careful to keep my ordinances, so that you will dwell securely in the land.
25:19 The land will yield its fruit and you will eat your fill, and live there securely.
25:20 And if you say, What shall we eat in the seventh year, if we do not sow or reap our crop?
25:21 I will command such a blessing for you in the sixth year that there will be crop enough for three years,
25:22 and when you sow in the eighth year, you will still be eating from the old crop; even into the ninth year, until the crop comes in, you will still be eating from the old crop. 
25:23 The land shall not be sold irrevocably; for the land is mine, and you are but resident aliens and under my authority.
25:24 Therefore, in every part of the country that you occupy, you must permit the land to be redeemed.
25:25 When one of your kindred is reduced to poverty and has to sell some property, that persons closest relative, who has the duty to redeem it, shall come and redeem what the relative has sold.
25:26 If, however, the person has no relative to redeem it, but later on acquires sufficient means to redeem it,
25:27 the person shall calculate the years since the sale, return the balance to the one to whom it was sold, and thus regain the property.
25:28 But if the person does not acquire sufficient means to buy back the land, what was sold shall remain in the possession of the purchaser until the year of the jubilee, when it must be released and returned to the original owner.
25:29 When someone sells a dwelling in a walled town, it can be redeemed up to a full year after its sale—the redemption period is one year.
25:30 But if such a house in a walled town has not been redeemed at the end of a full year, it shall belong irrevocably to the purchaser throughout the generations; it shall not be released in the jubilee.
25:31 However, houses in villages that are not encircled by walls shall be reckoned as part of the surrounding farm land; they may be redeemed, and in the jubilee they must be released.
25:32 In levitical cities the Levites shall always have the right to redeem the houses in the cities that are in their possession.
25:33 As for levitical property that goes unredeemed—houses sold in cities of their possession shall be released in the jubilee; for the houses in levitical cities are their possession in the midst of the Israelites.
25:34 Moreover, the pasture land belonging to their cities shall not be sold at all; it must always remain their possession.
25:35 When one of your kindred is reduced to poverty and becomes indebted to you, you shall support that person like a resident alien; let your kindred live with you.
25:36 Do not exact interest in advance or accrued interest, but out of fear of God let your kindred live with you.
25:37 Do not give your money at interest or your food at a profit.
25:38 I, the , am your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt to give you the land of Canaan and to be your God.
25:39 When your kindred with you, having been so reduced to poverty, sell themselves to you, do not make them work as slaves.
25:40 Rather, let them be like laborers or like your tenants, working with you until the jubilee year,
25:41 when, together with any children, they shall be released from your service and return to their family and to their ancestral property.
25:42 Since they are my servants, whom I brought out of the land of Egypt, they shall not sell themselves as slaves are sold.
25:43 Do not lord it over them harshly, but stand in fear of your God.
25:44 The male and female slaves that you possess—these you shall acquire from the nations round about you.
25:45 You may also acquire them from among the resident aliens who reside with you, and from their families who are with you, those whom they bore in your land. These you may possess,
25:46 and bequeath to your children as their hereditary possession forever. You may treat them as slaves. But none of you shall lord it harshly over any of your fellow Israelites.
25:47 When your kindred, having been so reduced to poverty, sell themselves to a resident alien who has become wealthy or to descendants of a resident aliens family,
25:48 even after having sold themselves, they still may be redeemed by one of their kindred,
25:49 by an uncle or cousin, or by some other relative from their family; or, having acquired the means, they may pay the redemption price themselves.
25:50 With the purchaser they shall compute the years from the sale to the jubilee, distributing the sale price over these years as though they had been hired as laborers.
25:51 The more years there are, the more of the sale price they shall pay back as the redemption price;
25:52 the fewer years there are before the jubilee year, the more they have as credit; in proportion to the years of service they shall pay the redemption price.
25:53 The tenant alien shall treat those who sold themselves as laborers hired on an annual basis, and the alien shall not lord it over them harshly before your very eyes.
25:54 And if they are not redeemed by these means, they shall nevertheless be released, together with any children, in the jubilee year.
25:55 For the Israelites belong to me as servants; they are my servants, whom I brought out of the land of Egypt, I, the , your God.
26:1 Do not make idols for yourselves. You shall not erect a carved image or a sacred stone for yourselves, nor shall you set up a carved stone for worship in your land; for I, the , am your God.
26:2 Keep my sabbaths, and reverence my sanctuary. I am the .
26:3 If you live in accordance with my statutes and are careful to observe my commandments,
26:4 I will give you your rains in due season, so that the land will yield its crops, and the trees their fruit;
26:5 your threshing will last till vintage time, and your vintage till the time for sowing, and you will eat your fill of food, and live securely in your land.
26:6 I will establish peace in the land, and you will lie down to rest with no one to cause you anxiety. I will rid the country of ravenous beasts, and no sword shall sweep across your land.
26:7 You will rout your enemies, and they shall fall before your sword.
26:8 Five of you will put a hundred of your foes to flight, and a hundred of you will put to flight ten thousand, till your enemies fall before your sword.
26:9 I will look with favor upon you, and make you fruitful and numerous, as I carry out my covenant with you.
26:10 You shall eat the oldest stored harvest, and have to discard it to make room for the new.
26:11 I will set my tabernacle in your midst, and will not loathe you.
26:12 Ever present in your midst, I will be your God, and you will be my people;
26:13 I, the , am your God, who brought you out of the land of Egypt to be their slaves no more, breaking the bars of your yoke and making you walk erect. 
26:14 But if you do not heed me and do not keep all these commandments,
26:15 if you reject my statutes and loathe my decrees, refusing to obey all my commandments and breaking my covenant,
26:16 then I, in turn, will do this to you: I will bring terror upon you—with consumption and fever to dim the eyes and sap the life. You will sow your seed in vain, for your enemies will consume the crop.
26:17 I will turn against you, and you will be beaten down before your enemies and your foes will lord it over you. You will flee though no one pursues you.
26:18 If even after this you do not obey me, I will increase the chastisement for your sins sevenfold,
26:19 to break your proud strength. I will make the sky above you as hard as iron, and your soil as hard as bronze,
26:20 so that your strength will be spent in vain; your land will bear no crops, and its trees no fruit.
26:21 If then you continue hostile, unwilling to obey me, I will multiply my blows sevenfold, as your sins deserve.
26:22 I will unleash wild beasts against you, to rob you of your children and wipe out your livestock, till your population dwindles away and your roads become deserted.
26:23 If, with all this, you still do not accept my discipline and continue hostile to me,
26:24 I, too, will continue to be hostile to you and I, for my part, will smite you for your sins sevenfold.
26:25 I will bring against you the sword, the avenger of my covenant. Though you then huddle together in your cities, I will send pestilence among you, till you are delivered to the enemy.
26:26 When I break your staff of bread, ten women will need but one oven for baking your bread, and they shall dole it out to you by weight; and though you eat, you shall not be satisfied.
26:27 If, despite all this, you disobey and continue hostile to me,
26:28 I will continue in my hostile rage toward you, and I myself will discipline you for your sins sevenfold,
26:29 till you begin to eat the flesh of your own sons and daughters.
26:30 I will demolish your high places, overthrow your incense stands, and cast your corpses upon the corpses of your idols. In my loathing of you,
26:31 I will lay waste your cities and desolate your sanctuaries, refusing your sweet-smelling offerings.
26:32 So devastated will I leave the land that your enemies who come to live there will stand aghast at the sight of it.
26:33 And you I will scatter among the nations at the point of my drawn sword, leaving your countryside desolate and your cities deserted.
26:34 Then shall the land, during the time it lies waste, make up its lost sabbaths, while you are in the land of your enemies; then shall the land have rest and make up for its sabbaths
26:35 during all the time that it lies desolate, enjoying the rest that you would not let it have on your sabbaths when you lived there.
26:36 Those of you who survive in the lands of their enemies, I will make so fainthearted that the sound of a driven leaf will pursue them, and they shall run as if from the sword, and fall though no one pursues them;
26:37 stumbling over one another as if to escape a sword, while no one is after them—so helpless will you be to take a stand against your foes!
26:38 You shall perish among the nations, swallowed up in your enemies country.
26:39 Those of you who survive will waste away in the lands of their enemies, for their own and their ancestors guilt.
26:40 They will confess their iniquity and the iniquity of their ancestors in their treachery against me and in their continued hostility toward me,
26:41 so that I, too, had to be hostile to them and bring them into their enemies land. Then, when their uncircumcised hearts are humbled and they make amends for their iniquity,
26:42 I will remember my covenant with Jacob, and also my covenant with Isaac; and also my covenant with Abraham I will remember. The land, too, I will remember.
26:43 The land will be forsaken by them, that in its desolation without them, it may make up its sabbaths, and that they, too, may make good the debt of their guilt for having spurned my decrees and loathed my statutes.
26:44 Yet even so, even while they are in their enemies land, I will not reject or loathe them to the point of wiping them out, thus making void my covenant with them; for I, the , am their God.
26:45 I will remember for them the covenant I made with their forebears, whom I brought out of the land of Egypt before the eyes of the nations, that I might be their God. I am the .
26:46 These are the statutes, decrees and laws which the established between himself and the Israelites through Moses on Mount Sinai.
27:1 The said to Moses:
27:2 Speak to the Israelites and tell them: When anyone makes a vow to the with respect to the value of a human being,
27:3 the value for males between the ages of twenty and sixty shall be fifty silver shekels, by the sanctuary shekel;
27:4 and for a female, the value shall be thirty shekels.
27:5 For persons between the ages of five and twenty, the value for a male shall be twenty shekels, and for a female, ten shekels.
27:6 For persons between the ages of one month and five years, the value for a male shall be five silver shekels, and for a female, three shekels.
27:7 For persons of sixty or more, for a male the value shall be fifteen shekels, and ten shekels for a female.
27:8 However, if the one who made the vow is too poor to meet the sum, the person must be set before the priest, who shall determine a value; the priest will do this in keeping with the means of the one who made the vow.
27:9 If the offering vowed to the is an animal that may be sacrificed, every such animal given to the becomes sacred.
27:10 The offerer shall not substitute or exchange another for it, either a worse or a better one. If the offerer exchanges one animal in place of another, both the original and its substitute shall become sacred.
27:11 If any unclean animal which is unfit for sacrifice to the is vowed, it must be set before the priest,
27:12 who shall determine its value in keeping with its good or bad qualities, and the value set by the priest shall stand.
27:13 If the offerer wishes to redeem the animal, the person shall pay one fifth more than this valuation.
27:14 When someone dedicates a house as sacred to the , the priest shall determine its value in keeping with its good or bad qualities, and the value set by the priest shall stand.
27:15 A person dedicating a house who then wishes to redeem it shall pay one fifth more than the price thus established, and then it will again belong to that individual.
27:16 If someone dedicates to the a portion of hereditary land, its valuation shall be made according to the amount of seed required to sow it, the acreage sown with a homer of barley seed being valued at fifty silver shekels.
27:17 If the dedication of a field is made at the beginning of a jubilee period, the full valuation shall hold;
27:18 but if it is some time after this, the priest shall estimate its money value according to the number of years left until the next jubilee year, with a corresponding reduction on the valuation.
27:19 A person dedicating a field who then wishes to redeem it shall pay one fifth more than the price thus established, and so reclaim it.
27:20 If, instead of redeeming such a field, one sells it to another, it may no longer be redeemed;
27:21 but at the jubilee it shall be released as sacred to the ; like a field that is put under the ban, it shall become priestly property.
27:22 If someone dedicates to the a field that was purchased and was not part of hereditary property,
27:23 the priest shall compute its value in proportion to the number of years until the next jubilee, and on the same day the person shall pay the price thus established, a sacred donation to the ;
27:24 at the jubilee the field shall revert to the hereditary owner of this land from whom it had been purchased.
27:25 Every valuation shall be made according to the standard of the sanctuary shekel. There are twenty gerahs to the shekel.
27:26 Note that a firstborn animal, which as such already belongs to the , may not be dedicated. Whether an ox or a sheep, it is the s.
27:27 But if it is an unclean animal, it may be redeemed by paying one fifth more than its value. If it is not redeemed, it shall be sold at its value.
27:28 Note, also, that any possession which someone puts under the ban for the , whether it is a human being, an animal, or a hereditary field, shall be neither sold nor redeemed; everything that is put under the ban becomes most holy to the .
27:29 All human beings that are put under the ban cannot be redeemed; they must be put to death.
27:30 All tithes of the land, whether in grain from the fields or in fruit from the trees, belong to the ; they are sacred to the .
27:31 If someone wishes to redeem any of the tithes, the person shall pay one fifth more than their value.
27:32 The tithes of the herd and the flock, every tenth animal that passes under the herdsmans rod, shall be sacred to the .
27:33 It shall not matter whether good ones or bad ones are thus chosen, and no exchange may be made. If any exchange is made, both the original animal and its substitute become sacred and cannot be redeemed.
27:34 These are the commandments which the gave Moses on Mount Sinai for the Israelites.
NUMBERS
1:1 In the second year after the Israelites departure from the land of Egypt, on the first day of the second month, the said to Moses at the tent of meeting in the wilderness of Sinai:
1:2 Take a census of the whole community of the Israelites, by clans and ancestral houses, registering by name each male individually.
1:3 You and Aaron shall enroll in companies all the men in Israel of twenty years or more who are fit for military service.
1:4 With you there shall be a man from each tribe, each the head of his ancestral house.
1:5 These are the names of those who are to assist you: from Reuben: Elizur, son of Shedeur;
1:6 from Simeon: Shelumiel, son of Zurishaddai;
1:7 from Judah: Nahshon, son of Amminadab;
1:8 from Issachar: Nethanel, son of Zuar;
1:9 from Zebulun: Eliab, son of Helon;
1:10 for the descendants of Joseph: from Ephraim: Elishama, son of Ammihud; and from Manasseh: Gamaliel, son of Pedahzur;
1:11 from Benjamin: Abidan, son of Gideoni;
1:12 from Dan: Ahiezer, son of Ammishaddai;
1:13 from Asher: Pagiel, son of Ochran;
1:14 from Gad: Eliasaph, son of Reuel;
1:15 from Naphtali: Ahira, son of Enan.
1:16 These were the elect of the community, leaders of their ancestral tribes, heads of the clans of Israel.
1:17 So Moses and Aaron took these men who had been designated by name,
1:18 and assembled the whole community on the first day of the second month. Every man of twenty years or more then registered individually his name and lineage according to clan and ancestral house,
1:19 as the had commanded Moses. So he enrolled them in the wilderness of Sinai.
1:20 Of the descendants of Reuben, the firstborn of Israel, registered individually by name and lineage according to their clans and ancestral houses, every male of twenty years or more, everyone fit for military service:
1:21 those enrolled from the tribe of Reuben were forty-six thousand five hundred.
1:22 Of the descendants of Simeon, registered individually by name and lineage according to their clans and ancestral houses, every male of twenty years or more, everyone fit for military service:
1:23 those enrolled from the tribe of Simeon were fifty-nine thousand three hundred.
1:24 Of the descendants of Gad, registered by name and lineage according to their clans and ancestral houses, every male of twenty years or more, everyone fit for military service:
1:25 those enrolled from the tribe of Gad were forty-five thousand six hundred and fifty.
1:26 Of the descendants of Judah, registered by name and lineage according to their clans and ancestral houses, every male of twenty years or more, everyone fit for military service:
1:27 those enrolled from the tribe of Judah were seventy-four thousand six hundred.
1:28 Of the descendants of Issachar, registered by name and lineage according to their clans and ancestral houses, every male of twenty years or more, everyone fit for military service:
1:29 those enrolled from the tribe of Issachar were fifty-four thousand four hundred.
1:30 Of the descendants of Zebulun, registered by name and lineage according to their clans and ancestral houses, every male of twenty years or more, everyone fit for military service:
1:31 those enrolled from the tribe of Zebulun were fifty-seven thousand four hundred.
1:32 Of the descendants of Joseph: Of the descendants of Ephraim, registered by name and lineage according to their clans and ancestral houses, every male of twenty years or more, everyone fit for military service:
1:33 those enrolled from the tribe of Ephraim were forty thousand five hundred.
1:34 Of the descendants of Manasseh, registered by name and lineage according to their clans and ancestral houses, every male of twenty years or more, everyone fit for military service:
1:35 those enrolled from the tribe of Manasseh were thirty-two thousand two hundred.
1:36 Of the descendants of Benjamin, registered by name and lineage according to their clans and ancestral houses, every male of twenty years or more, everyone fit for military service:
1:37 those enrolled from the tribe of Benjamin were thirty-five thousand four hundred.
1:38 Of the descendants of Dan, registered by name and lineage according to their clans and ancestral houses, every male of twenty years or more, everyone fit for military service:
1:39 those enrolled from the tribe of Dan were sixty-two thousand seven hundred.
1:40 Of the descendants of Asher, registered by name and lineage according to their clans and ancestral houses, every male of twenty years or more, everyone fit for military service:
1:41 those enrolled from the tribe of Asher were forty-one thousand five hundred.
1:42 Of the descendants of Naphtali, registered by name and lineage according to their clans and ancestral houses, every male of twenty years or more, everyone fit for military service:
1:43 those enrolled from the tribe of Naphtali were fifty-three thousand four hundred.
1:44 It was these who were enrolled, each according to his ancestral house, by Moses and Aaron and the twelve leaders of Israel.
1:45 The total enrollment of the Israelites of twenty years or more, according to their ancestral houses, everyone fit for military service in Israel—
1:46 the total enrollment was six hundred and three thousand, five hundred and fifty.
1:47 Now the Levites were not enrolled by their ancestral tribe with the others.
1:48 For the had told Moses,
1:49 The tribe of Levi alone you shall not enroll nor include in the census along with the other Israelites.
1:50 You are to give the Levites charge of the tabernacle of the covenant with all its equipment and all that belongs to it. It is they who shall carry the tabernacle with all its equipment and who shall be its ministers; and they shall camp all around the tabernacle.
1:51 When the tabernacle is to move on, the Levites shall take it down; when the tabernacle is to be pitched, it is the Levites who shall set it up. Any unauthorized person who comes near it shall be put to death.
1:52 The other Israelites shall camp according to their companies, each in their own divisional camps,
1:53 but the Levites shall camp around the tabernacle of the covenant to ensure that Gods wrath will not fall upon the Israelite community. The Levites shall keep guard over the tabernacle of the covenant.
1:54 The Israelites complied; they did just as the had commanded Moses.
2:1 The said to Moses and Aaron:
2:2 The Israelites shall camp, each in their own divisions, under the ensigns of their ancestral houses. They shall camp at some distance all around the tent of meeting.
