10:19 And the remnant of the trees in his forest will be so few, that any child can record them.
10:20 On that day The remnant of Israel, the survivors of the house of Jacob, will no more lean upon the one who struck them; But they will lean upon the , the Holy One of Israel, in truth.
10:21 A remnant will return, the remnant of Jacob, to the mighty God.
10:22 Though your people, O Israel, were like the sand of the sea, Only a remnant of them will return; their destruction is decreed, as overflowing justice demands.
10:23 For the Lord, the of hosts, is about to carry out the destruction decreed in the midst of the whole land.
10:24 Therefore thus says the Lord, the of hosts: My people, who dwell in Zion, do not fear the Assyrian, though he strikes you with a rod, and raises his staff against you as did the Egyptians.
10:25 For just a brief moment more, and my wrath shall be over, and my anger shall be set for their destruction.
10:26 Then the of hosts will raise against them a scourge such as struck Midian at the rock of Oreb; and he will raise his staff over the sea as he did in Egypt.
10:27 On that day, His burden shall be taken from your shoulder, and his yoke shattered from your neck. He has come up from Rimmon,
10:28 he has reached Aiath, passed through Migron, at Michmash he has stored his supplies.
10:29 He has crossed the ravine, at Geba he has camped for the night. Ramah trembles, Gibeah of Saul has fled.
10:30 Cry and shriek, Bath-Gallim! Hearken, Laishah! Answer her, Anathoth!
10:31 Madmenah is in flight, the inhabitants of Gebim seek refuge.
10:32 Even today he will halt at Nob, he will shake his fist at the mount of daughter Zion, the hill of Jerusalem!
10:33 Now the Lord, the of hosts, is about to lop off the boughs with terrible violence; The tall of stature shall be felled, and the lofty ones shall be brought low;
10:34 He shall hack down the forest thickets with an ax, and Lebanon in its splendor shall fall.
11:1 But a shoot shall sprout from the stump of Jesse, and from his roots a bud shall blossom.
11:2 The spirit of the shall rest upon him: a spirit of wisdom and of understanding, A spirit of counsel and of strength, a spirit of knowledge and of fear of the ,
11:3 and his delight shall be the fear of the . Not by appearance shall he judge, nor by hearsay shall he decide,
11:4 But he shall judge the poor with justice, and decide fairly for the lands afflicted. He shall strike the ruthless with the rod of his mouth, and with the breath of his lips he shall slay the wicked.
11:5 Justice shall be the band around his waist, and faithfulness a belt upon his hips.
11:6 Then the wolf shall be a guest of the lamb, and the leopard shall lie down with the young goat; The calf and the young lion shall browse together, with a little child to guide them.
11:7 The cow and the bear shall graze, together their young shall lie down; the lion shall eat hay like the ox.
11:8 The baby shall play by the vipers den, and the child lay his hand on the adders lair.
11:9 They shall not harm or destroy on all my holy mountain; for the earth shall be filled with knowledge of the , as water covers the sea.
11:10 On that day, The root of Jesse, set up as a signal for the peoples— Him the nations will seek out; his dwelling shall be glorious.
11:11 On that day, The Lord shall again take it in hand to reclaim the remnant of his people that is left from Assyria and Egypt, Pathros, Ethiopia, and Elam, Shinar, Hamath, and the isles of the sea.
11:12 He shall raise a signal to the nations and gather the outcasts of Israel; The dispersed of Judah he shall assemble from the four corners of the earth.
11:13 The envy of Ephraim shall pass away, and those hostile to Judah shall be cut off; Ephraim shall not envy Judah, and Judah shall not be hostile to Ephraim;
11:14 But they shall swoop down on the foothills of the Philistines to the west, together they shall plunder the people of the east; Edom and Moab shall be their possessions, and the Ammonites their subjects.
11:15 The shall dry up the tongue of the Sea of Egypt, and wave his hand over the Euphrates with his fierce wind, And divide it into seven streamlets, so that it can be crossed in sandals.
11:16 There shall be a highway for the remnant of his people that is left from Assyria, As there was for Israel when it came up from the land of Egypt.
12:1 On that day, you will say: I give you thanks, O ; though you have been angry with me, your anger has abated, and you have consoled me.
12:2 God indeed is my salvation; I am confident and unafraid. For the is my strength and my might, and he has been my salvation.
12:3 With joy you will draw water from the fountains of salvation,
12:4 And you will say on that day: give thanks to the , acclaim his name; Among the nations make known his deeds, proclaim how exalted is his name.
12:5 Sing praise to the for he has done glorious things; let this be known throughout all the earth.
12:6 Shout with exultation, City of Zion, for great in your midst is the Holy One of Israel!
13:1 An oracle concerning Babylon; a vision of Isaiah, son of Amoz.
13:2 Upon the bare mountains set up a signal; cry out to them, Beckon for them to enter the gates of the nobles.
13:3 I have commanded my consecrated ones, I have summoned my warriors, eager and bold to carry out my anger.
13:4 Listen! the rumble on the mountains: that of an immense throng! Listen! the noise of kingdoms, nations assembled! The of hosts is mustering an army for battle.
13:5 They come from a far-off country, and from the end of the heavens, The and the instruments of his wrath, to destroy all the land.
13:6 Howl, for the day of the is near; as destruction from the Almighty it comes.
13:7 Therefore all hands fall helpless, every human heart melts,
13:8 and they are terrified, Pangs and sorrows take hold of them, like a woman in labor they writhe; They look aghast at each other, their faces aflame.
13:9 Indeed, the day of the comes, cruel, with wrath and burning anger; To lay waste the land and destroy the sinners within it!
13:10 The stars of the heavens and their constellations will send forth no light; The sun will be dark at its rising, and the moon will not give its light.
13:11 Thus I will punish the world for its evil and the wicked for their guilt. I will put an end to the pride of the arrogant, the insolence of tyrants I will humble.
13:12 I will make mortals more rare than pure gold, human beings, than the gold of Ophir.
13:13 For this I will make the heavens tremble and the earth shall be shaken from its place, At the wrath of the of hosts on the day of his burning anger.
13:14 Like a hunted gazelle, or a flock that no one gathers, They shall turn each to their own people and flee each to their own land.
13:15 Everyone who is taken shall be run through; and everyone who is caught shall fall by the sword.
13:16 Their infants shall be dashed to pieces in their sight; their houses shall be plundered and their wives ravished.
13:17 I am stirring up against them the Medes, who think nothing of silver and take no delight in gold.
13:18 With their bows they shall shatter the young men, And the fruit of the womb they shall not spare, nor shall their eye take pity on children.
13:19 And Babylon, the jewel of kingdoms, the glory and pride of the Chaldeans, Shall become like Sodom and Gomorrah, overthrown by God.
13:20 It shall never be inhabited, nor dwelt in, from age to age; Arabians shall not pitch their tents there, nor shepherds rest their flocks there.
13:21 But desert demons shall rest there and owls shall fill the houses; There ostriches shall dwell, and satyrs shall dance.
13:22 Wild dogs shall dwell in its castles, and jackals in its luxurious palaces. Its time is near at hand and its days shall not be prolonged.
14:1 But the will take pity on Jacob and again choose Israel, and will settle them on their own land; foreigners will join them and attach themselves to the house of Jacob.
14:2 The nations will take them and bring them to their place, and the house of Israel will possess them as male and female slaves on the Lords land; they will take captive their captors and rule over their oppressors.
14:3 On the day when the gives you rest from your sorrow and turmoil, from the hard service with which you served,
14:4 you will take up this taunt-song against the king of Babylon: How the oppressor has come to an end! how the turmoil has ended!
14:5 The has broken the rod of the wicked, the staff of the tyrants
14:6 That struck the peoples in wrath with relentless blows; That ruled the nations in anger, with boundless persecution.
14:7 The whole earth rests peacefully, song breaks forth;
14:8 The very cypresses rejoice over you, the cedars of Lebanon: Now that you are laid to rest, no one comes to cut us down.
14:9 Below, Sheol is all astir preparing for your coming; Awakening the shades to greet you, all the leaders of the earth; Making all the kings of the nations rise from their thrones.
14:10 All of them speak out and say to you, You too have become weak like us, you are just like us!
14:11 Down to Sheol your pomp is brought, the sound of your harps. Maggots are the couch beneath you, worms your blanket.
14:12 How you have fallen from the heavens, O Morning Star, son of the dawn! How you have been cut down to the earth, you who conquered nations!
14:13 In your heart you said: I will scale the heavens; Above the stars of God I will set up my throne; I will take my seat on the Mount of Assembly, on the heights of Zaphon.
14:14 I will ascend above the tops of the clouds; I will be like the Most High!
14:15 No! Down to Sheol you will be brought to the depths of the pit!
14:16 When they see you they will stare, pondering over you: Is this the man who made the earth tremble, who shook kingdoms?
14:17 Who made the world a wilderness, razed its cities, and gave captives no release?
14:18 All the kings of the nations lie in glory, each in his own tomb;
14:19 But you are cast forth without burial, like loathsome carrion, Covered with the slain, with those struck by the sword, a trampled corpse, Going down to the very stones of the pit.
14:20 You will never be together with them in the grave, For you have ruined your land, you have slain your people! Let him never be named, that offshoot of evil!
14:21 Make ready to slaughter his sons for the guilt of their fathers; Lest they rise and possess the earth, and fill the breadth of the world with cities.
14:22 I will rise up against them, says the of hosts, and cut off from Babylon name and remnant, progeny and offspring, says the .
14:23 I will make it a haunt of hoot owls and a marshland; I will sweep it with the broom of destruction, oracle of the of hosts.
14:24 The of hosts has sworn: As I have resolved, so shall it be; As I have planned, so shall it stand:
14:25 To break the Assyrian in my land and trample him on my mountains; Then his yoke shall be removed from them, and his burden from their shoulder.
14:26 This is the plan proposed for the whole earth, and this the hand outstretched over all the nations.
14:27 The of hosts has planned; who can thwart him? His hand is stretched out; who can turn it back? 
14:28 In the year that King Ahaz died, there came this oracle:
14:29 Do not rejoice, Philistia, not one of you, that the rod which struck you is broken; For out of the serpents root shall come an adder, its offspring shall be a flying saraph.
14:30 In my pastures the poor shall graze, and the needy lie down in safety; But I will kill your root with famine that shall slay even your remnant.
14:31 Howl, O gate; cry out, O city! Philistia, all of you melts away! For there comes a smoke from the north, without a straggler in its ranks.
14:32 What will one answer the messengers of the nations? The has established Zion, and in her the afflicted of his people find refuge.
15:1 Oracle on Moab: Laid waste in a night, Ar of Moab is destroyed; Laid waste in a night, Kir of Moab is destroyed.
15:2 Daughter Dibon has gone up to the high places to weep; Over Nebo and over Medeba Moab is wailing. Every head is shaved, every beard sheared off.
15:3 In the streets they wear sackcloth, and on the rooftops; In the squares everyone wails, streaming with tears.
15:4 Heshbon and Elealeh cry out, they are heard as far as Jahaz. At this the loins of Moab tremble, his soul quivers within him;
15:5 My heart cries out for Moab, his fugitives reach Zoar, Eglath-shelishiyah: The ascent of Luhith they ascend weeping; On the way to Horonaim they utter rending cries;
15:6 The waters of Nimrim have become a waste, The grass is withered, new growth is gone, nothing is green.
15:7 So now whatever they have acquired or stored away they carry across the Wadi of the Poplars.
15:8 The cry has gone round the territory of Moab; As far as Eglaim his wailing, even at Beer-elim his wailing.
15:9 The waters of Dimon are filled with blood, but I will bring still more upon Dimon: Lions for those who are fleeing from Moab and for those who remain in the land!
16:1 Send them forth, hugging the earth like reptiles, from Sela across the desert, to the mount of daughter Zion.
16:2 Like flushed birds, like scattered nestlings, Are the daughters of Moab at the fords of the Arnon.
16:3 Offer counsel, take their part; at high noon make your shade like the night; Hide the outcasts, do not betray the fugitives.
16:4 Let the outcasts of Moab live with you, be their shelter from the destroyer. When there is an end to the oppressor, when destruction has ceased, and the marauders have vanished from the land,
16:5 A throne shall be set up in mercy, and on it shall sit in fidelity, in Davids tent, A judge upholding right, prompt to do justice.
16:6 We have heard of the pride of Moab, how very proud he is, Of his haughtiness, pride, and arrogance that his empty words do not match.
16:7 Therefore let Moab wail, let everyone wail for Moab; For the raisin cakes of Kir-hareseth let them sigh, stricken with grief.
16:8 The terraced slopes of Heshbon languish, the vines of Sibmah, Whose clusters once overpowered the lords of nations, Reaching as far as Jazer winding through the wilderness, Whose branches spread forth, crossing over the sea.
16:9 Therefore I weep with Jazer for the vines of Sibmah; I drench you with my tears, Heshbon and Elealeh; For on your summer fruits and harvests the battle cry has fallen.
16:10 From the orchards are taken away joy and gladness, In the vineyards there is no singing, no shout of joy; In the wine presses no one treads grapes, the vintage shout is stilled.
16:11 Therefore for Moab my heart moans like a lyre, my inmost being for Kir-hareseth.
16:12 When Moab wears himself out on the high places, and enters his sanctuary to pray, it shall avail him nothing.
16:13 That is the word the spoke against Moab in times past.
16:14 But now the speaks: In three years, like the years of a hired laborer, the glory of Moab shall be empty despite all its great multitude; and the remnant shall be very small and weak.
17:1 Oracle on Damascus: See, Damascus shall cease to be a city and become a pile of ruins;
17:2 Her cities shall be forever abandoned, for flocks to lie in undisturbed.
17:3 The fortress shall vanish from Ephraim and dominion from Damascus; The remnant of Aram shall become like the glory of the Israelites— oracle of the of hosts.
17:4 On that day The glory of Jacob shall fade, and his full body shall grow thin.
17:5 Like the reapers mere armful of stalks, when he gathers the standing grain; Or as when one gleans the ears in the Valley of Rephaim.
17:6 Only gleanings shall be left in it, as when an olive tree has been beaten— Two or three olives at the very top, four or five on its most fruitful branches— oracle of the , the God of Israel.
17:7 On that day people shall turn to their maker, their eyes shall look to the Holy One of Israel.
17:8 They shall not turn to the altars, the work of their hands, nor shall they look to what their fingers have made: the asherahs or the incense stands.
17:9 On that day his strong cities shall be like those abandoned by the Hivites and Amorites When faced with the Israelites; and there shall be desolation.
17:10 Truly, you have forgotten the God who saves you, the Rock, your refuge, you have not remembered. Therefore, though you plant plants for the Pleasant One, and set out cuttings for a foreign one,
17:11 Though you make them grow the day you plant them and make them blossom the morning you set them out, The harvest shall disappear on a day of sickness and incurable pain.
17:12 Ah! the roaring of many peoples— a roar like the roar of the seas! The thundering of nations— thunder like the thundering of mighty waters!
17:13 But God shall rebuke them, and they shall flee far away, Driven like chaff on the mountains before a wind, like tumbleweed before a storm.
17:14 At evening, there is terror, but before morning, they are gone! Such is the portion of those who despoil us, the lot of those who plunder us.
18:1 Ah! Land of buzzing insects, beyond the rivers of Ethiopia,
18:2 Sending ambassadors by sea, in papyrus boats on the waters! Go, swift messengers, to a nation tall and bronzed, To a people dreaded near and far, a nation strong and conquering, whose land is washed by rivers.
18:3 All you who inhabit the world, who dwell on earth, When the signal is raised on the mountain, look! When the trumpet blows, listen!
18:4 For thus says the to me: I will be quiet, looking on from where I dwell, Like the shimmering heat in sunshine, like a cloud of dew at harvest time.
18:5 Before the vintage, when the flowering has ended, and the blooms are succeeded by ripening grapes, Then comes the cutting of branches with pruning hooks, and the discarding of the lopped-off shoots.
18:6 They shall all be left to the mountain vultures and to the beasts of the earth; The vultures shall summer on them, all the beasts of the earth shall winter on them.
18:7 Then will gifts be brought to the of hosts—to the place of the name of the of hosts, Mount Zion—from a people tall and bronzed, from a people dreaded near and far, a nation strong and conquering, whose land is washed by rivers.
19:1 Oracle on Egypt: See, the is riding on a swift cloud on his way to Egypt; The idols of Egypt tremble before him, the hearts of the Egyptians melt within them.
19:2 I will stir up Egypt against Egypt: brother will war against brother, Neighbor against neighbor, city against city, kingdom against kingdom.
19:3 The courage of the Egyptians shall ebb away within them, and I will bring their counsel to nought; They shall consult idols and charmers, ghosts and clairvoyants.
19:4 I will deliver Egypt into the power of a cruel master, A harsh king who shall rule over them— oracle of the Lord, the of hosts.
19:5 The waters shall be drained from the sea, the river shall parch and dry up;
19:6 Its streams shall become foul, and the canals of Egypt shall dwindle and parch. Reeds and rushes shall wither away,
19:7 and bulrushes on the bank of the Nile; All the sown land along the Nile shall dry up and blow away, and be no more.
19:8 The fishermen shall mourn and lament, all who cast hook in the Nile; Those who spread their nets in the water shall pine away.
19:9 The linen-workers shall be disappointed, the combers and weavers shall turn pale;
19:10 The spinners shall be crushed, all the hired laborers shall be despondent.
19:11 Utter fools are the princes of Zoan! the wisest of Pharaohs advisers give stupid counsel. How can you say to Pharaoh, I am a descendant of wise men, of ancient kings?
19:12 Where then are your wise men? Let them tell you and make known What the of hosts has planned against Egypt.
19:13 The princes of Zoan have become fools, the princes of Memphis have been deceived. The chiefs of its tribes have led Egypt astray.
19:14 The has prepared among them a spirit of dizziness, And they have made Egypt stagger in whatever she does, as a drunkard staggers in his vomit.
19:15 Egypt shall accomplish nothing— neither head nor tail, palm branch nor reed, shall accomplish anything.
19:16 On that day the Egyptians shall be like women, trembling with fear, because of the of hosts shaking his fist at them.
19:17 And the land of Judah shall be a terror to the Egyptians. Every time they think of Judah, they shall stand in dread because of the plan the of hosts has in mind for them.
19:18 On that day there shall be five cities in the land of Egypt that speak the language of Canaan and swear by the of hosts; one shall be called City of the Sun.
19:19 On that day there shall be an altar to the at the center of Egypt, and a sacred pillar to the near its boundary.
19:20 This will be a sign and witness to the of hosts in the land of Egypt, so that when they cry out to the because of their oppressors, he will send them a savior to defend and deliver them.
19:21 The shall make himself known to Egypt, and the Egyptians shall know the in that day; they shall offer sacrifices and oblations, make vows to the and fulfill them.
19:22 Although the shall smite Egypt severely, he shall heal them; they shall turn to the and he shall be moved by their entreaty and heal them.
19:23 On that day there shall be a highway from Egypt to Assyria; the Assyrians shall enter Egypt, and the Egyptians enter Assyria, and the Egyptians shall worship with the Assyrians.
19:24 On that day Israel shall be a third party with Egypt and Assyria, a blessing in the midst of the earth,
19:25 when the of hosts gives this blessing: Blessed be my people Egypt, and the work of my hands Assyria, and my heritage, Israel.
20:1 In the year the general sent by Sargon, king of Assyria, came to Ashdod, fought against it, and captured it—
20:2 at that time the had spoken through Isaiah, the son of Amoz: Go and take off the sackcloth from your waist, and remove the sandals from your feet. This he did, walking naked and barefoot.
20:3 Then the said: Just as my servant Isaiah has gone naked and barefoot for three years as a sign and portent against Egypt and Ethiopia,
20:4 so shall the king of Assyria lead away captives from Egypt, and exiles from Ethiopia, young and old, naked and barefoot, with buttocks uncovered, the shame of Egypt.
20:5 They shall be dismayed and ashamed because of Ethiopia, their hope, and because of Egypt, their boast.
20:6 The inhabitants of this coastland shall say on that day, See what has happened to those we hoped in, to whom we fled for help and deliverance from the king of Assyria! What escape is there for us now?
21:1 Oracle on the wastelands by the sea: Like whirlwinds sweeping through the Negeb, it comes from the desert, from the fearful land.
21:2 A harsh vision has been announced to me: The traitor betrays, the despoiler spoils. Go up, O Elam; besiege, O Media; put an end to all its groaning!
21:3 Therefore my loins are filled with anguish, pangs have seized me like those of a woman in labor; I am too bewildered to hear, too dismayed to look.
21:4 My mind reels, shuddering assails me; The twilight I yearned for he has turned into dread.
21:5 They set the table, spread out the rugs; they eat, they drink. Rise up, O princes, oil the shield!
21:6 For thus my Lord said to me: Go, station a watchman, let him tell what he sees.
21:7 If he sees a chariot, a pair of horses, Someone riding a donkey, someone riding a camel, Then let him pay heed, very close heed.
21:8 Then the watchman cried, On the watchtower, my Lord, I stand constantly by day; And I stay at my post through all the watches of the night.
21:9 Here he comes— a single chariot, a pair of horses— He calls out and says, Fallen, fallen is Babylon! All the images of her gods are smashed to the ground!
21:10 To you, who have been threshed, beaten on my threshing floor, What I have heard from the of hosts, The God of Israel, I have announced to you.
21:11 Oracle on Dumah: They call to me from Seir, Watchman, how much longer the night? Watchman, how much longer the night?
21:12 The watchman replies, Morning has come, and again night. If you will ask, ask; come back again.
21:13 Oracle: in the steppe: In the thicket in the steppe you will spend the night, caravans of Dedanites.
21:14 Meet the thirsty, bring them water, inhabitants of the land of Tema, greet the fugitives with bread.
21:15 For they have fled from the sword, from the drawn sword; From the taut bow, from the thick of battle.
21:16 For thus the Lord has said to me: In another year, like the years of a hired laborer, all the glory of Kedar shall come to an end.
21:17 Few of Kedars stalwart archers shall remain, for the , the God of Israel, has spoken.
22:1 Oracle on the Valley of Vision: What is the matter with you now, that you have gone up, all of you, to the housetops,
22:2 You who were full of noise, tumultuous city, exultant town? Your slain are not slain with the sword, nor killed in battle.
22:3 All your leaders fled away together, they were captured without use of bow; All who were found were captured together, though they had fled afar off.
22:4 That is why I say: Turn away from me, let me weep bitterly; Do not try to comfort me for the ruin of the daughter of my people.
22:5 It is a day of panic, rout and confusion, from the Lord, the of hosts, in the Valley of Vision Walls crash; a cry for help to the mountains.
22:6 Elam takes up the quiver, Aram mounts the horses and Kir uncovers the shields.
22:7 Your choice valleys are filled with chariots, horses are posted at the gates—
22:8 and shelter over Judah is removed. On that day you looked to the weapons in the House of the Forest;
22:9 you saw that the breaches in the City of David were many; you collected the water of the lower pool.
22:10 You numbered the houses of Jerusalem, tearing some down to strengthen the wall;
22:11 you made a reservoir between the two walls for the water of the old pool. But you did not look to the citys Maker, nor consider the one who fashioned it long ago.
22:12 On that day the Lord, the of hosts, called For weeping and mourning, for shaving the head and wearing sackcloth.
22:13 But look! instead, there was celebration and joy, slaughtering cattle and butchering sheep, Eating meat and drinking wine: Eat and drink, for tomorrow we die!
22:14 This message was revealed in my hearing from the of hosts: This iniquity will not be forgiven you until you die, says the Lord, the of hosts.
22:15 Thus says the Lord, the of hosts: Up, go to that official, Shebna, master of the palace,
22:16 What have you here? Whom have you here, that you have hewn for yourself a tomb here, Hewing a tomb on high, carving a resting place in the rock?
22:17 The shall hurl you down headlong, mortal man! He shall grip you firmly,
22:18 And roll you up and toss you like a ball into a broad land. There you will die, there with the chariots you glory in, you disgrace to your masters house!
22:19 I will thrust you from your office and pull you down from your station.
22:20 On that day I will summon my servant Eliakim, son of Hilkiah;
22:21 I will clothe him with your robe, gird him with your sash, confer on him your authority. He shall be a father to the inhabitants of Jerusalem, and to the house of Judah.
22:22 I will place the key of the House of David on his shoulder; what he opens, no one will shut, what he shuts, no one will open.
22:23 I will fix him as a peg in a firm place, a seat of honor for his ancestral house;
22:24 On him shall hang all the glory of his ancestral house: descendants and offspring, all the little dishes, from bowls to jugs.
22:25 On that day, says the of hosts, the peg fixed in a firm place shall give way, break off and fall, and the weight that hung on it shall be done away with; for the has spoken.
23:1 Oracle on Tyre: Wail, ships of Tarshish, for your port is destroyed; From the land of the Kittim the news reaches them.
23:2 Silence! you who dwell on the coast, you merchants of Sidon, Whose messengers crossed the sea
23:3 over the deep waters, Whose revenue was the grain of Shihor, the harvest of the Nile, you who were the merchant among the nations.
23:4 Be ashamed, Sidon, fortress on the sea, for the sea has spoken, I have not been in labor, nor given birth, nor raised young men, nor reared young women.
23:5 When the report reaches Egypt they shall be in anguish at the report about Tyre.
23:6 Pass over to Tarshish, wail, you who dwell on the coast!
23:7 Is this your exultant city, whose origin is from old, Whose feet have taken her to dwell in distant lands?
23:8 Who has planned such a thing against Tyre, the bestower of crowns, Whose merchants are princes, whose traders are the earths honored men?
23:9 The of hosts has planned it, to disgrace the height of all beauty, to degrade all the honored of the earth.
23:10 Cross to your own land, ship of Tarshish; the harbor is no more.
23:11 His hand he stretches out over the sea, he shakes kingdoms; The commanded the destruction of Canaans strongholds:
23:12 Crushed, you shall exult no more, virgin daughter Sidon. Arise, pass over to the Kittim, even there you shall find no rest.
23:13 Look at the land of the Chaldeans, the people that has ceased to be. Assyria founded it for ships, raised its towers, Only to tear down its palaces, and turn it into a ruin.
23:14 Lament, ships of Tarshish, for your stronghold is destroyed.
23:15 On that day, Tyre shall be forgotten for seventy years, the lifetime of one king. At the end of seventy years, the song about the prostitute will be Tyres song:
23:16 Take a harp, go about the city, forgotten prostitute; Pluck the strings skillfully, sing many songs, that you may be remembered.
23:17 At the end of the seventy years the shall visit Tyre. She shall return to her hire and serve as prostitute with all the worlds kingdoms on the face of the earth.
23:18 But her merchandise and her hire shall be sacred to the . It shall not be stored up or laid away; instead, her merchandise shall belong to those who dwell before the , to eat their fill and clothe themselves in choice attire.
24:1 See! The is about to empty the earth and lay it waste; he will twist its surface, and scatter its inhabitants:
24:2 People and priest shall fare alike: servant and master, Maid and mistress, buyer and seller, Lender and borrower, creditor and debtor.
24:3 The earth shall be utterly laid waste, utterly stripped, for the has decreed this word.
24:4 The earth mourns and fades, the world languishes and fades; both heaven and earth languish.
24:5 The earth is polluted because of its inhabitants, for they have transgressed laws, violated statutes, broken the ancient covenant.
24:6 Therefore a curse devours the earth, and its inhabitants pay for their guilt; Therefore they who dwell on earth have dwindled, and only a few are left.
24:7 The new wine mourns, the vine languishes, all the merry-hearted groan.
24:8 Stilled are the cheerful timbrels, ended the shouts of the jubilant, stilled the cheerful harp.
24:9 They no longer drink wine and sing; strong brew is bitter to those who drink it.
24:10 Broken down is the city of chaos, every house is shut against entry.
24:11 In the streets they cry out for lack of wine; all joy has grown dim, cheer is exiled from the land.
24:12 In the city nothing remains but desolation, gates battered into ruins.
24:13 For thus it shall be in the midst of the earth, among the peoples, As when an olive tree has been beaten, as with a gleaning when the vintage is done.
24:14 These shall lift up their voice, they shall sing for joy in the majesty of the , they shall shout from the western sea:
24:15 Therefore, in the east give glory to the ! In the coastlands of the sea, to the name of the , the God of Israel!
24:16 From the end of the earth we hear songs: Splendor to the Just One! But I said, I am wasted, wasted away. Woe is me! The traitors betray; with treachery have the traitors betrayed!
24:17 Terror, pit, and trap for you, inhabitant of the earth!
24:18 One who flees at the sound of terror will fall into the pit; One who climbs out of the pit will be caught in the trap. For the windows on high are open and the foundations of the earth shake.
24:19 The earth will burst asunder, the earth will be shaken apart, the earth will be convulsed.
24:20 The earth will reel like a drunkard, sway like a hut; Its rebellion will weigh it down; it will fall, never to rise again.
24:21 On that day the will punish the host of the heavens in the heavens, and the kings of the earth on the earth.
24:22 They will be gathered together like prisoners into a pit; They will be shut up in a dungeon, and after many days they will be punished.
24:23 Then the moon will blush and the sun be ashamed, For the of hosts will reign on Mount Zion and in Jerusalem, glorious in the sight of the elders.
25:1 O , you are my God, I extol you, I praise your name; For you have carried out your wonderful plans of old, faithful and true.
25:2 For you have made the city a heap, the fortified city a ruin, The castle of the insolent, a city no more, not ever to be rebuilt.
25:3 Therefore a strong people will honor you, ruthless nations will fear you.
25:4 For you have been a refuge to the poor, a refuge to the needy in their distress; Shelter from the rain, shade from the heat. When the blast of the ruthless was like a winter rain,
25:5 the roar of strangers like heat in the desert, You subdued the heat with the shade of a cloud, the rain of the tyrants was vanquished.
25:6 On this mountain the of hosts will provide for all peoples A feast of rich food and choice wines, juicy, rich food and pure, choice wines.
25:7 On this mountain he will destroy the veil that veils all peoples, The web that is woven over all nations.
25:8 He will destroy death forever. The Lord will wipe away the tears from all faces; The reproach of his people he will remove from the whole earth; for the has spoken.
25:9 On that day it will be said: Indeed, this is our God; we looked to him, and he saved us! This is the to whom we looked; let us rejoice and be glad that he has saved us!
25:10 For the hand of the will rest on this mountain, but Moab will be trodden down as straw is trodden down in the mire.
25:11 He will spread out his hands in its midst, as a swimmer spreads out his hands to swim; His pride will be brought low despite his strokes.
25:12 The high-walled fortress he will raze, bringing it low, leveling it to the ground, to the very dust.
26:1 On that day this song shall be sung in the land of Judah: A strong city have we; he sets up victory as our walls and ramparts.
26:2 Open up the gates that a righteous nation may enter, one that keeps faith.
26:3 With firm purpose you maintain peace; in peace, because of our trust in you.
26:4 Trust in the forever! For the is an eternal Rock.
26:5 He humbles those who dwell on high, the lofty city he brings down, Brings it down to the ground, levels it to the dust.
26:6 The feet of the needy trample on it— the feet of the poor.
26:7 The way of the just is smooth; the path of the just you make level.
26:8 The course of your judgments, , we await; your name and your memory are the desire of our souls.
26:9 My soul yearns for you at night, yes, my spirit within me seeks you at dawn; When your judgment comes upon the earth, the worlds inhabitants learn justice.
26:10 The wicked, when spared, do not learn justice; in an upright land they act perversely, and do not see the majesty of the .
26:11 , your hand is raised high, but they do not perceive it; Let them be put to shame when they see your zeal for your people: let the fire prepared for your enemies consume them.
26:12 , you will decree peace for us, for you have accomplished all we have done.
26:13 , our God, lords other than you have ruled us; only because of you can we call upon your name.
26:14 Dead they are, they cannot live, shades that cannot rise; Indeed, you have punished and destroyed them, and wiped out all memory of them.
26:15 You have increased the nation, , you have increased the nation, have added to your glory, you have extended far all the boundaries of the land.
26:16 , oppressed by your punishment, we cried out in anguish under your discipline.
26:17 As a woman about to give birth writhes and cries out in pain, so were we before you, .
26:18 We conceived and writhed in pain, giving birth only to wind; Salvation we have not achieved for the earth, no inhabitants for the world were born.
26:19 But your dead shall live, their corpses shall rise! Awake and sing, you who lie in the dust! For your dew is a dew of light, and you cause the land of shades to give birth.
26:20 Go, my people, enter your chambers, and close the doors behind you; Hide yourselves for a brief moment, until the wrath is past.
26:21 See, the goes forth from his place, to punish the wickedness of the earths inhabitants; The earth will reveal the blood shed upon it, and no longer conceal the slain.
27:1 On that day, The will punish with his sword that is cruel, great, and strong, Leviathan the fleeing serpent, Leviathan the coiled serpent; he will slay the dragon in the sea.
27:2 On that day— The pleasant vineyard, sing about it!
27:3 I, the , am its keeper, I water it every moment; Lest anyone harm it, night and day I guard it.
27:4 I am not angry. But if I were to find briers and thorns, In battle I would march against it; I would burn it all.
27:5 But if it holds fast to my refuge, it shall have peace with me; it shall have peace with me.
27:6 In days to come Jacob shall take root, Israel shall sprout and blossom, covering all the world with fruit.
27:7 Was he smitten as his smiter was smitten? Was he slain as his slayer was slain?
27:8 Driving out and expelling, he struggled against it, carrying it off with his cruel wind on a day of storm.
27:9 This, then, shall be the expiation of Jacobs guilt, this the result of removing his sin: He shall pulverize all the stones of the altars like pieces of chalk; no asherahs or incense altars shall stand.
27:10 For the fortified city shall be desolate, an abandoned pasture, a forsaken wilderness; There calves shall graze, there they shall lie down, and consume its branches.
27:11 When its boughs wither, they shall be broken off; and women shall come to kindle fires with them. For this is not an understanding people; therefore their maker shall not spare them; their creator shall not be gracious to them.
27:12 On that day, The shall beat out grain from the channel of the Euphrates to the Wadi of Egypt, and you shall be gleaned one by one, children of Israel.
27:13 On that day, A great trumpet shall blow, and the lost in the land of Assyria and the outcasts in the land of Egypt Shall come and worship the on the holy mountain, in Jerusalem.
28:1 Ah! majestic garland of the drunkards of Ephraim, Fading blooms of his glorious beauty, at the head of the fertile valley, upon those stupefied with wine.
28:2 See, the has a strong one, a mighty one, who, like an onslaught of hail, a destructive storm, Like a flood of water, great and overflowing, levels to the ground with violence;
28:3 With feet that will trample the majestic garland of the drunkards of Ephraim.
28:4 The fading blooms of his glorious beauty at the head of the fertile valley Will be like an early fig before summer: whoever sees it, swallows it as soon as it is in hand.
28:5 On that day the of hosts will be a glorious crown And a brilliant diadem for the remnant of his people,
28:6 A spirit of judgment for the one who sits in judgment, And strength for those who turn back the battle at the gate.
28:7 But these also stagger from wine and stumble from strong drink: Priest and prophet stagger from strong drink, overpowered by wine; They are confused by strong drink, they stagger in their visions, they totter when giving judgment.
28:8 Yes, all the tables are covered with vomit, with filth, and no place left clean.
28:9 To whom would he impart knowledge? To whom would he convey the message? To those just weaned from milk, those weaned from the breast?
28:10 For he says, Command on command, command on command, rule on rule, rule on rule, here a little, there a little!
28:11 Yes, with stammering lips and in a strange language he will speak to this people,
28:12 to whom he said: This is the resting place, give rest to the weary; And this is the place of repose— but they refused to hear.
28:13 So for them the word of the shall be: Command on command, command on command, Rule on rule, rule on rule, here a little, there a little! So that when they walk, they shall stumble backward, broken, ensnared, and captured.
28:14 Therefore, hear the word of the , you scoffers, who rule this people in Jerusalem:
28:15 You have declared, We have made a covenant with death, with Sheol we have made a pact; When the raging flood passes through, it will not reach us; For we have made lies our refuge, and in falsehood we have found a hiding place,—
28:16 Therefore, thus says the Lord : See, I am laying a stone in Zion, a stone that has been tested, A precious cornerstone as a sure foundation; whoever puts faith in it will not waver.
28:17 I will make judgment a measuring line, and justice a level.— Hail shall sweep away the refuge of lies, and waters shall flood the hiding place.
28:18 Your covenant with death shall be canceled and your pact with Sheol shall not stand. When the raging flood passes through, you shall be beaten down by it.
28:19 Whenever it passes, it shall seize you; morning after morning it shall pass, by day and by night. Sheer terror to impart the message!
28:20 For the bed shall be too short to stretch out in, and the cover too narrow to wrap in.
28:21 For the shall rise up as on Mount Perazim, bestir himself as in the Valley of Gibeon, To carry out his work—strange his work! to perform his deed—alien his deed!
28:22 Now, cease scoffing, lest your bonds be tightened, For I have heard a decree of destruction from the Lord, the of hosts, for the whole land.
28:23 Give ear and hear my voice, pay attention and hear my word:
28:24 Is the plowman forever plowing in order to sow, always loosening and harrowing the field?
28:25 When he has leveled the surface, does he not scatter caraway and sow cumin, Put in wheat and barley, with spelt as its border?
28:26 His God has taught him this rule, he has instructed him.
28:27 For caraway is not threshed with a sledge, nor does a cartwheel roll over cumin. But caraway is beaten out with a staff, and cumin with a rod.
28:28 Grain is crushed for bread, but not forever; though he thresh it thoroughly, and drive his cartwheel and horses over it, he does not pulverize it.
28:29 This too comes from the of hosts; wonderful is his counsel and great his wisdom.
29:1 Ah! Ariel, Ariel, city where David encamped! Let year follow year, and feast follow feast,
29:2 But I will bring distress upon Ariel, and there will be mourning and moaning. You shall be to me like Ariel:
29:3 I will encamp like David against you; I will circle you with outposts and set up siege works against you.
29:4 You shall speak from beneath the earth, and from the dust below, your words shall come. Your voice shall be that of a ghost from the earth, and your words shall whisper from the dust.
29:5 The horde of your arrogant shall be like fine dust, a horde of tyrants like flying chaff. Then suddenly, in an instant,
29:6 you shall be visited by the of hosts, With thunder, earthquake, and great noise, whirlwind, storm, and the flame of consuming fire.
29:7 Then like a dream, a vision of the night, Shall be the horde of all the nations who make war against Ariel: All the outposts, the siege works against it, all who distress it.
29:8 As when a hungry man dreams he is eating and awakens with an empty stomach, Or when a thirsty man dreams he is drinking and awakens faint, his throat parched, So shall the horde of all the nations be, who make war against Mount Zion.
29:9 Stupefy yourselves and stay stupid; blind yourselves and stay blind! You who are drunk, but not from wine, who stagger, but not from strong drink!
29:10 For the has poured out on you a spirit of deep sleep. He has shut your eyes (the prophets) and covered your heads (the seers).
29:11 For you the vision of all this has become like the words of a sealed scroll. When it is handed to one who can read, with the request, Read this, the reply is, I cannot, because it is sealed.
29:12 When the scroll is handed to one who cannot read, with the request, Read this, the reply is, I cannot read.
29:13 The Lord said: Since this people draws near with words only and honors me with their lips alone, though their hearts are far from me, And fear of me has become mere precept of human teaching,
29:14 Therefore I will again deal with this people in surprising and wondrous fashion: The wisdom of the wise shall perish, the prudence of the prudent shall vanish.
29:15 Ah! You who would hide a plan too deep for the ! Who work in the dark, saying, Who sees us, who knows us?
29:16 Your perversity is as though the potter were taken to be the clay: As though what is made should say of its maker, He did not make me! Or the vessel should say of the potter, He does not understand.
29:17 Surely, in a very little while, Lebanon shall be changed into an orchard, and the orchard be considered a forest!
29:18 On that day the deaf shall hear the words of a scroll; And out of gloom and darkness, the eyes of the blind shall see.
29:19 The lowly shall again find joy in the , the poorest rejoice in the Holy One of Israel.
29:20 For the tyrant shall be no more, the scoffer shall cease to be; All who are ready for evil shall be cut off,
29:21 those who condemn with a mere word, Who ensnare the defender at the gate, and leave the just with an empty claim.
29:22 Therefore thus says the , the God of the house of Jacob, who redeemed Abraham: No longer shall Jacob be ashamed, no longer shall his face grow pale.
29:23 For when his children see the work of my hands in his midst, They shall sanctify my name; they shall sanctify the Holy One of Jacob, be in awe of the God of Israel.
29:24 Those who err in spirit shall acquire understanding, those who find fault shall receive instruction.
30:1 Ah! Rebellious children, oracle of the , Who carry out a plan that is not mine, who make an alliance I did not inspire, thus adding sin upon sin;
30:2 They go down to Egypt, without asking my counsel, To seek strength in Pharaohs protection and take refuge in Egypts shadow.
30:3 Pharaohs protection shall become your shame, refuge in Egypts shadow your disgrace.
30:4 When his princes are at Zoan and his messengers reach Hanes,
30:5 All shall be ashamed of a people that gain them nothing, Neither help nor benefit, but only shame and reproach.
30:6 Oracle on the Beasts of the Negeb. Through the distressed and troubled land of the lioness and roaring lion, of the viper and flying saraph, They carry their riches on the backs of donkeys and their treasures on the humps of camels To a people good for nothing,
30:7 to Egypt whose help is futile and vain. Therefore I call her Rahab Sit-still.
30:8 Now come, write it on a tablet they can keep, inscribe it on a scroll; That in time to come it may be an eternal witness.
30:9 For this is a rebellious people, deceitful children, Children who refuse to listen to the instruction of the ;
30:10 Who say to the seers, Do not see; to the prophets, Do not prophesy truth for us; speak smooth things to us, see visions that deceive!
30:11 Turn aside from the way! Get out of the path! Let us hear no more of the Holy One of Israel!
30:12 Therefore, thus says the Holy One of Israel: Because you reject this word, And put your trust in oppression and deceit, and depend on them,
30:13 This iniquity of yours shall be like a descending rift Bulging out in a high wall whose crash comes suddenly, in an instant,
30:14 Crashing like a potters jar smashed beyond rescue, And among its fragments cannot be found a sherd to scoop fire from the hearth or dip water from the cistern.
30:15 For thus said the Lord , the Holy One of Israel: By waiting and by calm you shall be saved, in quiet and in trust shall be your strength. But this you did not will.
30:16 No, you said, Upon horses we will flee. Very well, you shall flee! Upon swift steeds we will ride. Very well, swift shall be your pursuers!
30:17 A thousand shall tremble at the threat of one— if five threaten, you shall flee. You will then be left like a flagstaff on a mountaintop, like a flag on a hill.
30:18 Truly, the is waiting to be gracious to you, truly, he shall rise to show you mercy; For the is a God of justice: happy are all who wait for him!
30:19 Yes, people of Zion, dwelling in Jerusalem, you shall no longer weep; He will be most gracious to you when you cry out; as soon as he hears he will answer you.
30:20 The Lord will give you bread in adversity and water in affliction. No longer will your Teacher hide himself, but with your own eyes you shall see your Teacher,
30:21 And your ears shall hear a word behind you: This is the way; walk in it, when you would turn to the right or the left.
30:22 You shall defile your silver-plated idols and your gold-covered images; You shall throw them away like filthy rags, you shall say, Get out!
30:23 He will give rain for the seed you sow in the ground, And the bread that the soil produces will be rich and abundant. On that day your cattle will graze in broad meadows;
30:24 The oxen and the donkeys that till the ground will eat silage tossed to them with shovel and pitchfork.
30:25 Upon every high mountain and lofty hill there will be streams of running water. On the day of the great slaughter, when the towers fall,
30:26 The light of the moon will be like the light of the sun, and the light of the sun will be seven times greater, like the light of seven days, On the day the binds up the wounds of his people and heals the bruises left by his blows.
30:27 See, the name of the is coming from afar, burning with anger, heavy with threat, His lips filled with fury, tongue like a consuming fire,
30:28 Breath like an overflowing torrent that reaches up to the neck! He will winnow the nations with a destructive winnowing and bridle the jaws of the peoples to send them astray.
30:29 For you, there will be singing as on a night when a feast is observed, And joy of heart as when one marches along with a flute Going to the mountain of the , to the Rock of Israel.
30:30 The will make his glorious voice heard, and reveal his arm coming down In raging fury and flame of consuming fire, in tempest, and rainstorm, and hail.
30:31 For at the voice of the , Assyria will be shattered, as he strikes with the rod;
30:32 And every sweep of the rod of his punishment, which the will bring down on him, Will be accompanied by timbrels and lyres, while he wages war against him.
30:33 For his tophet has long been ready, truly it is prepared for the king; His firepit made both deep and wide, with fire and firewood in abundance, And the breath of the , like a stream of sulfur, setting it afire.
31:1 Ah! Those who go down to Egypt for help, who rely on horses; Who put their trust in chariots because of their number, and in horsemen because of their combined power, But look not to the Holy One of Israel nor seek the !
31:2 Yet he too is wise and will bring disaster; he will not turn from his threats. He will rise up against the house of the wicked and against those who help evildoers.
31:3 The Egyptians are human beings, not God, their horses flesh, not spirit; When the stretches forth his hand, the helper shall stumble, the one helped shall fall, and both of them shall perish together.
31:4 For thus says the to me: As a lion or its young growling over the prey, With a band of shepherds assembled against it, Is neither dismayed by their shouts nor cowed by their noise, So shall the of hosts come down to wage war upon Mount Zion, upon its height.
31:5 Like hovering birds, so the of hosts shall shield Jerusalem, To shield and deliver, to spare and rescue.
31:6 Return, O Israelites, to him whom you have utterly deserted.
31:7 On that day each one of you shall reject his idols of silver and gold, which your hands have made.
31:8 Assyria shall fall by a sword, not wielded by human being, no mortal sword shall devour him; He shall flee before the sword, and his young men shall be impressed as laborers.
31:9 He shall rush past his crag in panic, and his princes desert the standard in terror, Says the who has a fire in Zion and a furnace in Jerusalem.
32:1 See, a king will reign justly and princes will rule rightly.
32:2 Each of them will be like a shelter from the wind, a refuge from the rain. They will be like streams of water in a dry country, like the shade of a great rock in a parched land.
32:3 The eyes of those who see will not be closed; the ears of those who hear will be attentive.
32:4 The hasty of heart shall take thought to know, and tongues of stutterers shall speak readily and clearly.
32:5 No more will the fool be called noble, nor the deceiver be considered honorable.
32:6 For the fool speaks folly, his heart plans evil: Godless actions, perverse speech against the , Letting the hungry go empty and the thirsty without drink.
32:7 The deceits of the deceiver are evil, he plans devious schemes: To ruin the poor with lies, and the needy when they plead their case.
32:8 But the noble plan noble deeds, and in noble deeds they persist.
32:9 You women so complacent, rise up and hear my voice, daughters so confident, give heed to my words.
32:10 In a little more than a year your confidence will be shaken; For the vintage will fail, no fruit harvest will come in.
32:11 Tremble, you who are so complacent! Shudder, you who are so confident! Strip yourselves bare, with only a loincloth for cover.
32:12 Beat your breasts for the pleasant fields, for the fruitful vine;
32:13 For the soil of my people, overgrown with thorns and briers; For all the joyful houses, the exultant city.
32:14 The castle will be forsaken, the noisy city deserted; Citadel and tower will become wasteland forever, the joy of wild donkeys, the pasture of flocks;
32:15 Until the spirit from on high is poured out on us. And the wilderness becomes a garden land and the garden land seems as common as forest.
32:16 Then judgment will dwell in the wilderness and justice abide in the garden land.
32:17 The work of justice will be peace; the effect of justice, calm and security forever.
32:18 My people will live in peaceful country, in secure dwellings and quiet resting places.
32:19 And the forest will come down completely, the city will be utterly laid low.
32:20 Happy are you who sow beside every stream, and let the ox and the donkey go freely!
33:1 Ah! You destroyer never destroyed, betrayer never betrayed! When you have finished destroying, you will be destroyed; when you have stopped betraying, you will be betrayed.
33:2 , be gracious to us; for you we wait. Be our strength every morning, our salvation in time of trouble!
33:3 At the roaring sound, peoples flee; when you rise in your majesty, nations are scattered.
33:4 Spoil is gathered up as caterpillars gather, an onrush like the rush of locusts.
33:5 The is exalted, enthroned on high; he fills Zion with right and justice.
33:6 That which makes her seasons certain, her wealth, salvation, wisdom, and knowledge, is the fear of the , her treasure.
33:7 See, the men of Ariel cry out in the streets, the messengers of Shalem weep bitterly.
33:8 The highways are desolate, travelers have quit the paths, Covenants are broken, witnesses spurned; yet no one gives it a thought.
33:9 The country languishes in mourning, Lebanon withers with shame; Sharon is like the Arabah, Bashan and Carmel are stripped bare.
33:10 Now I will rise up, says the , now exalt myself, now lift myself up.
33:11 You conceive dry grass, bring forth stubble; my spirit shall consume you like fire.
33:12 The peoples shall be burned to lime, thorns cut down to burn in fire.
33:13 Hear, you who are far off, what I have done; you who are near, acknowledge my might.
33:14 In Zion sinners are in dread, trembling grips the impious: Who of us can live with consuming fire? who of us can live with everlasting flames?
33:15 Whoever walks righteously and speaks honestly, who spurns what is gained by oppression, Who waves off contact with a bribe, who stops his ears so as not to hear of bloodshed, who closes his eyes so as not to look on evil—
33:16 That one shall dwell on the heights, with fortresses of rock for stronghold, food and drink in steady supply.
33:17 Your eyes will see a king in his splendor, they will look upon a vast land.
33:18 Your mind will dwell on the terror: Where is the one who counted, where the one who weighed? Where the one who counted the towers?
33:19 You shall no longer see a defiant people, a people of speech too obscure to comprehend, stammering in a tongue not understood.
33:20 Look to Zion, the city of our festivals; your eyes shall see Jerusalem as a quiet abode, a tent not to be struck, Whose pegs will never be pulled up, nor any of its ropes severed.
33:21 Indeed the in majesty will be there for us a place of rivers and wide streams on which no galley may go, where no majestic ship may pass.
33:22 For the is our judge, the is our lawgiver, the is our king; he it is who will save us.
33:23 The rigging hangs slack; it cannot hold the mast in place, nor keep the sail spread out. Then the blind will divide great spoils and the lame will carry off the loot.
33:24 No one who dwells there will say, I am sick; the people who live there will be forgiven their guilt.
34:1 Come near, nations, and listen; be attentive, you peoples! Let the earth and what fills it listen, the world and all it produces.
34:2 The is angry with all the nations, enraged against all their host; He has placed them under the ban, given them up to slaughter.
34:3 Their slain shall be cast out, their corpses shall send up a stench; the mountains shall run with their blood,
34:4 All the host of heaven shall rot; the heavens shall be rolled up like a scroll. All their host shall wither away, as the leaf wilts on the vine, or as the fig withers on the tree.
34:5 When my sword has drunk its fill in the heavens, it shall come down upon Edom for judgment, upon a people under my ban.
34:6 The has a sword sated with blood, greasy with fat, With the blood of lambs and goats, with the fat of rams kidneys; For the has a sacrifice in Bozrah, a great slaughter in the land of Edom.
34:7 Wild oxen shall be struck down with fatlings, and bullocks with bulls; Their land shall be soaked with blood, and their soil greasy with fat.
34:8 For the has a day of vengeance, a year of requital for the cause of Zion.
34:9 Edoms streams shall be changed into pitch, its soil into sulfur, and its land shall become burning pitch;
34:10 Night and day it shall not be quenched, its smoke shall rise forever. From generation to generation it shall lie waste, never again shall anyone pass through it.
34:11 But the desert owl and hoot owl shall possess it, the screech owl and raven shall dwell in it. The will stretch over it the measuring line of chaos, the plumb line of confusion.
34:12 Its nobles shall be no more, nor shall kings be proclaimed there; all its princes are gone.
34:13 Its castles shall be overgrown with thorns, its fortresses with thistles and briers. It shall become an abode for jackals, a haunt for ostriches.
34:14 Wildcats shall meet with desert beasts, satyrs shall call to one another; There shall the lilith repose, and find for herself a place to rest.
34:15 There the hoot owl shall nest and lay eggs, hatch them out and gather them in her shadow; There shall the kites assemble, each with its mate.
34:16 Search through the book of the and read: not one of these shall be lacking, For the mouth of the has ordered it, and his spirit gathers them there.
34:17 It is he who casts the lot for them; his hand measures off their portions; They shall possess it forever, and dwell in it from generation to generation.
35:1 The wilderness and the parched land will exult; the Arabah will rejoice and bloom;
35:2 Like the crocus it shall bloom abundantly, and rejoice with joyful song. The glory of Lebanon will be given to it, the splendor of Carmel and Sharon; They will see the glory of the , the splendor of our God.
35:3 Strengthen hands that are feeble, make firm knees that are weak,
35:4 Say to the fearful of heart: Be strong, do not fear! Here is your God, he comes with vindication; With divine recompense he comes to save you.
35:5 Then the eyes of the blind shall see, and the ears of the deaf be opened;
35:6 Then the lame shall leap like a stag, and the mute tongue sing for joy. For waters will burst forth in the wilderness, and streams in the Arabah.
35:7 The burning sands will become pools, and the thirsty ground, springs of water; The abode where jackals crouch will be a marsh for the reed and papyrus.
35:8 A highway will be there, called the holy way; No one unclean may pass over it, but it will be for his people; no traveler, not even fools, shall go astray on it.
35:9 No lion shall be there, nor any beast of prey approach, nor be found. But there the redeemed shall walk,
35:10 And the ransomed of the shall return, and enter Zion singing, crowned with everlasting joy; They meet with joy and gladness, sorrow and mourning flee away.
36:1 In the fourteenth year of King Hezekiah, Sennacherib, king of Assyria, went up against all the fortified cities of Judah and captured them.
36:2 From Lachish the king of Assyria sent his commander with a great army to King Hezekiah in Jerusalem. When he stopped at the conduit of the upper pool, on the highway of the fullers field,
36:3 there came out to him the master of the palace, Eliakim, son of Hilkiah, and Shebna the scribe, and the chancellor, Joah, son of Asaph.
36:4 The commander said to them, Tell Hezekiah: Thus says the great king, the king of Assyria: On what do you base this trust of yours?
36:5 Do you think mere words substitute for strategy and might in war? In whom, then, do you place your trust, that you rebel against me?
36:6 Do you trust in Egypt, that broken reed of a staff which pierces the hand of anyone who leans on it? That is what Pharaoh, king of Egypt, is to all who trust in him.
36:7 Or do you say to me: It is in the , our God, we trust? Is it not he whose high places and altars Hezekiah has removed, commanding Judah and Jerusalem, Worship before this altar?
36:8 Now, make a wager with my lord, the king of Assyria: I will give you two thousand horses, if you are able to put riders on them.
36:9 How then can you turn back even a captain, one of the least servants of my lord, trusting, as you do, in Egypt for chariots and horses?
36:10 Did I come up to destroy this land without the ? The himself said to me, Go up and destroy that land!
36:11 Then Eliakim and Shebna and Joah said to the commander, Please speak to your servants in Aramaic; we understand it. Do not speak to us in the language of Judah within earshot of the people who are on the wall.
36:12 But the commander replied, Was it to your lord and to you that my lord sent me to speak these words? Was it not rather to those sitting on the wall, who, with you, will have to eat their own excrement and drink their own urine?
36:13 Then the commander stepped forward and cried out in a loud voice in the language of Judah, Listen to the words of the great king, the king of Assyria.
36:14 Thus says the king: Do not let Hezekiah deceive you, for he cannot rescue you.
36:15 And do not let Hezekiah induce you to trust in the , saying, The will surely rescue us, and this city will not be handed over to the king of Assyria.
36:16 Do not listen to Hezekiah, for thus says the king of Assyria: Make peace with me and surrender to me! Eat, each of you, from your vine, each from your own fig tree. Drink water, each from your own well,
36:17 until I arrive and take you to a land like your own, A land of grain and wine, a land of bread and vineyards.
36:18 Do not let Hezekiah seduce you by saying, The will rescue us. Has any of the gods of the nations rescued his land from the power of the king of Assyria?
36:19 Where are the gods of Hamath and Arpad? Where are the gods of Sepharvaim? Where are the gods of Samaria? Have they saved Samaria from my power?
36:20 Who among all the gods of these lands ever rescued their land from my power, that the should save Jerusalem from my power?
36:21 But they remained silent and did not answer at all, for the kings command was, Do not answer him.
36:22 Then the master of the palace, Eliakim, son of Hilkiah, Shebna the scribe, and the chancellor Joah, son of Asaph, came to Hezekiah with their garments torn, and reported to him the words of the commander.
37:1 When King Hezekiah heard this, he tore his garments, covered himself with sackcloth, and went into the house of the .
37:2 He sent Eliakim, the master of the palace, and Shebna the scribe, and the elders of the priests, covered with sackcloth, to tell the prophet Isaiah, son of Amoz,
37:3 Thus says Hezekiah: A day of distress and rebuke, a day of disgrace is this day! Children are due to come forth, but the strength to give birth is lacking.
37:4 Perhaps the , your God, will hear the words of the commander, whom his lord, the king of Assyria, sent to taunt the living God, and will rebuke him for the words which the , your God, has heard. So lift up a prayer for the remnant that is here.
37:5 When the servants of King Hezekiah had come to Isaiah,
37:6 he said to them: Tell this to your lord: Thus says the : Do not be frightened by the words you have heard, by which the deputies of the king of Assyria have blasphemed me.
37:7 I am putting in him such a spirit that when he hears a report he will return to his land. I will make him fall by the sword in his land.
37:8 When the commander, on his return, heard that the king of Assyria had withdrawn from Lachish, he found him besieging Libnah.
37:9 The king of Assyria heard a report: Tirhakah, king of Ethiopia, has come out to fight against you. Again he sent messengers to Hezekiah to say:
37:10 Thus shall you say to Hezekiah, king of Judah: Do not let your God in whom you trust deceive you by saying, Jerusalem will not be handed over to the king of Assyria.
37:11 You, certainly, have heard what the kings of Assyria have done to all the lands: they put them under the ban! And are you to be delivered?
37:12 Did the gods of the nations whom my fathers destroyed deliver them—Gozan, Haran, Rezeph, and the Edenites in Telassar?
37:13 Where are the king of Hamath, the king of Arpad, or a king of the cities Sepharvaim, Hena or Ivvah?
37:14 Hezekiah took the letter from the hand of the messengers and read it; then he went up to the house of the , and spreading it out before the ,
37:15 Hezekiah prayed to the :
37:16 of hosts, God of Israel, enthroned on the cherubim! You alone are God over all the kingdoms of the earth. It is you who made the heavens and the earth.
37:17 Incline your ear, , and listen! open your eyes, , and see! Hear all the words Sennacherib has sent to taunt the living God.
37:18 Truly, O , the kings of Assyria have laid waste the nations and their lands.
37:19 They gave their gods to the fire —they were not gods at all, but the work of human hands— Wood and stone, they destroyed them.
37:20 Therefore, , our God, save us from this mans power, That all the kingdoms of the earth may know that you alone, , are God.
37:21 Then Isaiah, son of Amoz, sent this message to Hezekiah: Thus says the , the God of Israel, to whom you have prayed concerning Sennacherib, king of Assyria: I have listened!
37:22 This is the word the has spoken concerning him: She despises you, laughs you to scorn, the virgin daughter Zion; Behind you she wags her head, daughter Jerusalem.
37:23 Whom have you insulted and blasphemed, at whom have you raised your voice And lifted up your eyes on high? At the Holy One of Israel!
37:24 Through the mouths of your messengers you have insulted the Lord when you said: With my many chariots I went up to the tops of the peaks, to the recesses of Lebanon, To cut down its lofty cedars, its choice cypresses; I reached the farthest shelter, the forest ranges.
37:25 I myself dug wells and drank foreign water; Drying up all the rivers of Egypt beneath the soles of my feet.
37:26 Have you not heard? A long time ago I prepared it, from days of old I planned it, Now I have brought it about: You are here to reduce fortified cities to heaps of ruins,
37:27 Their people powerless, dismayed and distraught, They are plants of the field, green growth, thatch on the rooftops, Grain scorched by the east wind.
37:28 I know when you stand or sit, when you come or go, and how you rage against me.
37:29 Because you rage against me and your smugness has reached my ears, I will put my hook in your nose and my bit in your mouth, And make you leave by the way you came.
37:30 This shall be a sign for you: This year you shall eat the aftergrowth, next year, what grows of itself; But in the third year, sow and reap, plant vineyards and eat their fruit!
37:31 The remaining survivors of the house of Judah shall again strike root below and bear fruit above.
37:32 For out of Jerusalem shall come a remnant, and from Mount Zion, survivors. The zeal of the of hosts shall do this.
37:33 Therefore, thus says the about the king of Assyria: He shall not come as far as this city, nor shoot there an arrow, nor confront it with a shield, Nor cast up a siege-work against it.
37:34 By the way he came he shall leave, never coming as far as this city, oracle of the .
37:35 I will shield and save this city for my own sake and the sake of David my servant.
37:36 Then the angel of the went forth and struck down one hundred and eighty-five thousand in the Assyrian camp. Early the next morning, there they were, all those corpses, dead!
37:37 So Sennacherib, the king of Assyria, broke camp, departed, returned home, and stayed in Nineveh.
37:38 When he was worshiping in the temple of his god Nisroch, his sons Adrammelech and Sharezer struck him down with the sword and fled into the land of Ararat. His son Esarhaddon reigned in his place.
38:1 In those days, when Hezekiah was mortally ill, the prophet Isaiah, son of Amoz, came and said to him: Thus says the : Put your house in order, for you are about to die; you shall not recover.
38:2 Hezekiah turned his face to the wall and prayed to the :
38:3 Ah, , remember how faithfully and wholeheartedly I conducted myself in your presence, doing what was good in your sight! And Hezekiah wept bitterly.
38:4 Then the word of the came to Isaiah:
38:5 Go, tell Hezekiah: Thus says the , the God of your father David: I have heard your prayer; I have seen your tears. Now I will add fifteen years to your life.
38:6 I will rescue you and this city from the hand of the king of Assyria; I will be a shield to this city.
38:7 This will be the sign for you from the that the will carry out the word he has spoken:
38:8 See, I will make the shadow cast by the sun on the stairway to the terrace of Ahaz go back the ten steps it has advanced. So the sun came back the ten steps it had advanced.
38:9 The song of Hezekiah, king of Judah, after he had been sick and had recovered from his illness:
38:10 In the noontime of life I said, I must depart! To the gates of Sheol I have been consigned for the rest of my years.
38:11 I said, I shall see the no more in the land of the living. Nor look on any mortals among those who dwell in the world.
38:12 My dwelling, like a shepherds tent, is struck down and borne away from me; You have folded up my life, like a weaver who severs me from the last thread. From morning to night you make an end of me;
38:13 I cry out even until the dawn. Like a lion he breaks all my bones; from morning to night you make an end of me.
38:14 Like a swallow I chirp; I moan like a dove. My eyes grow weary looking heavenward: Lord, I am overwhelmed; go security for me!
38:15 What am I to say or tell him? He is the one who has done it! All my sleep has fled, because of the bitterness of my soul.
38:16 Those live whom the protects; yours is the life of my spirit. You have given me health and restored my life!
38:17 Peace in place of bitterness! You have preserved my life from the pit of destruction; Behind your back you cast all my sins.
38:18 For it is not Sheol that gives you thanks, nor death that praises you; Neither do those who go down into the pit await your kindness.
38:19 The living, the living give you thanks, as I do today. Parents declare to their children, O God, your faithfulness.
38:20 The is there to save us. We shall play our music In the house of the all the days of our life.
38:21 Then Isaiah said, Bring a poultice of figs and apply it to the boil for his recovery.
38:22 Hezekiah asked, What is the sign that I shall go up to the house of the ?
39:1 At that time Merodach-baladan, son of Baladan, king of Babylon, sent letters and gifts to Hezekiah, when he heard that he had been sick and had recovered.
39:2 Hezekiah was pleased at their coming, and then showed the messengers his treasury, the silver and gold, the spices and perfumed oil, his whole armory, and everything in his storerooms; there was nothing in his house or in all his realm that Hezekiah did not show them.
39:3 Then Isaiah the prophet came to King Hezekiah and asked him, What did these men say to you? Where did they come from? Hezekiah replied, They came to me from a distant land, from Babylon.
39:4 He asked, What did they see in your house? Hezekiah answered, They saw everything in my house. There is nothing in my storerooms that I did not show them.
39:5 Then Isaiah said to Hezekiah, Hear the word of the of hosts:
39:6 The time is coming when all that is in your house, everything that your ancestors have stored up until this day, shall be carried off to Babylon; nothing shall be left, says the .
39:7 Some of your own descendants, your progeny, shall be taken and made attendants in the palace of the king of Babylon.
39:8 Hezekiah replied to Isaiah, The word of the which you have spoken is good. For he thought, There will be peace and stability in my lifetime.
40:1 Comfort, give comfort to my people, says your God.
40:2 Speak to the heart of Jerusalem, and proclaim to her that her service has ended, that her guilt is expiated, That she has received from the hand of the double for all her sins.
40:3 A voice proclaims: In the wilderness prepare the way of the ! Make straight in the wasteland a highway for our God!
40:4 Every valley shall be lifted up, every mountain and hill made low; The rugged land shall be a plain, the rough country, a broad valley.
40:5 Then the glory of the shall be revealed, and all flesh shall see it together; for the mouth of the has spoken.
40:6 A voice says, Proclaim! I answer, What shall I proclaim? All flesh is grass, and all their loyalty like the flower of the field.
40:7 The grass withers, the flower wilts, when the breath of the blows upon it. Yes, the people is grass!
40:8 The grass withers, the flower wilts, but the word of our God stands forever.
40:9 Go up onto a high mountain, Zion, herald of good news! Cry out at the top of your voice, Jerusalem, herald of good news! Cry out, do not fear! Say to the cities of Judah: Here is your God!
40:10 Here comes with power the Lord , who rules by his strong arm; Here is his reward with him, his recompense before him.
40:11 Like a shepherd he feeds his flock; in his arms he gathers the lambs, Carrying them in his bosom, leading the ewes with care.
40:12 Who has measured with his palm the waters, marked off the heavens with a span, held in his fingers the dust of the earth, weighed the mountains in scales and the hills in a balance?
40:13 Who has directed the spirit of the , or instructed him as his counselor?
40:14 Whom did he consult to gain knowledge? Who taught him the path of judgment, or showed him the way of understanding?
40:15 See, the nations count as a drop in the bucket, as a wisp of cloud on the scales; the coastlands weigh no more than a speck.
40:16 Lebanon would not suffice for fuel, nor its animals be enough for burnt offerings.
40:17 Before him all the nations are as nought, as nothing and void he counts them.
40:18 To whom can you liken God? With what likeness can you confront him?
40:19 An idol? An artisan casts it, the smith plates it with gold, fits it with silver chains.
40:20 Is mulberry wood the offering? A skilled artisan picks out a wood that will not rot, Seeks to set up for himself an idol that will not totter.
40:21 Do you not know? Have you not heard? Was it not told you from the beginning? Have you not understood from the founding of the earth?
40:22 The one who is enthroned above the vault of the earth, its inhabitants like grasshoppers, Who stretches out the heavens like a veil and spreads them out like a tent to dwell in,
40:23 Who brings princes to nought and makes the rulers of the earth as nothing.
40:24 Scarcely are they planted, scarcely sown, scarcely their stem rooted in the earth, When he breathes upon them and they wither, and the stormwind carries them away like straw.
40:25 To whom can you liken me as an equal? says the Holy One.
40:26 Lift up your eyes on high and see who created these: He leads out their army and numbers them, calling them all by name. By his great might and the strength of his power not one of them is missing!
40:27 Why, O Jacob, do you say, and declare, O Israel, My way is hidden from the , and my right is disregarded by my God?
40:28 Do you not know? Have you not heard? The is God from of old, creator of the ends of the earth. He does not faint or grow weary, and his knowledge is beyond scrutiny.
40:29 He gives power to the faint, abundant strength to the weak.
40:30 Though young men faint and grow weary, and youths stagger and fall,
40:31 They that hope in the will renew their strength, they will soar on eagles wings; They will run and not grow weary, walk and not grow faint.
41:1 Keep silence before me, O coastlands; let the nations renew their strength. Let them draw near and speak; let us come together for judgment.
41:2 Who has stirred up from the East the champion of justice, and summoned him to be his attendant? To him he delivers nations and subdues kings; With his sword he reduces them to dust, with his bow, to driven straw.
41:3 He pursues them, passing on without loss, by a path his feet scarcely touch.
41:4 Who has performed these deeds? Who has called forth the generations from the beginning? I, the , am the first, and at the last I am he.
41:5 The coastlands see, and fear; the ends of the earth tremble: they approach, they come on.
41:6 Each one helps his neighbor, one says to the other, Courage!
41:7 The woodworker encourages the goldsmith, the one who beats with the hammer, him who strikes on the anvil, Saying of the soldering, It is good! then fastening it with nails so it will not totter.
41:8 But you, Israel, my servant, Jacob, whom I have chosen, offspring of Abraham my friend—
41:9 You whom I have taken from the ends of the earth and summoned from its far-off places, To whom I have said, You are my servant; I chose you, I have not rejected you—
41:10 Do not fear: I am with you; do not be anxious: I am your God. I will strengthen you, I will help you, I will uphold you with my victorious right hand.
41:11 Yes, all shall be put to shame and disgrace who vent their anger against you; Those shall be as nothing and perish who offer resistance.
41:12 You shall seek but not find those who strive against you; They shall be as nothing at all who do battle with you.
41:13 For I am the , your God, who grasp your right hand; It is I who say to you, Do not fear, I will help you.
41:14 Do not fear, you worm Jacob, you maggot Israel; I will help you—oracle of the ; the Holy One of Israel is your redeemer.
