41:15 I will make of you a threshing sledge, sharp, new, full of teeth, To thresh the mountains and crush them, to make the hills like chaff.
41:16 When you winnow them, the wind shall carry them off, the storm shall scatter them. But you shall rejoice in the ; in the Holy One of Israel you shall glory.
41:17 The afflicted and the needy seek water in vain, their tongues are parched with thirst. I, the , will answer them; I, the God of Israel, will not forsake them.
41:18 I will open up rivers on the bare heights, and fountains in the broad valleys; I will turn the wilderness into a marshland, and the dry ground into springs of water.
41:19 In the wilderness I will plant the cedar, acacia, myrtle, and olive; In the wasteland I will set the cypress, together with the plane tree and the pine,
41:20 That all may see and know, observe and understand, That the hand of the has done this, the Holy One of Israel has created it.
41:21 Present your case, says the ; bring forward your arguments, says the King of Jacob.
41:22 Let them draw near and foretell to us what it is that shall happen! What are the things of long ago? Tell us, that we may reflect on them and know their outcome; Or declare to us the things to come,
41:23 tell what is to be in the future, that we may know that you are gods! Do something, good or evil, that will put us in awe and in fear.
41:24 Why, you are nothing and your work is nought; to choose you is an abomination!
41:25 I have stirred up one from the north, and he comes; from the east I summon him by name; He shall trample the rulers down like mud, like a potter treading clay.
41:26 Who announced this from the beginning, that we might know; beforehand, that we might say, True? Not one of you foretold it, not one spoke; not one heard you say,
41:27 The first news for Zion: here they come, or, I will give Jerusalem a herald of good news.
41:28 When I look, there is not one, not one of them to give counsel, to make an answer when I question them.
41:29 Ah, all of them are nothing, their works are nought, their idols, empty wind!
42:1 Here is my servant whom I uphold, my chosen one with whom I am pleased. Upon him I have put my spirit; he shall bring forth justice to the nations.
42:2 He will not cry out, nor shout, nor make his voice heard in the street.
42:3 A bruised reed he will not break, and a dimly burning wick he will not quench. He will faithfully bring forth justice.
42:4 He will not grow dim or be bruised until he establishes justice on the earth; the coastlands will wait for his teaching.
42:5 Thus says God, the , who created the heavens and stretched them out, who spread out the earth and its produce, Who gives breath to its people and spirit to those who walk on it:
42:6 I, the , have called you for justice, I have grasped you by the hand; I formed you, and set you as a covenant for the people, a light for the nations,
42:7 To open the eyes of the blind, to bring out prisoners from confinement, and from the dungeon, those who live in darkness.
42:8 I am the , is my name; my glory I give to no other, nor my praise to idols.
42:9 See, the earlier things have come to pass, new ones I now declare; Before they spring forth I announce them to you.
42:10 Sing to the a new song, his praise from the ends of the earth: Let the sea and what fills it resound, the coastlands, and those who dwell in them.
42:11 Let the wilderness and its cities cry out, the villages where Kedar dwells; Let the inhabitants of Sela exult, and shout from the top of the mountains.
42:12 Let them give glory to the , and utter his praise in the coastlands.
42:13 The goes forth like a warrior, like a man of war he stirs up his fury; He shouts out his battle cry, against his enemies he shows his might:
42:14 For a long time I have kept silent, I have said nothing, holding myself back; Now I cry out like a woman in labor, gasping and panting.
42:15 I will lay waste mountains and hills, all their undergrowth I will dry up; I will turn the rivers into marshes, and the marshes I will dry up.
42:16 I will lead the blind on a way they do not know; by paths they do not know I will guide them. I will turn darkness into light before them, and make crooked ways straight. These are my promises: I made them, I will not forsake them.
42:17 They shall be turned back in utter shame who trust in idols; Who say to molten images, You are our gods.
42:18 You deaf ones, listen, you blind ones, look and see!
42:19 Who is blind but my servant, or deaf like the messenger I send? Who is blind like the one I restore, blind like the servant of the ?
42:20 You see many things but do not observe; ears open, but do not hear.
42:21 It was the s will for the sake of his justice to make his teaching great and glorious.
42:22 This is a people plundered and despoiled, all of them trapped in holes, hidden away in prisons. They are taken as plunder, with no one to rescue them, as spoil, with no one to say, Give back!
42:23 Who among you will give ear to this, listen and pay attention from now on?
42:24 Who was it that gave Jacob to be despoiled, Israel to the plunderers? Was it not the , against whom we have sinned? In his ways they refused to walk, his teaching they would not heed.
42:25 So he poured out wrath upon them, his anger, and the fury of battle; It blazed all around them, yet they did not realize, it burned them, but they did not take it to heart.
43:1 But now, thus says the , who created you, Jacob, and formed you, Israel: Do not fear, for I have redeemed you; I have called you by name: you are mine.
43:2 When you pass through waters, I will be with you; through rivers, you shall not be swept away. When you walk through fire, you shall not be burned, nor will flames consume you.
43:3 For I, the , am your God, the Holy One of Israel, your savior. I give Egypt as ransom for you, Ethiopia and Seba in exchange for you.
43:4 Because you are precious in my eyes and honored, and I love you, I give people in return for you and nations in exchange for your life.
43:5 Fear not, for I am with you; from the east I will bring back your offspring, from the west I will gather you.
43:6 I will say to the north: Give them up! and to the south: Do not hold them! Bring back my sons from afar, and my daughters from the ends of the earth:
43:7 All who are called by my name I created for my glory; I formed them, made them.
43:8 Lead out the people, blind though they have eyes, deaf though they have ears.
43:9 Let all the nations gather together, let the peoples assemble! Who among them could have declared this, or announced to us the earlier things? Let them produce witnesses to prove themselves right, that one may hear and say, It is true!
43:10 You are my witnesses—oracle of the — my servant whom I have chosen To know and believe in me and understand that I am he. Before me no god was formed, and after me there shall be none.
43:11 I, I am the ; there is no savior but me.
43:12 It is I who declared, who saved, who announced, not some strange god among you; You are my witnesses—oracle of the . I am God,
43:13 yes, from eternity I am he; There is none who can deliver from my hand: I act and who can cancel it?
43:14 Thus says the , your redeemer, the Holy One of Israel: For your sake I send to Babylon; I will bring down all her defenses, and the Chaldeans shall cry out in lamentation.
43:15 I am the , your Holy One, the creator of Israel, your King.
43:16 Thus says the , who opens a way in the sea, a path in the mighty waters,
43:17 Who leads out chariots and horsemen, a powerful army, Till they lie prostrate together, never to rise, snuffed out, quenched like a wick.
43:18 Remember not the events of the past, the things of long ago consider not;
43:19 See, I am doing something new! Now it springs forth, do you not perceive it? In the wilderness I make a way, in the wasteland, rivers.
43:20 Wild beasts honor me, jackals and ostriches, For I put water in the wilderness and rivers in the wasteland for my chosen people to drink,
43:21 The people whom I formed for myself, that they might recount my praise.
43:22 Yet you did not call upon me, Jacob, for you grew weary of me, Israel.
43:23 You did not bring me sheep for your burnt offerings, nor honor me with your sacrifices. I did not exact from you the service of offerings, nor weary you for frankincense.
43:24 You did not buy me sweet cane, nor did you fill me with the fat of your sacrifices; Instead, you burdened me with your sins, wearied me with your crimes.
43:25 It is I, I, who wipe out, for my own sake, your offenses; your sins I remember no more.
43:26 Would you have me remember, have us come to trial? Speak up, prove your innocence!
43:27 Your first father sinned; your spokesmen rebelled against me
43:28 Till I repudiated the holy princes, put Jacob under the ban, exposed Israel to scorn.
44:1 Hear then, Jacob, my servant, Israel, whom I have chosen.
44:2 Thus says the who made you, your help, who formed you from the womb: Do not fear, Jacob, my servant, Jeshurun, whom I have chosen.
44:3 I will pour out water upon the thirsty ground, streams upon the dry land; I will pour out my spirit upon your offspring, my blessing upon your descendants.
44:4 They shall spring forth amid grass like poplars beside flowing waters.
44:5 One shall say, I am the s, another shall be named after Jacob, And this one shall write on his hand, The s, and receive the name Israel.
44:6 Thus says the , Israels king, its redeemer, the of hosts: I am the first, I am the last; there is no God but me.
44:7 Who is like me? Let him stand up and declare, make it evident, and confront me with it. Who of old announced future events? Let them foretell to us the things to come.
44:8 Do not fear or be troubled. Did I not announce it to you long ago? I declared it, and you are my witnesses. Is there any God but me? There is no other Rock, I know of none!
44:9 Those who fashion idols are all nothing; their precious works are of no avail. They are their witnesses: they see nothing, know nothing, and so they are put to shame.
44:10 Who would fashion a god or cast an idol, that is of no use?
44:11 Look, all its company will be shamed; they are artisans, mere human beings! They all assemble and stand there, only to cower in shame.
44:12 The ironsmith fashions a likeness, he works it over the coals, Shaping it with hammers, working it with his strong arm. With hunger his strength wanes, without water, he grows faint.
44:13 The woodworker stretches a line, and marks out a shape with a stylus. He shapes it with scraping tools, with a compass measures it off, Making it the copy of a man, human display, enthroned in a shrine.
44:14 He goes out to cut down cedars, takes a holm tree or an oak. He picks out for himself trees of the forest, plants a fir, and the rain makes it grow.
44:15 It is used for fuel: with some of the wood he warms himself, makes a fire and bakes bread. Yet he makes a god and worships it, turns it into an idol and adores it!
44:16 Half of it he burns in the fire, on its embers he roasts meat; he eats the roast and is full. He warms himself and says, Ah! I am warm! I see the flames!
44:17 The rest of it he makes into a god, an image to worship and adore. He prays to it and says, Help me! You are my god!
44:18 They do not know, do not understand; their eyes are too clouded to see, their minds, to perceive.
44:19 He does not think clearly; he lacks the wit and knowledge to say, Half the wood I burned in the fire, on its embers I baked bread, I roasted meat and ate. Shall I turn the rest into an abomination? Shall I worship a block of wood?
44:20 He is chasing ashes! A deluded mind has led him astray; He cannot save himself, does not say, This thing in my right hand—is it not a fraud?
44:21 Remember these things, Jacob, Israel, for you are my servant! I formed you, a servant to me; Israel, you shall never be forgotten by me:
44:22 I have brushed away your offenses like a cloud, your sins like a mist; return to me, for I have redeemed you.
44:23 Raise a glad cry, you heavens—the has acted! Shout, you depths of the earth. Break forth, mountains, into song, forest, with all your trees. For the has redeemed Jacob, shows his glory through Israel.
44:24 Thus says the , your redeemer, who formed you from the womb: I am the , who made all things, who alone stretched out the heavens, I spread out the earth by myself.
44:25 I bring to nought the omens of babblers, make fools of diviners, Turn back the wise and make their knowledge foolish.
44:26 I confirm the words of my servant, carry out the plan my messengers announce. I say to Jerusalem, Be inhabited! To the cities of Judah, Be rebuilt! I will raise up their ruins.
44:27 I say to the deep, Be dry! I will dry up your rivers.
44:28 I say of Cyrus, My shepherd! He carries out my every wish, Saying of Jerusalem, Let it be rebuilt, and of the temple, Lay its foundations.
45:1 Thus says the to his anointed, Cyrus, whose right hand I grasp, Subduing nations before him, stripping kings of their strength, Opening doors before him, leaving the gates unbarred:
45:2 I will go before you and level the mountains; Bronze doors I will shatter, iron bars I will snap.
45:3 I will give you treasures of darkness, riches hidden away, That you may know I am the , the God of Israel, who calls you by name.
45:4 For the sake of Jacob, my servant, of Israel my chosen one, I have called you by name, giving you a title, though you do not know me.
45:5 I am the , there is no other, there is no God besides me. It is I who arm you, though you do not know me,
45:6 so that all may know, from the rising of the sun to its setting, that there is none besides me. I am the , there is no other.
45:7 I form the light, and create the darkness, I make weal and create woe; I, the , do all these things.
45:8 Let justice descend, you heavens, like dew from above, like gentle rain let the clouds drop it down. Let the earth open and salvation bud forth; let righteousness spring up with them! I, the , have created this.
45:9 Woe to anyone who contends with their Maker; a potsherd among potsherds of the earth! Shall the clay say to the potter, What are you doing? or, What you are making has no handles?
45:10 Woe to anyone who asks a father, What are you begetting? or a woman, What are you giving birth to?
45:11 Thus says the , the Holy One of Israel, his maker: Do you question me about my children, tell me how to treat the work of my hands?
45:12 It was I who made the earth and created the people upon it; It was my hands that stretched out the heavens; I gave the order to all their host.
45:13 It was I who stirred him up for justice; all his ways I make level. He shall rebuild my city and let my exiles go free Without price or payment, says the of hosts.
45:14 Thus says the : The earnings of Egypt, the gain of Ethiopia, and the Sabeans, tall of stature, Shall come over to you and belong to you; they shall follow you, coming in chains. Before you they shall bow down, saying in prayer: With you alone is God; and there is none other, no other god!
45:15 Truly with you God is hidden, the God of Israel, the savior!
45:16 They are put to shame and disgrace, all of them; they go in disgrace who carve images.
45:17 Israel has been saved by the , saved forever! You shall never be put to shame or disgrace in any future age.
45:18 For thus says the , The creator of the heavens, who is God, The designer and maker of the earth who established it, Not as an empty waste did he create it, but designing it to be lived in: I am the , and there is no other.
45:19 I have not spoken in secret from some place in the land of darkness, I have not said to the descendants of Jacob, Look for me in an empty waste. I, the , promise justice, I declare what is right.
45:20 Come and assemble, gather together, you fugitives from among the nations! They are without knowledge who bear wooden idols and pray to gods that cannot save.
45:21 Come close and declare; let them take counsel together: Who announced this from the beginning, declared it from of old? Was it not I, the , besides whom there is no other God? There is no just and saving God but me.
45:22 Turn to me and be safe, all you ends of the earth, for I am God; there is no other!
45:23 By myself I swear, uttering my just decree, a word that will not return: To me every knee shall bend; by me every tongue shall swear,
45:24 Saying, Only in the are just deeds and power. Before him in shame shall come all who vent their anger against him.
45:25 In the all the descendants of Israel shall have vindication and glory.
46:1 Bel bows down, Nebo stoops, their idols set upon beasts and cattle; They must be borne upon shoulders, a load for weary animals.
46:2 They stoop and bow down together; unable to deliver those who bear them, they too go into captivity.
46:3 Hear me, O house of Jacob, all the remnant of the house of Israel, My burden from the womb, whom I have carried since birth.
46:4 Even to your old age I am he, even when your hair is gray I will carry you; I have done this, and I will lift you up, I will carry you to safety.
46:5 To whom would you liken me as an equal, compare me, as though we were alike?
46:6 There are those who pour out gold from a purse and weigh out silver on the scales; They hire a goldsmith to make it into a god before which they bow down in worship.
46:7 They lift it to their shoulders to carry; when they set it down, it stays, and does not move from the place. They cry out to it, but it cannot answer; it delivers no one from distress.
46:8 Remember this and be firm, take it to heart, you rebels;
46:9 remember the former things, those long ago: I am God, there is no other; I am God, there is none like me.
46:10 At the beginning I declare the outcome; from of old, things not yet done. I say that my plan shall stand, I accomplish my every desire.
46:11 I summon from the east a bird of prey, from a distant land, one to carry out my plan. Yes, I have spoken, I will accomplish it; I have planned it, and I will do it.
46:12 Listen to me, you fainthearted, far from the victory of justice:
46:13 I am bringing on that victory, it is not far off, my salvation shall not tarry; I will put salvation within Zion, give to Israel my glory.
47:1 Come down, sit in the dust, virgin daughter Babylon; Sit on the ground, dethroned, daughter of the Chaldeans. No longer shall you be called dainty and delicate.
47:2 Take the millstone and grind flour, remove your veil; Strip off your skirt, bare your legs, cross through the streams.
47:3 Your nakedness shall be uncovered, and your shame be seen; I will take vengeance, I will yield to no entreaty, says
47:4 our redeemer, Whose name is the of hosts, the Holy One of Israel.
47:5 Go into darkness and sit in silence, daughter of the Chaldeans, No longer shall you be called sovereign mistress of kingdoms.
47:6 Angry at my people, I profaned my heritage And gave them into your power; but you showed them no mercy; Upon the aged you laid a very heavy yoke.
47:7 You said, I shall remain always, a sovereign mistress forever! You did not take these things to heart, but disregarded their outcome.
47:8 Now hear this, voluptuous one, enthroned securely, Saying in your heart, I, and no one else! I shall never be a widow, bereft of my children—
47:9 Both these things shall come to you suddenly, in a single day: Complete bereavement and widowhood shall come upon you Despite your many sorceries and the full power of your spells;
47:10 Secure in your wickedness, you said, No one sees me. Your wisdom and your knowledge led you astray, And you said in your heart, I, and no one else!
47:11 But upon you shall come an evil you will not be able to charm away; Upon you shall fall a disaster you cannot ward off. Upon you shall suddenly come a ruin you cannot imagine.
47:12 Keep on with your spells and your many sorceries, at which you toiled from your youth. Perhaps you can prevail, perhaps you can strike terror!
47:13 You wore yourself out with so many consultations! Let the astrologers stand forth to save you, The stargazers who forecast at each new moon what would happen to you.
47:14 See, they are like stubble, fire consumes them; They cannot deliver themselves from the spreading flames. This is no warming ember, no fire to sit before!
47:15 Thus do your wizards serve you with whom you have toiled from your youth; They wander their separate ways, with none to save you.
48:1 Hear this, house of Jacob called by the name Israel, sprung from the stock of Judah, You who swear by the name of the and invoke the God of Israel without sincerity, without justice,
48:2 Though you are named after the holy city and rely on the God of Israel, whose name is the of hosts.
48:3 Things of the past I declared long ago, they went forth from my mouth, I announced them; then suddenly I took action and they came to be.
48:4 Because I know that you are stubborn and that your neck is an iron sinew and your forehead bronze,
48:5 I declared them to you of old; before they took place I informed you, That you might not say, My idol did them, my statue, my molten image commanded them.
48:6 Now that you have heard, look at all this; must you not admit it? From now on I announce new things to you, hidden events you never knew.
48:7 Now, not from of old, they are created, before today you did not hear of them, so that you cannot claim, I have known them.
48:8 You never heard, you never knew, they never reached your ears beforehand. Yes, I know you are utterly treacherous, a rebel you were named from the womb.
48:9 For the sake of my name I restrain my anger, for the sake of my renown I hold it back from you, lest I destroy you.
48:10 See, I refined you, but not like silver; I tested you in the furnace of affliction.
48:11 For my sake, for my own sake, I do this; why should my name be profaned? My glory I will not give to another.
48:12 Listen to me, Jacob, Israel, whom I called! I, it is I who am the first, and am I the last.
48:13 Yes, my hand laid the foundations of the earth; my right hand spread out the heavens. When I summon them, they stand forth at once.
48:14 All of you assemble and listen: Who among you declared these things? The one the loves shall do his will against Babylon and the offspring of Chaldea.
48:15 I myself have spoken, I have summoned him, I have brought him, and his way succeeds!
48:16 Come near to me and hear this! From the beginning I did not speak in secret; At the time it happens, I am there: Now the Lord has sent me, and his spirit.
48:17 Thus says the , your redeemer, the Holy One of Israel: I am the , your God, teaching you how to prevail, leading you on the way you should go.
48:18 If only you would attend to my commandments, your peace would be like a river, your vindication like the waves of the sea,
48:19 Your descendants like the sand, the offspring of your loins like its grains, Their name never cut off or blotted out from my presence.
48:20 Go forth from Babylon, flee from Chaldea! With shouts of joy declare this, announce it; Make it known to the ends of the earth, Say: The has redeemed his servant Jacob.
48:21 They did not thirst when he led them through dry lands; Water from the rock he set flowing for them; he cleft the rock, and waters welled forth.
48:22 There is no peace for the wicked, says the .
49:1 Hear me, coastlands, listen, distant peoples. Before birth the called me, from my mothers womb he gave me my name.
49:2 He made my mouth like a sharp-edged sword, concealed me, shielded by his hand. He made me a sharpened arrow, in his quiver he hid me.
49:3 He said to me, You are my servant, in you, Israel, I show my glory.
49:4 Though I thought I had toiled in vain, for nothing and for naught spent my strength, Yet my right is with the , my recompense is with my God.
49:5 For now the has spoken who formed me as his servant from the womb, That Jacob may be brought back to him and Israel gathered to him; I am honored in the sight of the , and my God is now my strength!
49:6 It is too little, he says, for you to be my servant, to raise up the tribes of Jacob, and restore the survivors of Israel; I will make you a light to the nations, that my salvation may reach to the ends of the earth.
49:7 Thus says the , the redeemer, the Holy One of Israel, To the one despised, abhorred by the nations, the slave of rulers: When kings see you, they shall stand up, and princes shall bow down Because of the who is faithful, the Holy One of Israel who has chosen you.
49:8 Thus says the : In a time of favor I answer you, on the day of salvation I help you; I form you and set you as a covenant for the people, To restore the land and allot the devastated heritages,
49:9 To say to the prisoners: Come out! To those in darkness: Show yourselves! Along the roadways they shall find pasture, on every barren height shall their pastures be.
49:10 They shall not hunger or thirst; nor shall scorching wind or sun strike them; For he who pities them leads them and guides them beside springs of water.
49:11 I will turn all my mountains into roadway, and make my highways level.
49:12 See, these shall come from afar: some from the north and the west, others from the land of Syene.
49:13 Sing out, heavens, and rejoice, earth, break forth into song, you mountains, For the comforts his people and shows mercy to his afflicted.
49:14 But Zion said, The has forsaken me; my Lord has forgotten me.
49:15 Can a mother forget her infant, be without tenderness for the child of her womb? Even should she forget, I will never forget you.
49:16 See, upon the palms of my hands I have engraved you; your walls are ever before me.
49:17 Your children hasten— your levelers, your destroyers go forth from you;
49:18 Look about and see, they are all gathering and coming to you. As I live—oracle of the — you shall don them as jewels, bedeck yourself like a bride.
49:19 Though you were waste and desolate, a land of ruins, Now you shall be too narrow for your inhabitants, while those who swallowed you up will be far away.
49:20 The children of whom you were bereft shall yet say in your hearing, This place is too narrow for me, make room for me to live in.
49:21 You shall ask yourself: Who has borne me these, when I was bereft and barren? Exiled and repudiated, who has reared them? I was left all alone; where then do these come from?
49:22 Thus says the Lord : See, I will lift up my hand to the nations, and to the peoples raise my signal; They shall bring your sons in their arms, your daughters shall be carried on their shoulders.
49:23 Kings shall be your guardians, their princesses your nursemaids; Face to the ground, they shall bow down before you and lick the dust at your feet. Then you shall know that I am the , none who hope in me shall be ashamed.
49:24 Can plunder be taken from a warrior, or captives rescued from a tyrant?
49:25 Thus says the : Yes, captives can be taken from a warrior, and plunder rescued from a tyrant; Those who oppose you I will oppose, and your sons I will save.
49:26 I will make your oppressors eat their own flesh, and they shall be drunk with their own blood as though with new wine. All flesh shall know that I, the , am your savior, your redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob.
50:1 Thus says the : Where is the bill of divorce with which I dismissed your mother? Or to which of my creditors have I sold you? It was for your sins you were sold, for your rebellions your mother was dismissed.
50:2 Why was no one there when I came? Why did no one answer when I called? Is my hand too short to ransom? Have I not the strength to deliver? See, with my rebuke I dry up the sea, I turn rivers into wilderness; Their fish rot for lack of water, and die of thirst.
50:3 I clothe the heavens in black, and make sackcloth their covering.
50:4 The Lord has given me a well-trained tongue, That I might know how to answer the weary a word that will waken them. Morning after morning he wakens my ear to hear as disciples do;
50:5 The Lord opened my ear; I did not refuse, did not turn away.
50:6 I gave my back to those who beat me, my cheeks to those who tore out my beard; My face I did not hide from insults and spitting.
50:7 The Lord is my help, therefore I am not disgraced; Therefore I have set my face like flint, knowing that I shall not be put to shame.
50:8 He who declares my innocence is near. Who will oppose me? Let us appear together. Who will dispute my right? Let them confront me.
50:9 See, the Lord is my help; who will declare me guilty? See, they will all wear out like a garment, consumed by moths.
50:10 Who among you fears the , heeds his servants voice? Whoever walk in darkness, without any light, Yet trust in the name of the and rely upon their God!
50:11 All you who kindle flames and set flares alight, Walk by the light of your own fire and by the flares you have burnt! This is your fate from my hand: you shall lie down in a place of torment.
51:1 Listen to me, you who pursue justice, who seek the ; Look to the rock from which you were hewn, to the quarry from which you were taken;
51:2 Look to Abraham, your father, and to Sarah, who gave you birth; Though he was but one when I called him, I blessed him and made him many.
51:3 Yes, the shall comfort Zion, shall comfort all her ruins; Her wilderness he shall make like Eden, her wasteland like the garden of the ; Joy and gladness shall be found in her, thanksgiving and the sound of song.
51:4 Be attentive to me, my people; my nation, give ear to me. For teaching shall go forth from me, and my judgment, as light to the peoples.
51:5 I will make my victory come swiftly; my salvation shall go forth and my arm shall judge the nations; In me the coastlands shall hope, and my arm they shall await.
51:6 Raise your eyes to the heavens, look at the earth below; Though the heavens vanish like smoke, the earth wear out like a garment and its inhabitants die like flies, My salvation shall remain forever and my victory shall always be firm.
51:7 Hear me, you who know justice, you people who have my teaching at heart: Do not fear the reproach of others; remain firm at their revilings.
51:8 They shall be like a garment eaten by moths, like wool consumed by grubs; But my victory shall remain forever, my salvation, for all generations.
51:9 Awake, awake, put on strength, arm of the ! Awake as in the days of old, in ages long ago! Was it not you who crushed Rahab, you who pierced the dragon?
51:10 Was it not you who dried up the sea, the waters of the great deep, You who made the depths of the sea into a way for the redeemed to pass through?
51:11 Those whom the has ransomed will return and enter Zion singing, crowned with everlasting joy; They will meet with joy and gladness, sorrow and mourning will flee.
51:12 I, it is I who comfort you. Can you then fear mortals who die, human beings who are just grass,
51:13 And forget the , your maker, who stretched out the heavens and laid the foundations of earth? All the day you are in constant dread of the fury of the oppressor When he prepares himself to destroy; but where is the oppressors fury?
51:14 The captives shall soon be released; they shall not die and go down into the pit, nor shall they want for bread.
51:15 For I am the , your God, who stirs up the sea so that its waves roar; the of hosts by name.
51:16 I have put my words into your mouth, I covered you, shielded by my hand, Stretching out the heavens, laying the foundations of the earth, saying to Zion: You are my people.
51:17 Wake up, wake up! Arise, Jerusalem, You who drank at the s hand the cup of his wrath; Who drained to the dregs the bowl of staggering!
51:18 She has no one to guide her of all the children she bore; She has no one to take her by the hand, of all the children she reared!—
51:19 Your misfortunes are double; who is there to grieve with you? Desolation and destruction, famine and sword! Who is there to comfort you?
51:20 Your children lie helpless at every street corner like antelopes in a net. They are filled with the wrath of the , the rebuke of your God.
51:21 But now, hear this, afflicted one, drunk, but not with wine,
51:22 Thus says the , your Master, your God, who defends his people: See, I am taking from your hand the cup of staggering; The bowl of my wrath you shall no longer drink.
51:23 I will put it into the hands of your tormentors, those who said to you, Bow down, that we may walk over you. So you offered your back like the ground, like the street for them to walk on.
52:1 Awake, awake! Put on your strength, Zion; Put on your glorious garments, Jerusalem, holy city. Never again shall the uncircumcised or the unclean enter you.
52:2 Arise, shake off the dust, sit enthroned, Jerusalem; Loose the bonds from your neck, captive daughter Zion!
52:3 For thus says the : For nothing you were sold, without money you shall be redeemed.
52:4 For thus says the Lord : To Egypt long ago my people went down, to sojourn there; Assyria, too, oppressed them for nought.
52:5 But now, what am I to do here? —oracle of the . My people have been taken away for nothing; their rulers mock, oracle of the ; constantly, every day, my name is reviled.
52:6 Therefore my people shall know my name on that day, that it is I who speaks: Here I am!
52:7 How beautiful upon the mountains are the feet of the one bringing good news, Announcing peace, bearing good news, announcing salvation, saying to Zion, Your God is King!
52:8 Listen! Your sentinels raise a cry, together they shout for joy, For they see directly, before their eyes, the s return to Zion.
52:9 Break out together in song, O ruins of Jerusalem! For the has comforted his people, has redeemed Jerusalem.
52:10 The has bared his holy arm in the sight of all the nations; All the ends of the earth can see the salvation of our God.
52:11 Depart, depart, go out from there, touch nothing unclean! Out from there! Purify yourselves, you who carry the vessels of the .
52:12 But not in hurried flight will you go out, nor leave in headlong haste, For the goes before you, and your rear guard is the God of Israel.
52:13 See, my servant shall prosper, he shall be raised high and greatly exalted.
52:14 Even as many were amazed at him— so marred were his features, beyond that of mortals his appearance, beyond that of human beings—
52:15 So shall he startle many nations, kings shall stand speechless; For those who have not been told shall see, those who have not heard shall ponder it.
53:1 Who would believe what we have heard? To whom has the arm of the been revealed?
53:2 He grew up like a sapling before him, like a shoot from the parched earth; He had no majestic bearing to catch our eye, no beauty to draw us to him.
53:3 He was spurned and avoided by men, a man of suffering, knowing pain, Like one from whom you turn your face, spurned, and we held him in no esteem.
53:4 Yet it was our pain that he bore, our sufferings he endured. We thought of him as stricken, struck down by God and afflicted,
53:5 But he was pierced for our sins, crushed for our iniquity. He bore the punishment that makes us whole, by his wounds we were healed.
53:6 We had all gone astray like sheep, all following our own way; But the laid upon him the guilt of us all.
53:7 Though harshly treated, he submitted and did not open his mouth; Like a lamb led to slaughter or a sheep silent before shearers, he did not open his mouth.
53:8 Seized and condemned, he was taken away. Who would have thought any more of his destiny? For he was cut off from the land of the living, struck for the sins of his people.
53:9 He was given a grave among the wicked, a burial place with evildoers, Though he had done no wrong, nor was deceit found in his mouth.
53:10 But it was the s will to crush him with pain. By making his life as a reparation offering, he shall see his offspring, shall lengthen his days, and the s will shall be accomplished through him.
53:11 Because of his anguish he shall see the light; because of his knowledge he shall be content; My servant, the just one, shall justify the many, their iniquity he shall bear.
53:12 Therefore I will give him his portion among the many, and he shall divide the spoils with the mighty, Because he surrendered himself to death, was counted among the transgressors, Bore the sins of many, and interceded for the transgressors.
54:1 Raise a glad cry, you barren one who never bore a child, break forth in jubilant song, you who have never been in labor, For more numerous are the children of the deserted wife than the children of her who has a husband, says the .
54:2 Enlarge the space for your tent, spread out your tent cloths unsparingly; lengthen your ropes and make firm your pegs.
54:3 For you shall spread abroad to the right and left; your descendants shall dispossess the nations and shall people the deserted cities.
54:4 Do not fear, you shall not be put to shame; do not be discouraged, you shall not be disgraced. For the shame of your youth you shall forget, the reproach of your widowhood no longer remember.
54:5 For your husband is your Maker; the of hosts is his name, Your redeemer, the Holy One of Israel, called God of all the earth.
54:6 The calls you back, like a wife forsaken and grieved in spirit, A wife married in youth and then cast off, says your God.
54:7 For a brief moment I abandoned you, but with great tenderness I will take you back.
54:8 In an outburst of wrath, for a moment I hid my face from you; But with enduring love I take pity on you, says the , your redeemer.
54:9 This is for me like the days of Noah: As I swore then that the waters of Noah should never again flood the earth, So I have sworn now not to be angry with you, or to rebuke you.
54:10 Though the mountains fall away and the hills be shaken, My love shall never fall away from you nor my covenant of peace be shaken, says the , who has mercy on you.
54:11 O afflicted one, storm-battered and unconsoled, I lay your pavements in carnelians, your foundations in sapphires;
54:12 I will make your battlements of rubies, your gates of jewels, and all your walls of precious stones.
54:13 All your children shall be taught by the ; great shall be the peace of your children.
54:14 In justice shall you be established, far from oppression, you shall not fear, from destruction, it cannot come near.
54:15 If there be an attack, it is not my doing; whoever attacks shall fall before you.
54:16 See, I have created the smith who blows on the burning coals and forges weapons as his work; It is I also who have created the destroyer to work havoc.
54:17 Every weapon fashioned against you shall fail; every tongue that brings you to trial you shall prove false. This is the lot of the servants of the , their vindication from me—oracle of the .
55:1 All you who are thirsty, come to the water! You who have no money, come, buy grain and eat; Come, buy grain without money, wine and milk without cost!
55:2 Why spend your money for what is not bread; your wages for what does not satisfy? Only listen to me, and you shall eat well, you shall delight in rich fare.
55:3 Pay attention and come to me; listen, that you may have life. I will make with you an everlasting covenant, the steadfast loyalty promised to David.
55:4 As I made him a witness to peoples, a leader and commander of peoples,
55:5 So shall you summon a nation you knew not, and a nation that knew you not shall run to you, Because of the , your God, the Holy One of Israel, who has glorified you.
55:6 Seek the while he may be found, call upon him while he is near.
55:7 Let the wicked forsake their way, and sinners their thoughts; Let them turn to the to find mercy; to our God, who is generous in forgiving.
55:8 For my thoughts are not your thoughts, nor are your ways my ways—oracle of the .
55:9 For as the heavens are higher than the earth, so are my ways higher than your ways, my thoughts higher than your thoughts.
55:10 Yet just as from the heavens the rain and snow come down And do not return there till they have watered the earth, making it fertile and fruitful, Giving seed to the one who sows and bread to the one who eats,
55:11 So shall my word be that goes forth from my mouth; It shall not return to me empty, but shall do what pleases me, achieving the end for which I sent it.
55:12 Yes, in joy you shall go forth, in peace you shall be brought home; Mountains and hills shall break out in song before you, all trees of the field shall clap their hands.
55:13 In place of the thornbush, the cypress shall grow, instead of nettles, the myrtle. This shall be to the s renown, as an everlasting sign that shall not fail.
56:1 Thus says the : Observe what is right, do what is just, for my salvation is about to come, my justice, about to be revealed.
56:2 Happy is the one who does this, whoever holds fast to it: Keeping the sabbath without profaning it, keeping ones hand from doing any evil.
56:3 The foreigner joined to the should not say, The will surely exclude me from his people; Nor should the eunuch say, See, I am a dry tree.
56:4 For thus says the : To the eunuchs who keep my sabbaths, who choose what pleases me, and who hold fast to my covenant,
56:5 I will give them, in my house and within my walls, a monument and a name Better than sons and daughters; an eternal name, which shall not be cut off, will I give them.
56:6 And foreigners who join themselves to the , to minister to him, To love the name of the , to become his servants— All who keep the sabbath without profaning it and hold fast to my covenant,
56:7 Them I will bring to my holy mountain and make them joyful in my house of prayer; Their burnt offerings and their sacrifices will be acceptable on my altar, For my house shall be called a house of prayer for all peoples.
56:8 Oracle of the Lord , who gathers the dispersed of Israel— Others will I gather to them besides those already gathered.
56:9 All you beasts of the field, come to devour, all you beasts in the forest!
56:10 All the sentinels of Israel are blind, they are without knowledge; They are all mute dogs, unable to bark; Dreaming, reclining, loving their sleep.
56:11 Yes, the dogs have a ravenous appetite; they never know satiety, Shepherds who have no understanding; all have turned their own way, each one covetous for gain:
56:12 Come, let me bring wine; let us fill ourselves with strong drink, And tomorrow will be like today, or even greater.
57:1 The just have perished, but no one takes it to heart; The steadfast are swept away, while no one understands. Yet the just are taken away from the presence of evil,
57:2 and enter into peace; They rest upon their couches, the sincere, who walk in integrity.
57:3 But you, draw near, you children of a sorceress, offspring of an adulterer and a prostitute!
57:4 Against whom do you make sport, against whom do you open wide your mouth, and stick out your tongue? Are you not rebellious children, deceitful offspring—
57:5 You who burn with lust among the oaks, under every green tree; You who immolate children in the wadies, among the clefts of the rocks?
57:6 Among the smooth stones of the wadi is your portion, they, they are your allotment; Indeed, you poured out a drink offering to them, and brought up grain offerings. With these things, should I be appeased?
57:7 Upon a towering and lofty mountain you set up your bed, and there you went up to offer sacrifice.
57:8 Behind the door and the doorpost you set up your symbol. Yes, deserting me, you carried up your bedding; and spread it wide. You entered an agreement with them, you loved their couch, you gazed upon nakedness.
57:9 You approached the king with oil, and multiplied your perfumes; You sent your ambassadors far away, down even to deepest Sheol.
57:10 Though worn out with the length of your journey, you never said, It is hopeless; You found your strength revived, and so you did not weaken.
57:11 Whom did you dread and fear, that you told lies, And me you did not remember nor take to heart? Am I to keep silent and conceal, while you show no fear of me?
57:12 I will proclaim your justice and your works; but they shall not help you.
57:13 When you cry out, let your collection of idols save you. All these the wind shall carry off, a mere breath shall bear them away; But whoever takes refuge in me shall inherit the land, and possess my holy mountain.
57:14 And I say: Build up, build up, prepare the way, remove every obstacle from my peoples way.
57:15 For thus says the high and lofty One, the One who dwells forever, whose name is holy: I dwell in a high and holy place, but also with the contrite and lowly of spirit, To revive the spirit of the lowly, to revive the heart of the crushed.
57:16 For I will not accuse forever, nor always be angry; For without me their spirit fails, the life breath that I have given.
57:17 Because of their wicked avarice I grew angry; I struck them, hiding myself from them in wrath. But they turned back, following the way of their own heart.
57:18 I saw their ways, but I will heal them. I will lead them and restore full comfort to them and to those who mourn for them,
57:19 creating words of comfort. Peace! Peace to those who are far and near, says the ; and I will heal them.
57:20 But the wicked are like the tossing sea which cannot be still, Its waters cast up mire and mud.
57:21 There is no peace for the wicked! says my God.
58:1 Cry out full-throated and unsparingly, lift up your voice like a trumpet blast; Proclaim to my people their transgression, to the house of Jacob their sins.
58:2 They seek me day after day, and desire to know my ways, Like a nation that has done what is just and not abandoned the judgment of their God; They ask of me just judgments, they desire to draw near to God.
58:3 Why do we fast, but you do not see it? afflict ourselves, but you take no note? See, on your fast day you carry out your own pursuits, and drive all your laborers.
58:4 See, you fast only to quarrel and fight and to strike with a wicked fist! Do not fast as you do today to make your voice heard on high!
58:5 Is this the manner of fasting I would choose, a day to afflict oneself? To bow ones head like a reed, and lie upon sackcloth and ashes? Is this what you call a fast, a day acceptable to the ?
58:6 Is this not, rather, the fast that I choose: releasing those bound unjustly, untying the thongs of the yoke; Setting free the oppressed, breaking off every yoke?
58:7 Is it not sharing your bread with the hungry, bringing the afflicted and the homeless into your house; Clothing the naked when you see them, and not turning your back on your own flesh?
58:8 Then your light shall break forth like the dawn, and your wound shall quickly be healed; Your vindication shall go before you, and the glory of the shall be your rear guard.
58:9 Then you shall call, and the will answer, you shall cry for help, and he will say: Here I am! If you remove the yoke from among you, the accusing finger, and malicious speech;
58:10 If you lavish your food on the hungry and satisfy the afflicted; Then your light shall rise in the darkness, and your gloom shall become like midday;
58:11 Then the will guide you always and satisfy your thirst in parched places, will give strength to your bones And you shall be like a watered garden, like a flowing spring whose waters never fail.
58:12 Your people shall rebuild the ancient ruins; the foundations from ages past you shall raise up; Repairer of the breach, they shall call you, Restorer of ruined dwellings.
58:13 If you refrain from trampling the sabbath, from following your own pursuits on my holy day; If you call the sabbath a delight, the s holy day glorious; If you glorify it by not following your ways, seeking your own interests, or pursuing your own affairs—
58:14 Then you shall delight in the , and I will make you ride upon the heights of the earth; I will nourish you with the heritage of Jacob, your father, for the mouth of the has spoken.
59:1 No, the hand of the is not too short to save, nor his ear too dull to hear.
59:2 Rather, it is your crimes that separate you from your God, It is your sins that make him hide his face so that he does not hear you.
59:3 For your hands are defiled with blood, and your fingers with crime; Your lips speak falsehood, and your tongue utters deceit.
59:4 No one brings suit justly, no one pleads truthfully; They trust an empty plea and tell lies; they conceive mischief and bring forth malice.
59:5 They hatch adders eggs, and weave spiders webs: Whoever eats the eggs will die, if one of them is crushed, it will hatch a viper;
59:6 Their webs cannot serve as clothing, nor can they cover themselves with their works. Their works are evil works, and deeds of violence are in their hands.
59:7 Their feet run to evil, and they hasten to shed innocent blood; Their thoughts are thoughts of wickedness, violence and destruction are on their highways.
59:8 The way of peace they know not, and there is no justice on their paths; Their roads they have made crooked, no one who walks in them knows peace.
59:9 That is why judgment is far from us and justice does not reach us. We look for light, but there is darkness; for brightness, and we walk in gloom!
59:10 Like those who are blind we grope along the wall, like people without eyes we feel our way. We stumble at midday as if at twilight, among the vigorous, we are like the dead.
59:11 Like bears we all growl, like doves we moan without ceasing. We cry out for justice, but it is not there; for salvation, but it is far from us.
59:12 For our transgressions before you are many, our sins bear witness against us. Our transgressions are present to us, and our crimes we acknowledge:
59:13 Transgressing, and denying the , turning back from following our God, Planning fraud and treachery, uttering lying words conceived in the heart.
59:14 Judgment is turned away, and justice stands far off; For truth stumbles in the public square, and uprightness cannot enter.
59:15 Fidelity is lacking, and whoever turns from evil is despoiled. The saw this, and was aggrieved that there was no justice.
59:16 He saw that there was no one, was appalled that there was none to intervene; Then his own arm brought about the victory, and his justice sustained him.
59:17 He put on justice as his breastplate, victory as a helmet on his head; He clothed himself with garments of vengeance, wrapped himself in a mantle of zeal.
59:18 According to their deeds he repays his enemies and requites his foes with wrath; to the coastlands he renders recompense.
59:19 Those in the west shall fear the name of the , and those in the east, his glory, Coming like a pent-up stream driven on by the breath of the .
59:20 Then for Zion shall come a redeemer, to those in Jacob who turn from transgression—oracle of the .
59:21 This is my covenant with them, which I myself have made, says the : My spirit which is upon you and my words that I have put in your mouth Shall not depart from your mouth, nor from the mouths of your children Nor the mouths of your childrens children from this time forth and forever, says the .
60:1 Arise! Shine, for your light has come, the glory of the has dawned upon you.
60:2 Though darkness covers the earth, and thick clouds, the peoples, Upon you the will dawn, and over you his glory will be seen.
60:3 Nations shall walk by your light, kings by the radiance of your dawning.
60:4 Raise your eyes and look about; they all gather and come to you— Your sons from afar, your daughters in the arms of their nurses.
60:5 Then you shall see and be radiant, your heart shall throb and overflow. For the riches of the sea shall be poured out before you, the wealth of nations shall come to you.
60:6 Caravans of camels shall cover you, dromedaries of Midian and Ephah; All from Sheba shall come bearing gold and frankincense, and heralding the praises of the .
60:7 All the flocks of Kedar shall be gathered for you, the rams of Nebaioth shall serve your needs; They will be acceptable offerings on my altar, and I will glorify my glorious house.
60:8 Who are these that fly along like a cloud, like doves to their cotes?
60:9 The vessels of the coastlands are gathering, with the ships of Tarshish in the lead, To bring your children from afar, their silver and gold with them— For the name of the , your God, for the Holy One of Israel who has glorified you.
60:10 Foreigners shall rebuild your walls, their kings shall minister to you; Though in my wrath I struck you, yet in my good will I have shown you mercy.
60:11 Your gates shall stand open constantly; day and night they shall not be closed So that they may bring you the wealth of nations, with their kings in the vanguard.
60:12 For the nation or kingdom that will not serve you shall perish; such nations shall be utterly destroyed!
60:13 The glory of Lebanon shall come to you— the juniper, the fir, and the cypress all together— To bring beauty to my sanctuary, and glory to the place where I stand.
60:14 The children of your oppressors shall come, bowing before you; All those who despised you, shall bow low at your feet. They shall call you City of the , Zion of the Holy One of Israel.
60:15 No longer forsaken and hated, with no one passing through, Now I will make you the pride of the ages, a joy from generation to generation.
60:16 You shall suck the milk of nations, and be nursed at royal breasts; And you shall know that I, the , am your savior, your redeemer, the Mighty One of Jacob.
60:17 Instead of bronze I will bring gold, instead of iron I will bring silver; Instead of wood, bronze; instead of stones, iron. I will appoint peace your governor, and justice your ruler.
60:18 No longer shall violence be heard of in your land, or plunder and ruin within your borders. You shall call your walls Salvation and your gates Praise.
60:19 No longer shall the sun be your light by day, Nor shall the brightness of the moon give you light by night; Rather, the will be your light forever, your God will be your glory.
60:20 No longer will your sun set, or your moon wane; For the will be your light forever, and the days of your grieving will be over.
60:21 Your people will all be just; for all time they will possess the land; They are the shoot that I planted, the work of my hands, that I might be glorified.
60:22 The least one shall become a clan, the smallest, a mighty nation; I, the , will swiftly accomplish these things when the time comes.
61:1 The spirit of the Lord is upon me, because the has anointed me; He has sent me to bring good news to the afflicted, to bind up the brokenhearted, To proclaim liberty to the captives, release to the prisoners,
61:2 To announce a year of favor from the and a day of vindication by our God; To comfort all who mourn;
61:3 to place on those who mourn in Zion a diadem instead of ashes, To give them oil of gladness instead of mourning, a glorious mantle instead of a faint spirit. They will be called oaks of justice, the planting of the to show his glory.
61:4 They shall rebuild the ancient ruins, the former wastes they shall raise up And restore the desolate cities, devastations of generation upon generation.
61:5 Strangers shall stand ready to pasture your flocks, foreigners shall be your farmers and vinedressers.
61:6 You yourselves shall be called Priests of the , Ministers of our God you shall be called. You shall eat the wealth of the nations and in their riches you will boast.
61:7 Because their shame was twofold and disgrace was proclaimed their portion, They will possess twofold in their own land; everlasting joy shall be theirs.
61:8 For I, the , love justice, I hate robbery and wrongdoing; I will faithfully give them their recompense, an everlasting covenant I will make with them.
61:9 Their offspring shall be renowned among the nations, and their descendants in the midst of the peoples; All who see them shall acknowledge them: They are offspring the has blessed.
61:10 I will rejoice heartily in the , my being exults in my God; For he has clothed me with garments of salvation, and wrapped me in a robe of justice, Like a bridegroom adorned with a diadem, as a bride adorns herself with her jewels.
61:11 As the earth brings forth its shoots, and a garden makes its seeds spring up, So will the Lord make justice spring up, and praise before all the nations.

63:1 Who is this that comes from Edom, in crimsoned garments, from Bozrah? Who is this, glorious in his apparel, striding in the greatness of his strength? It is I, I who announce vindication, mighty to save.
63:2 Why is your apparel red, and your garments like one who treads the wine press?
63:3 The wine press I have trodden alone, and from the peoples no one was with me. I trod them in my anger, and trampled them down in my wrath; Their blood spurted on my garments, all my apparel I stained.
63:4 For a day of vindication was in my heart, my year for redeeming had come.
63:5 I looked about, but there was no one to help, I was appalled that there was no one to lend support; So my own arm brought me victory and my own wrath lent me support.
63:6 I trampled down the peoples in my anger, I made them drunk in my wrath, and I poured out their blood upon the ground.
63:7 The loving deeds of the I will recall, the glorious acts of the , Because of all the has done for us, the immense goodness to the house of Israel, Which he has granted according to his mercy and his many loving deeds.
63:8 He said: They are indeed my people, children who are not disloyal. So he became their savior
63:9 in their every affliction. It was not an envoy or a messenger, but his presence that saved them. Because of his love and pity the redeemed them, Lifting them up and carrying them all the days of old.
63:10 But they rebelled and grieved his holy spirit; So he turned to become their enemy, and warred against them.
63:11 Then they remembered the days of old, of Moses, his servant: Where is the one who brought up out of the sea the shepherd of his flock? Where is the one who placed in their midst his holy spirit,
63:12 Who guided Moses by the hand, with his glorious arm? Where is the one who divided the waters before them— winning for himself an everlasting renown—
63:13 Who guided them through the depths, like horses in open country?
63:14 As cattle going down into the valley, they did not stumble. The spirit of the guided them. Thus you led your people, to make for yourself a glorious name.
63:15 Look down from heaven and regard us from your holy and glorious palace! Where is your zealous care and your might, your surge of pity? Your mercy hold not back!
63:16 For you are our father. Were Abraham not to know us, nor Israel to acknowledge us, You, , are our father, our redeemer you are named from of old.
63:17 Why do you make us wander, , from your ways, and harden our hearts so that we do not fear you? Return for the sake of your servants, the tribes of your heritage.
63:18 Why have the wicked invaded your holy place, why have our enemies trampled your sanctuary?
63:19 Too long have we been like those you do not rule, on whom your name is not invoked. Oh, that you would rend the heavens and come down, with the mountains quaking before you,
64:1 As when brushwood is set ablaze, or fire makes the water boil! Then your name would be made known to your enemies and the nations would tremble before you,
64:2 While you worked awesome deeds we could not hope for,
64:3 such as had not been heard of from of old. No ear has ever heard, no eye ever seen, any God but you working such deeds for those who wait for him.
64:4 Would that you might meet us doing right, that we might be mindful of you in our ways! Indeed, you are angry; we have sinned, we have acted wickedly.
64:5 We have all become like something unclean, all our just deeds are like polluted rags; We have all withered like leaves, and our crimes carry us away like the wind.
64:6 There are none who call upon your name, none who rouse themselves to take hold of you; For you have hidden your face from us and have delivered us up to our crimes.
64:7 Yet, , you are our father; we are the clay and you our potter: we are all the work of your hand.
64:8 Do not be so very angry, , do not remember our crimes forever; look upon us, who are all your people!
64:9 Your holy cities have become a wilderness; Zion has become wilderness, Jerusalem desolation!
64:10 Our holy and glorious house in which our ancestors praised you Has been burned with fire; all that was dear to us is laid waste.
64:11 Can you hold back, , after all this? Can you remain silent, and afflict us so severely?
65:1 I was ready to respond to those who did not ask, to be found by those who did not seek me. I said: Here I am! Here I am! To a nation that did not invoke my name.
65:2 I have stretched out my hands all day to a rebellious people, Who walk in a way that is not good, following their own designs;
65:3 A people who provoke me continually to my face, Offering sacrifices in gardens and burning incense on bricks,
65:4 Sitting in tombs and spending the night in caves, Eating the flesh of pigs, with broth of unclean meat in their dishes;
65:5 Crying out, Hold back, do not come near me, lest I render you holy! These things are smoke in my nostrils, a fire that burns all the day.
65:6 See, it stands written before me; I will not remain quiet until I have repaid in full
65:7 Your crimes and the crimes of your ancestors as well, says the . Since they burned incense on the mountains, and insulted me on the hills, I will at once pour out in full measure their recompense into their laps.
65:8 Thus says the : As when the juice is pressed from a cluster, and someone says, Do not destroy it, for there is still good in it, So will I do for the sake of my servants: I will not destroy them all.
65:9 From Jacob I will bring forth offspring, from Judah, those who are to possess my mountains; My chosen ones shall possess the land, my servants shall dwell there.
65:10 Sharon shall become a pasture for the flocks, the Valley of Achor a resting place for the cattle, for my people who have sought me.
65:11 But you who forsake the , who forget my holy mountain, Who spread a table for Fortune and fill cups of mixed wine for Destiny,
65:12 You I will destine for the sword; you shall all bow down for slaughter; Because I called and you did not answer, I spoke and you did not listen, But did what is evil in my sight and things I do not delight in, you chose,
65:13 therefore thus says the Lord : My servants shall eat, but you shall go hungry; My servants shall drink, but you shall be thirsty; My servants shall rejoice, but you shall be put to shame;
65:14 My servants shall shout for joy of heart, But you shall cry out for grief of heart, and howl for anguish of spirit.
65:15 You will leave your name for a curse to my chosen ones when the Lord slays you, and calls his servants by another name.
65:16 Whoever invokes a blessing in the land shall bless by the God of truth; Whoever takes an oath in the land shall swear by the God of truth; For the hardships of the past shall be forgotten and hidden from my eyes.
65:17 See, I am creating new heavens and a new earth; The former things shall not be remembered nor come to mind.
65:18 Instead, shout for joy and be glad forever in what I am creating. Indeed, I am creating Jerusalem to be a joy and its people to be a delight;
65:19 I will rejoice in Jerusalem and exult in my people. No longer shall the sound of weeping be heard there, or the sound of crying;
65:20 No longer shall there be in it an infant who lives but a few days, nor anyone who does not live a full lifetime; One who dies at a hundred years shall be considered a youth, and one who falls short of a hundred shall be thought accursed.
65:21 They shall build houses and live in them, they shall plant vineyards and eat their fruit;
65:22 They shall not build and others live there; they shall not plant and others eat. As the years of a tree, so the years of my people; and my chosen ones shall long enjoy the work of their hands.
65:23 They shall not toil in vain, nor beget children for sudden destruction; For they shall be a people blessed by the and their descendants with them.
65:24 Before they call, I will answer; while they are yet speaking, I will hear.
65:25 The wolf and the lamb shall pasture together, and the lion shall eat hay like the ox— but the serpents food shall be dust. None shall harm or destroy on all my holy mountain, says the .
66:1 Thus says the : The heavens are my throne, the earth, my footstool. What house can you build for me? Where is the place of my rest?
66:2 My hand made all these things when all of them came to be—oracle of the . This is the one whom I approve: the afflicted one, crushed in spirit, who trembles at my word.
66:3 The one slaughtering an ox, striking a man, sacrificing a lamb, breaking a dogs neck, Making an offering of pigs blood, burning incense, honoring an idol— These have chosen their own ways, and taken pleasure in their own abominations.
66:4 I in turn will choose affliction for them and bring upon them what they fear. Because when I called, no one answered, when I spoke, no one listened. Because they did what was evil in my sight, and things I do not delight in they chose,
66:5 Hear the word of the , you who tremble at his word! Your kin who hate you and cast you out because of my name say, May the show his glory, that we may see your joy; but they shall be put to shame.
66:6 A voice roaring from the city, a voice from the temple; The voice of the rendering recompense to his enemies!
66:7 Before she is in labor, she gives birth; Before her pangs come upon her, she delivers a male child.
66:8 Who ever heard of such a thing, or who ever saw the like? Can a land be brought forth in one day, or a nation be born in a single moment? Yet Zion was scarcely in labor when she bore her children.
66:9 Shall I bring a mother to the point of birth, and yet not let her child be born? says the . Or shall I who bring to birth yet close her womb? says your God.
66:10 Rejoice with Jerusalem and be glad because of her, all you who love her; Rejoice with her in her joy, all you who mourn over her—
66:11 So that you may nurse and be satisfied from her consoling breast; That you may drink with delight at her abundant breasts!
66:12 For thus says the : I will spread prosperity over her like a river, like an overflowing torrent, the wealth of nations. You shall nurse, carried in her arms, cradled upon her knees;
66:13 As a mother comforts her child, so I will comfort you; in Jerusalem you shall find your comfort.
66:14 You will see and your heart shall exult, and your bodies shall flourish like the grass; The s power shall be revealed to his servants, but to his enemies, his wrath.
66:15 For see, the will come in fire, his chariots like the stormwind; To wreak his anger in burning rage and his rebuke in fiery flames.
66:16 For with fire the shall enter into judgment, and, with his sword, against all flesh; Those slain by the shall be many.
66:17 Those who sanctify and purify themselves to go into the gardens, following one who stands within, eating pigs flesh, abominable things, and mice, shall all together come to an end, with their deeds and purposes—oracle of the .
66:18 I am coming to gather all nations and tongues; they shall come and see my glory.
66:19 I will place a sign among them; from them I will send survivors to the nations: to Tarshish, Put and Lud, Mosoch, Tubal and Javan, to the distant coastlands which have never heard of my fame, or seen my glory; and they shall proclaim my glory among the nations.
66:20 They shall bring all your kin from all the nations as an offering to the , on horses and in chariots, in carts, upon mules and dromedaries, to Jerusalem, my holy mountain, says the , just as the Israelites bring their grain offering in a clean vessel to the house of the .
66:21 Some of these I will take as priests and Levites, says the .
66:22 Just as the new heavens and the new earth which I am making Shall endure before me—oracle of the — so shall your descendants and your name endure.
66:23 From new moon to new moon, and from sabbath to sabbath, All flesh shall come to worship before me, says the .
66:24 They shall go out and see the corpses of the people who rebelled against me; For their worm shall not die, their fire shall not be extinguished; and they shall be an abhorrence to all flesh.
JEREMIAH
1:1 The words of Jeremiah, son of Hilkiah, one of the priests from Anathoth, in the land of Benjamin.
1:2 The word of the came to him in the days of Josiah, son of Amon, king of Judah, in the thirteenth year of his reign,
1:3 and again in the days of Jehoiakim, son of Josiah, king of Judah, until the end of the eleventh year of Zedekiah, son of Josiah, king of Judah—down to the exile of Jerusalem, in the fifth month.
1:4 The word of the came to me:
1:5 Before I formed you in the womb I knew you, before you were born I dedicated you, a prophet to the nations I appointed you.
1:6 Ah, Lord ! I said, I do not know how to speak. I am too young!
1:7 But the answered me, Do not say, I am too young. To whomever I send you, you shall go; whatever I command you, you shall speak.
1:8 Do not be afraid of them, for I am with you to deliver you—oracle of the .
1:9 Then the extended his hand and touched my mouth, saying to me, See, I place my words in your mouth!
1:10 Today I appoint you over nations and over kingdoms, To uproot and to tear down, to destroy and to demolish, to build and to plant.
1:11 The word of the came to me: What do you see, Jeremiah? I see a branch of the almond tree, I replied.
1:12 Then the said to me: You have seen well, for I am watching over my word to carry it out.
1:13 A second time the word of the came to me: What do you see? I replied, I see a boiling kettle whose mouth is tipped away from the north.
1:14 The said to me, And from the north evil will pour out over all who dwell in the land.
1:15 Look, I am summoning all the kingdoms of the north—oracle of the — Each king shall come and set up his throne in the gateways of Jerusalem, Against all its surrounding walls and against all the cities of Judah.
1:16 I will pronounce my sentence against them for all their wickedness in forsaking me, In burning incense to other gods, in bowing down to the works of their hands.
1:17 But you, prepare yourself; stand up and tell them all that I command you. Do not be terrified on account of them, or I will terrify you before them;
1:18 For I am the one who today makes you a fortified city, A pillar of iron, a wall of bronze, against the whole land: Against Judahs kings and princes, its priests and the people of the land.
1:19 They will fight against you, but not prevail over you, for I am with you to deliver you—oracle of the .
2:1 The word of the came to me:
2:2 Go, cry out this message for Jerusalem to hear! I remember the devotion of your youth, how you loved me as a bride, Following me in the wilderness, in a land unsown.
2:3 Israel was dedicated to the , the first fruits of his harvest; All who ate of it were held guilty, evil befell them—oracle of the .
2:4 Listen to the word of the , house of Jacob! All you clans of the house of Israel,
2:5 thus says the : What fault did your ancestors find in me that they withdrew from me, Went after emptiness, and became empty themselves?
2:6 They did not ask, Where is the who brought us up from the land of Egypt, Who led us through the wilderness, through a land of wastes and ravines, A land of drought and darkness, a land which no one crosses, where no one dwells?
2:7 I brought you into the garden land to eat its fine fruits, But you entered and defiled my land, you turned my heritage into an abomination.
2:8 The priests did not ask, Where is the ? The experts in the law did not know me: the shepherds rebelled against me. The prophets prophesied by Baal, and went after useless idols.
2:9 Therefore I will again accuse you—oracle of the — even your childrens children I will accuse.
2:10 Cross to the coast of Cyprus and see, send to Kedar and carefully inquire: Where has anything like this been done?
2:11 Does any other nation change its gods?— even though they are not gods at all! But my people have changed their glory for useless things.
2:12 Be horrified at this, heavens; shudder, be appalled—oracle of the .
2:13 Two evils my people have done: they have forsaken me, the source of living waters; They have dug themselves cisterns, broken cisterns that cannot hold water.
2:14 Is Israel a slave, a house-born servant? Why then has he become plunder?
2:15 Against him lions roar, they raise their voices. They have turned his land into a waste; his cities are charred ruins, without an inhabitant.
2:16 Yes, the people of Memphis and Tahpanhes shave the crown of your head.
2:17 Has not forsaking the , your God, done this to you?
2:18 And now, why go to Egypt, to drink the waters of the Nile? Why go to Assyria, to drink the waters of the River?
2:19 Your own wickedness chastises you, your own infidelities punish you. Know then, and see, how evil and bitter is your forsaking the , your God, And your showing no fear of me, oracle of the Lord, the of hosts.
2:20 Long ago you broke your yoke, you tore off your bonds. You said, I will not serve. On every high hill, under every green tree, you sprawled and served as a prostitute.
2:21 But I had planted you as a choice vine, all pedigreed stock; How could you turn out so obnoxious to me, a spurious vine?
2:22 Even if you scour it with lye, and use much soap, The stain of your guilt is still before me, oracle of the Lord .
2:23 How can you say, I am not defiled, I have not pursued the Baals? Consider your conduct in the Valley, recall what you have done: A skittish young camel, running back and forth,
2:24 a wild donkey bred in the wilderness, Sniffing the wind in her desire— who can restrain her lust? None seeking her need tire themselves; in her time they will find her.
2:25 Stop wearing out your feet and parching your throat! But you say, No use! No! How I love these strangers, after them I must go.
2:26 As the thief is shamed when caught, so shall the house of Israel be shamed: They, their kings, their princes, their priests and their prophets;
2:27 They say to a piece of wood, You are my father, and to a stone, You gave me birth. They turn their backs to me, not their faces; yet in their time of trouble they cry out, Rise up and save us!
2:28 Where are the gods you made for yourselves? Let them rise up! Will they save you in your time of trouble? For as numerous as your cities are your gods, O Judah! And as many as the streets of Jerusalem are the altars you have set up for Baal.
2:29 Why are you arguing with me? You have all rebelled against me—oracle of the .
2:30 In vain I struck your children; correction they did not take. Your sword devoured your prophets like a ravening lion.
2:31 You people of this generation, consider the word of the Lord: Have I become a wilderness to Israel, a land of gloom? Why then do my people say, We have moved on, we will not come to you any more?
2:32 Does a young woman forget her jewelry, a bride her sash? Yet my people have forgotten me days without number.
2:33 How well you pick your way when seeking love! In your wickedness, you have gone by ways unclean!
2:34 On your clothing is the life-blood of the innocent, you did not find them committing burglary;
2:35 Nonetheless you say, I am innocent; at least, his anger is turned away from me. Listen! I will judge you on that word of yours, I have not sinned.
2:36 How frivolous you have become in changing your course! By Egypt you will be shamed, just as you were shamed by Assyria.
2:37 From there too you will go out, your hands upon your head; For the has rejected those in whom you trust, with them you will have no success.
3:1 If a man divorces his wife and she leaves him and then becomes the wife of another, Can she return to the first? Would not this land be wholly defiled? But you have played the prostitute with many lovers, and yet you would return to me!—oracle of the .
3:2 Raise your eyes to the heights, and look, where have men not lain with you? Along the roadways you waited for them like an Arabian in the wilderness. You defiled the land by your wicked prostitution.
3:3 Therefore the showers were withheld, the spring rain did not fall. But because you have a prostitutes brow, you refused to be ashamed.
3:4 Even now do you not call me, My father, you are the bridegroom of my youth?
3:5 Will he keep his wrath forever, will he hold his grudge to the end? This is what you say; yet you do all the evil you can.
3:6 The said to me in the days of King Josiah: Do you see what rebellious Israel has done? She has gone up every high mountain, and under every green tree she has played the prostitute.
3:7 And I thought: After she has done all this, she will return to me. But she did not return. Then, even though that traitor her sister Judah, saw
3:8 that, in response to all the adulteries rebel Israel had committed, I sent her away and gave her a bill of divorce, nevertheless Judah, the traitor, her sister, was not frightened; she too went off and played the prostitute.
3:9 With her casual prostitution, she polluted the land, committing adultery with stone and wood.
3:10 In spite of all this, Judah, the traitor, her sister, did not return to me wholeheartedly, but insincerely—oracle of the .
3:11 Then the said to me: Rebel Israel is more just than traitor Judah.
3:12 Go, proclaim these words toward the north, and say: Return, rebel Israel—oracle of the — I will not remain angry with you; For I am merciful, oracle of the , I will not keep my anger forever.
3:13 Only admit your guilt: how you have rebelled against the , your God, How you ran here and there to strangers under every green tree and would not listen to my voice—oracle of the .
3:14 Return, rebellious children—oracle of the — for I am your master; I will take you, one from a city, two from a clan, and bring you to Zion.
3:15 I will appoint for you shepherds after my own heart, who will shepherd you wisely and prudently.
3:16 When you increase in number and are fruitful in the land— oracle of the — They will in those days no longer say, The ark of the covenant of the ! They will no longer think of it, or remember it, or miss it, or make another one.
3:17 At that time they will call Jerusalem the s throne. All nations will gather together there to honor the name of the at Jerusalem, and they will no longer stubbornly follow their wicked heart.
3:18 In those days the house of Judah will walk alongside the house of Israel; together they will come from the land of the north to the land which I gave your ancestors as a heritage.
3:19 I thought: How I would like to make you my children! So I gave you a pleasant land, the most beautiful heritage among the nations! You would call me, My Father, I thought, and you would never turn away from me.
3:20 But like a woman faithless to her lover, thus have you been faithless to me, house of Israel—oracle of the .
3:21 A cry is heard on the heights! the plaintive weeping of Israels children, Because they have perverted their way, they have forgotten the , their God.
3:22 Return, rebellious children! I will heal your rebellions. Here we are! We belong to you, for you are the , our God.
3:23 Deceptive indeed are the hills, the mountains, clamorous; Only in the our God is Israels salvation.
3:24 The shameful thing has devoured our ancestors worth from our youth, Their sheep and cattle, their sons and daughters.
3:25 Let us lie down in our shame, let our disgrace cover us, for we have sinned against the , our God, We and our ancestors, from our youth to this day; we did not listen to the voice of the , our God.
4:1 If you return, Israel—oracle of the — return to me. If you put your detestable things out of my sight, and do not stray,
