4:2 And swear, As the lives, in truth, in judgment, and in justice, Then the nations shall bless themselves in him and in him glory.
4:3 For to the people of Judah and Jerusalem, thus says the : Till your untilled ground, and do not sow among thorns.
4:4 Be circumcised for the , remove the foreskins of your hearts, people of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem; Or else my anger will break out like fire, and burn so that no one can quench it, because of your evil deeds.
4:5 Proclaim it in Judah, in Jerusalem announce it; Blow the trumpet throughout the land, call out, Fill the ranks! Say, Assemble, let us march to the fortified cities.
4:6 Raise the signal—to Zion! Seek refuge! Dont stand there! Disaster I bring from the north, and great destruction.
4:7 Up comes the lion from its lair, the destroyer of nations has set out, has left its place, To turn your land into a desolation, your cities into an uninhabited waste.
4:8 So put on sackcloth, mourn and wail: The blazing anger of the has not turned away from us.
4:9 In that day—oracle of the — The king will lose heart, and the princes; the priests will be horrified, and the prophets stunned.
4:10 Ah! Lord , they will say, You really did deceive us When you said: You shall have peace, while the sword was at our very throats.
4:11 At that time it will be said to this people and to Jerusalem, A scorching wind from the bare heights comes through the wilderness toward my daughter, the people. Not to winnow, not to cleanse,
4:12 a strong wind from there comes at my bidding. Now I too pronounce sentence upon them.
4:13 See! like storm clouds he advances, like a whirlwind, his chariots; Swifter than eagles, his horses: Woe to us! we are ruined.
4:14 Cleanse your heart of evil, Jerusalem, that you may be saved. How long will you entertain wicked schemes?
4:15 A voice proclaims it from Dan, announces wickedness from Mount Ephraim:
4:16 Make this known to the nations, announce it against Jerusalem: Besiegers are coming from the distant land, shouting their war cry against the cities of Judah.
4:17 Like watchers in the fields they surround her, for she has rebelled against me—oracle of the .
4:18 Your conduct, your deeds, have done this to you; how bitter is this evil of yours, how it reaches to your very heart!
4:19 My body! my body! how I writhe! The walls of my heart! My heart beats wildly, I cannot be still; For I myself have heard the blast of the horn, the battle cry.
4:20 Ruin upon ruin is reported; the whole land is laid waste. In an instant my tents are ravaged; in a flash, my shelters.
4:21 How long must I see the signal, hear the blast of the horn!
4:22 My people are fools, they do not know me; They are senseless children, without understanding; They are wise at evil, but they do not know how to do good.
4:23 I looked at the earth—it was waste and void; at the heavens—their light had gone out!
4:24 I looked at the mountains—they were quaking! All the hills were crumbling!
4:25 I looked—there was no one; even the birds of the air had flown away!
4:26 I looked—the garden land was a wilderness, with all its cities destroyed before the , before his blazing anger.
4:27 For thus says the : The whole earth shall be waste, but I will not wholly destroy it.
4:28 Because of this the earth shall mourn, the heavens above shall darken; I have spoken, I will not change my mind, I have decided, I will not turn back.
4:29 At the shout of rider and archer each city takes to flight; They shrink into the thickets, they scale the rocks: All the cities are abandoned, no one lives in them.
4:30 You now who are doomed, what are you doing dressing in purple, bedecking yourself with gold, Enlarging your eyes with kohl? You beautify yourself in vain! Your lovers reject you, they seek your life.
4:31 Yes, I hear the cry, like that of a woman in labor, like the anguish of a mother bearing her first child— The cry of daughter Zion gasping, as she stretches out her hands: Ah, woe is me! I sink exhausted before my killers!
5:1 Roam the streets of Jerusalem, look about and observe, Search through her squares, to find even one Who acts justly and seeks honesty, and I will pardon her!
5:2 They say, As the lives, but in fact they swear falsely.
5:3 , do your eyes not search for honesty? You struck them, but they did not flinch; you laid them low, but they refused correction; They set their faces harder than stone, and refused to return.
5:4 I thought: These are only the lowly, they behave foolishly; For they do not know the way of the , the justice of their God.
5:5 Let me go to the leaders and speak with them; For they must know the way of the , the justice of their God. But, one and all, they have broken the yoke, torn off the harness.
5:6 Therefore, lions from the forest slay them, wolves of the desert ravage them, Leopards keep watch round their cities: all who come out are torn to pieces, For their crimes are many, their rebellions numerous.
5:7 Why should I pardon you? Your children have forsaken me, they swear by gods that are no gods. I fed them, but they commit adultery; to the prostitutes house they throng.
5:8 They are lustful stallions, each neighs after the others wife.
5:9 Should I not punish them for this?—oracle of the ; on a nation like this should I not take vengeance?
5:10 Climb her terraces, and ravage them, destroy them completely. Tear away her tendrils, they do not belong to the .
5:11 For they have openly rebelled against me, both the house of Israel and the house of Judah— oracle of the .
5:12 They denied the , saying, He is nothing, No evil shall come to us, neither sword nor famine shall we see.
5:13 The prophets are wind, and the word is not with them. Let it be done to them!
5:14 Therefore, thus says the , the God of hosts, because you have said this— See! I make my words a fire in your mouth, And this people the wood that it shall devour!—
5:15 Beware! I will bring against you a nation from far away, O House of Israel—oracle of the ; A long-lived nation, an ancient nation, a people whose language you do not know, whose speech you cannot understand.
5:16 Their quivers are like open graves; all of them are warriors.
5:17 They will devour your harvest and your bread, devour your sons and your daughters, Devour your sheep and cattle, devour your vines and fig trees; With their swords they will beat down the fortified cities in which you trust.
5:18 Yet even in those days—oracle of the —I will not completely destroy you.
5:19 And when they ask, Why has the our God done all these things to us? say to them, As you have abandoned me to serve foreign gods in your own land, so shall you serve foreigners in a land not your own.
5:20 Announce this to the house of Jacob, proclaim it in Judah:
5:21 Pay attention to this, you foolish and senseless people, Who have eyes and do not see, who have ears and do not hear.
5:22 Should you not fear me—oracle of the — should you not tremble before me? I made the sandy shore the seas limit, which by eternal decree it may not overstep. Toss though it may, it is to no avail; though its billows roar, they cannot overstep.
5:23 But this peoples heart is stubborn and rebellious; they turn and go away,
5:24 And do not say in their hearts, Let us fear the , our God, Who gives us rain early and late, in its time; Who watches for us over the appointed weeks of harvest.
5:25 Your crimes have prevented these things, your sins have turned these blessings away from you.
5:26 For criminals lurk among my people; like fowlers they set traps, but it is human beings they catch.
5:27 Their houses are as full of treachery as a bird-cage is of birds; Therefore they grow powerful and rich,
5:28 fat and sleek. They pass over wicked deeds; justice they do not defend By advancing the claim of the orphan or judging the cause of the poor.
5:29 Shall I not punish these things?—oracle of the ; on a nation such as this shall I not take vengeance?
5:30 Something shocking and horrible has happened in the land:
5:31 The prophets prophesy falsely, and the priests teach on their own authority; Yet my people like it this way; what will you do when the end comes?
6:1 Seek refuge, Benjaminites, from the midst of Jerusalem! Blow the trumpet in Tekoa, raise a signal over Beth-haccherem; For disaster threatens from the north, and mighty destruction.
6:2 Lovely and delicate daughter Zion, you are ruined!
6:3 Against her, shepherds come with their flocks; all around, they pitch their tents against her; each one grazes his portion.
6:4 Prepare for war against her, Up! let us rush upon her at midday! Woe to us! the day is waning, evening shadows lengthen!
6:5 Up! let us rush upon her by night, destroy her palaces!
6:6 For thus says the of hosts: Hew down her trees, throw up a siege mound against Jerusalem. Woe to the city marked for punishment; there is nothing but oppression within her!
6:7 As a well keeps its waters fresh, so she keeps fresh her wickedness. Violence and destruction resound in her; ever before me are wounds and blows.
6:8 Be warned, Jerusalem, or I will be estranged from you, And I will turn you into a wilderness, a land where no one dwells.
6:9 Thus says the of hosts: Glean, glean like a vine the remnant of Israel; Pass your hand, like a vintager, repeatedly over the tendrils.
6:10 To whom shall I speak? whom shall I warn, and be heard? See! their ears are uncircumcised, they cannot pay attention; See, the word of the has become for them an object of scorn, for which they have no taste.
6:11 But the wrath of the brims up within me, I am weary of holding it in. I will pour it out upon the child in the street, upon the young men gathered together. Yes, husband and wife will be taken, elder with ancient.
6:12 Their houses will fall to others, their fields and their wives as well; For I will stretch forth my hand against those who dwell in the land—oracle of the .
6:13 Small and great alike, all are greedy for gain; prophet and priest, all practice fraud.
6:14 They have treated lightly the injury to my people: Peace, peace! they say, though there is no peace.
6:15 They have acted shamefully, committing abominations, yet they are not at all ashamed, they do not know how to blush. Therefore they will fall among the fallen; in the time of their punishment they shall stumble, says the .
6:16 Thus says the : Stand by the earliest roads, ask the pathways of old, Which is the way to good? and walk it; thus you will find rest for yourselves. But they said, We will not walk it.
6:17 I raised up watchmen for them: Pay attention to the sound of the trumpet! But they said, We will not pay attention!
6:18 Therefore hear, O nations, and know, O earth, what I will do with them:
6:19 See, I bring evil upon this people, the fruit of their own schemes, Because they did not pay attention to my words, because they rejected my law.
6:20 Of what use to me is incense that comes from Sheba, or sweet cane from far-off lands? Your burnt offerings find no favor with me, your sacrifices do not please me.
6:21 Therefore, thus says the : See, I will place before this people obstacles to trip them up; Parents and children alike, neighbors and friends shall perish.
6:22 Thus says the : See, a people comes from the land of the north, a great nation, rising from the very ends of the earth.
6:23 Bow and javelin they wield; cruel and pitiless are they. They sound like the roaring sea as they ride forth on horses, Each in his place for battle against you, daughter Zion.
6:24 We hear news of them; our hands hang helpless, Anguish takes hold of us, pangs like a woman in childbirth.
6:25 Do not go out into the field, do not step into the street, For the enemy has a sword; terror on every side!
6:26 Daughter of my people, dress in sackcloth, roll in the ashes. Mourn as for an only child with bitter wailing: How suddenly the destroyer comes upon us!
6:27 A tester for my people I have appointed you, to search and test their way.
6:28 Arch-rebels are they all, dealers in slander, bronze and iron, all of them, destroyers they are.
6:29 The bellows are scorched, the lead is consumed by the fire; In vain has the refiner refined, the wicked are not drawn off.
6:30 Silver rejected they shall be called, for the has rejected them.
7:1 The word came to Jeremiah from the :
7:2 Stand at the gate of the house of the and proclaim this message there: Hear the word of the , all you of Judah who enter these gates to worship the !
7:3 Thus says the of hosts, the God of Israel: Reform your ways and your deeds so that I may dwell with you in this place.
7:4 Do not put your trust in these deceptive words: The temple of the ! The temple of the ! The temple of the !
7:5 Only if you thoroughly reform your ways and your deeds; if each of you deals justly with your neighbor;
7:6 if you no longer oppress the alien, the orphan, and the widow; if you no longer shed innocent blood in this place or follow after other gods to your own harm,
7:7 only then will I let you continue to dwell in this place, in the land I gave your ancestors long ago and forever.
7:8 But look at you! You put your trust in deceptive words to your own loss!
7:9 Do you think you can steal and murder, commit adultery and perjury, sacrifice to Baal, follow other gods that you do not know,
7:10 and then come and stand in my presence in this house, which bears my name, and say: We are safe! We can commit all these abominations again!?
7:11 Has this house which bears my name become in your eyes a den of thieves? I have seen it for myself!—oracle of the .
7:12 Go to my place at Shiloh, where I made my name dwell in the beginning. See what I did to it because of the wickedness of my people Israel.
7:13 And now, because you have committed all these deeds—oracle of the —because you did not listen, though I spoke to you untiringly, and because you did not answer, though I called you,
7:14 I will do to this house, which bears my name, in which you trust, and to the place which I gave you and your ancestors, exactly what I did to Shiloh.
7:15 I will cast you out of my sight, as I cast away all your kindred, all the offspring of Ephraim.
7:16 You, now, must not intercede for this people! Do not raise a cry or prayer in their behalf! Do not press me, for I will not listen to you!
7:17 Do you not see what they are doing in the cities of Judah, in the streets of Jerusalem?
7:18 The children gather wood, their fathers light the fire, and the women knead dough to make cakes for the Queen of Heaven, while libations are poured out to other gods—all to offend me!
7:19 Are they really offending me—oracle of the —or rather themselves, to their own disgrace?
7:20 Therefore, thus says the Lord : my anger and my wrath will pour out upon this place, upon human being and beast, upon the trees of the field and the fruits of the earth; it will burn and not be quenched.
7:21 Thus says the of hosts, the God of Israel: Heap your burnt offerings upon your sacrifices; eat up the meat!
7:22 In speaking to your ancestors on the day I brought them out of the land of Egypt, I gave them no command concerning burnt offering or sacrifice.
7:23 This rather is what I commanded them: Listen to my voice; then I will be your God and you shall be my people. Walk exactly in the way I command you, so that you may prosper.
7:24 But they did not listen to me, nor did they pay attention. They walked in the stubbornness of their evil hearts and turned their backs, not their faces, to me.
7:25 From the day that your ancestors left the land of Egypt even to this day, I kept on sending all my servants the prophets to you.
7:26 Yet they have not listened to me nor have they paid attention; they have stiffened their necks and done worse than their ancestors.
7:27 When you speak all these words to them, they will not listen to you either. When you call to them, they will not answer you.
7:28 Say to them: This is the nation which does not listen to the voice of the , its God, or take correction. Faithfulness has disappeared; the word itself is banished from their speech.
7:29 Cut off your hair and throw it away! on the heights raise a lament; The has indeed rejected and cast off the generation that draws down his wrath.
7:30 The people of Judah have done what is evil in my eyes—oracle of the . They have set up their detestable things in the house which bears my name, thereby defiling it.
7:31 In the Valley of Ben-hinnom they go on building the high places of Topheth to sacrifice their sons and daughters by fire, something I never commanded or considered.
7:32 Be assured! Days are coming—oracle of the —when they will no longer say Topheth or Valley of Ben-hinnom but Valley of Slaughter. For want of space, Topheth will become burial ground.
7:33 The corpses of this people will be food for the birds of the sky and beasts of the earth, which no one will drive away.
7:34 I will silence the cry of joy, the cry of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride, in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem; for the land will be turned to rubble.
8:1 At that time—oracle of the —the bones of the kings and princes of Judah, the bones of the priests and the prophets, and the bones of the inhabitants of Jerusalem will be brought out of their graves
8:2 and spread out before the sun, the moon, and the whole host of heaven, which they loved and served, which they followed, consulted, and worshiped. They will not be gathered up for burial, but will lie like dung upon the ground.
8:3 Death will be preferred to life by all the survivors of this wicked people who remain in any of the places to which I banish them—oracle of the of hosts.
8:4 Tell them: Thus says the : When someone falls, do they not rise again? if they turn away, do they not turn back?
8:5 Why then do these people resist with persistent rebellion? Why do they cling to deception, refuse to turn back?
8:6 I have listened closely: they speak what is not true; No one regrets wickedness, saying, What have I done? Everyone keeps on running their course, like a horse dashing into battle.
8:7 Even the stork in the sky knows its seasons; Turtledove, swift, and thrush observe the time of their return, But my people do not know the order of the .
8:8 How can you say, We are wise, we have the law of the ? See, that has been changed into falsehood by the lying pen of the scribes!
8:9 The wise are put to shame, terrified, and trapped; Since they have rejected the word of the , what sort of wisdom do they have?
8:10 Therefore, I will give their wives to other men, their fields to new owners. Small and great alike, all are greedy for gain, prophet and priest, all practice fraud.
8:11 They have treated lightly the injury to the daughter of my people: Peace, peace! they say, though there is no peace.
8:12 They have acted shamefully; they have done abominable things, yet they are not at all ashamed, they do not know how to blush. Hence they shall be among those who fall; in their time of punishment they shall stumble, says the .
8:13 I will gather them all in—oracle of the : no grapes on the vine, No figs on the fig trees, foliage withered! Whatever I have given them is gone.
8:14 Why do we remain here? Let us assemble and flee to the fortified cities, where we will meet our doom; For the our God has doomed us, he has given us poisoned water to drink, because we have sinned against the .
8:15 We wait for peace to no avail; for a time of healing, but terror comes instead.
8:16 From Dan is heard the snorting of horses; The neighing of stallions shakes the whole land. They come to devour the land and everything in it, the city and its inhabitants.
8:17 Yes, I will send against you poisonous snakes. Against them no charm will work when they bite you—oracle of the .
8:18 My joy is gone, grief is upon me, my heart is sick.
8:19 Listen! the cry of the daughter of my people, far and wide in the land! Is the no longer in Zion, is her King no longer in her midst? Why do they provoke me with their idols, with their foreign nonentities?
8:20 The harvest is over, the summer ended, but we have not yet been saved!
8:21 I am broken by the injury of the daughter of my people. I am in mourning; horror has seized me.
8:22 Is there no balm in Gilead, no healer there? Why does new flesh not grow over the wound of the daughter of my people?
8:23 Oh, that my head were a spring of water, my eyes a fountain of tears, That I might weep day and night over the slain from the daughter of my people!
9:1 Oh, that I had in the wilderness a travelers lodging! That I might leave my people and depart from them. They are all adulterers, a band of traitors.
9:2 They ready their tongues like a drawn bow; with lying, and not with truth, they are powerful in the land. They go from evil to evil, and me they do not know—oracle of the .
9:3 Be on your guard, everyone against his neighbor; put no trust in any brother. Every brother imitates Jacob, the supplanter, every neighbor is guilty of slander.
9:4 Each one deceives the other, no one speaks the truth. They have accustomed their tongues to lying, they are perverse and cannot repent.
9:5 Violence upon violence, deceit upon deceit: They refuse to know me— oracle of the .
9:6 Therefore, thus says the of hosts: I will refine them and test them; how else should I deal with the daughter of my people?
9:7 A murderous arrow is their tongue, their mouths utter deceit; They speak peaceably with their neighbors, but in their hearts they lay an ambush!
9:8 Should I not punish them for these deeds—oracle of the ; on a nation such as this should I not take vengeance?
9:9 Over the mountains I shall break out in cries of lamentation, over the pastures in the wilderness, in a dirge: They are scorched, and no one crosses them, no sound of lowing cattle; Birds of the air as well as beasts, all have fled and are gone.
9:10 I will turn Jerusalem into a heap of ruins, a haunt of jackals; The cities of Judah I will make a waste, where no one dwells.
9:11 Who is wise enough to understand this? To whom has the mouth of the spoken? Let him declare it! Why is the land ravaged, scorched like a wilderness no one crosses?
9:12 The said: Because they have abandoned my law, which I set before them, and did not listen to me or follow it,
9:13 but followed instead their stubborn hearts and the Baals, as their ancestors had taught them,
9:14 therefore, thus says the of hosts, the God of Israel: See now, I will give this people wormwood to eat and poisoned water to drink.
9:15 I will scatter them among nations whom neither they nor their ancestors have known; I will send the sword to pursue them until I have completely destroyed them.
9:16 Thus says the of hosts: Inquire, and call the wailing women to come; summon the most skilled of them.
9:17 Let them come quickly and raise for us a dirge, That our eyes may run with tears, our pupils flow with water.
9:18 The sound of the dirge is heard from Zion: We are ruined and greatly ashamed; We have left the land, given up our dwellings!
9:19 Hear, you women, the word of the , let your ears receive the word of his mouth. Teach your daughters a dirge, and each other a lament:
9:20 Death has come up through our windows, has entered our citadels, To cut down children in the street, young people in the squares.
9:21 Corpses shall fall like dung in the open field, Like sheaves behind the harvester, with no one to gather them.
9:22 Thus says the : Let not the wise boast of his wisdom, nor the strong boast of his strength, nor the rich man boast of his riches;
9:23 But rather, let those who boast, boast of this, that in their prudence they know me, Know that I, the , act with fidelity, justice, and integrity on earth. How I take delight in these—oracle of the .
9:24 See, days are coming—oracle of the —when I will demand an account of all those circumcised in the foreskin:
9:25 Egypt and Judah, Edom and the Ammonites, Moab, and those who live in the wilderness and shave their temples. For all the nations are uncircumcised, even the whole house of Israel is uncircumcised at heart.
10:1 Hear the word the speaks to you, house of Israel.
10:2 Thus says the : Do not learn the ways of the nations, and have no fear of the signs in the heavens, even though the nations fear them.
10:3 For the carvings of the nations are nonentities, wood cut from the forest, Fashioned by artisans with the adze,
10:4 adorned with silver and gold. With nails and hammers they are fastened, so they do not fall.
10:5 Like a scarecrow in a cucumber field are they, they cannot speak; They must be carried about, for they cannot walk. Do not fear them, they can do no harm, neither can they do good.
10:6 No one is like you, , you are great, great and mighty is your name.
10:7 Who would not fear you, King of the nations, for it is your due! Among all the wisest of the nations, and in all their domains, there is none like you.
10:8 One and all they are stupid and senseless, the instruction from nonentities—only wood!
10:9 Silver plates brought from Tarshish, and gold from Ophir, The work of the artisan and the handiwork of the smelter, Clothed with violet and purple— all of them the work of skilled workers.
10:10 The is truly God, he is the living God, the eternal King, Before whose anger the earth quakes, whose wrath the nations cannot endure.
10:11 Thus shall you say of them: The gods that did not make heaven and earth—let these perish from earth and from beneath heaven!
10:12 The one who made the earth by his power, established the world by his wisdom, and by his skill stretched out the heavens.
10:13 When he thunders, the waters in the heavens roar, and he brings up clouds from the end of the earth, Makes lightning flash in the rain, and brings forth the wind from his storehouses.
10:14 Everyone is too stupid to know; every artisan is put to shame by his idol: He has molded a fraud, without breath of life.
10:15 They are nothing, objects of ridicule; they will perish in their time of punishment.
10:16 Jacobs portion is nothing like them: for he is the maker of everything! Israel is his very own tribe, of hosts is his name.
10:17 Gather up your bundle from the land, City living under siege!
10:18 For thus says the : Now, at this time I will sling away the inhabitants of the land; I will hem them in, that they may be taken.
10:19 Woe is me! I am undone, my wound is beyond healing. Yet I had thought: if I make light of my sickness, I can bear it.
10:20 My tent is ruined, all its cords are severed. My children have left me, they are no more: no one to pitch my tent, no one to raise its curtains.
10:21 How stupid are the shepherds! The they have not sought; For this reason they have failed, and all their flocks scattered.
10:22 Listen! a rumor! here it comes, a great commotion from the land of the north: To make the cities of Judah a desolation, the haunt of jackals.
10:23 I know, , that no one chooses their way, Nor determines their course nor directs their own step.
10:24 Correct me, , but with equity, not in anger, lest you diminish me.
10:25 Pour out your wrath on the nations that do not know you, on the tribes that do not call your name; For they have utterly devoured Jacob, and laid waste his home.
11:1 The word that came to Jeremiah from the :
11:2 Speak to the people of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem,
11:3 and say to them: Thus says the , the God of Israel: Cursed be anyone who does not observe the words of this covenant,
11:4 which I commanded your ancestors the day I brought them up out of the land of Egypt, that iron furnace, saying: Listen to my voice and do all that I command you. Then you shall be my people, and I will be your God.
11:5 Thus I will fulfill the oath I swore to your ancestors, to give them a land flowing with milk and honey, the one you have today. Amen, , I answered.
11:6 Then the said to me: Proclaim all these words in the cities of Judah and in the streets of Jerusalem: Hear the words of this covenant and obey them.
11:7 I warned your ancestors unceasingly from the day I brought them up out of the land of Egypt even to this day: obey my voice.
11:8 But they did not listen or obey. They each walked in the stubbornness of their evil hearts, till I brought upon them all the threats of this covenant which they had failed to observe as I commanded them.
11:9 A conspiracy has been found, the said to me, among the people of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem:
11:10 They have returned to the crimes of their ancestors who refused to obey my words. They also have followed and served other gods; the house of Israel and the house of Judah have broken the covenant I made with their ancestors.
11:11 Therefore, thus says the : See, I am bringing upon them a disaster they cannot escape. Though they cry out to me, I will not listen to them.
11:12 Then the cities of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem will go and cry out to the gods to whom they have been offering incense. But these gods will give them no help whatever in the time of their disaster.
11:13 For as many as your cities are your gods, O Judah! As many as the streets of Jerusalem are the altars for sacrifice to Baal.
11:14 Now, you must not intercede for this people; do not raise on their behalf a cry or prayer! I will not listen when they call to me in the time of their disaster.
11:15 What right has my beloved in my house, while she devises her plots? Can vows and sacred meat turn away your disaster from you? Will you still be jubilant
11:16 when you hear the great tumult? The has named you a spreading olive tree, a pleasure to behold; Now he sets fire to it, its branches burn.
11:17 The of hosts who planted you has decreed disaster for you because of the evil done by the house of Israel and by the house of Judah, who provoked me by sacrificing to Baal.
11:18 I knew it because the informed me: at that time you showed me their doings.
11:19 Yet I was like a trusting lamb led to slaughter, not knowing that they were hatching plots against me: Let us destroy the tree in its vigor; let us cut him off from the land of the living, so that his name will no longer be remembered.
11:20 But, you, of hosts, just Judge, searcher of mind and heart, Let me witness the vengeance you take on them, for to you I have entrusted my cause!
11:21 Therefore, thus says the concerning the men of Anathoth who seek your life and say, Do not prophesy in the name of the ; otherwise you shall die by our hand.
11:22 Therefore, thus says the of hosts: I am going to punish them. The young men shall die by the sword; their sons and daughters shall die by famine.
11:23 None shall be spared among them, for I will bring disaster upon the men of Anathoth, the year of their punishment.
12:1 You would be in the right, O , if I should dispute with you; even so, I must lay out the case against you. Why does the way of the wicked prosper, why do all the treacherous live in contentment?
12:2 You planted them; they have taken root, they flourish and bear fruit as well. You are upon their lips, but far from their thoughts.
12:3 , you know me, you see me, you have found that my heart is with you. Pick them out like sheep for the butcher, set them apart for the day of slaughter.
12:4 How long must the land mourn, the grass of the whole countryside wither? Because of the wickedness of those who dwell in it beasts and birds disappear, for they say, God does not care about our future.
12:5 If running against men has wearied you, how will you race against horses? And if you are safe only on a level stretch, what will you do in the jungle of the Jordan?
12:6 Your kindred and your fathers house, even they betray you; they have recruited a force against you. Do not believe them, even when they speak fair words to you.
12:7 I have abandoned my house, cast off my heritage; The beloved of my soul I have delivered into the hand of her foes.
12:8 My heritage has become for me like a lion in the thicket; She has raised her voice against me, therefore she has incurred my hatred.
12:9 My heritage is a prey for hyenas, is surrounded by vultures; Come, gather together, all you wild animals, come and eat!
12:10 Many shepherds have ravaged my vineyard, have trampled down my heritage; My delightful portion they have turned into a desert waste.
12:11 They have made it a mournful waste, desolate before me, Desolate, the whole land, because no one takes it to heart.
12:12 Upon every height in the wilderness marauders have appeared. The has a sword that consumes the land from end to end: no peace for any living thing.
12:13 They have sown wheat and reaped thorns, they have tired themselves out for no purpose; They are shamed by their harvest, the burning anger of the .
12:14 Thus says the , against all my evil neighbors who plunder the heritage I gave my people Israel as their own: See, I will uproot them from their land; the house of Judah I will uproot in their midst.
12:15 But after uprooting them, I will have compassion on them again and bring them back, each to their heritage, each to their land.
12:16 And if they truly learn my peoples custom of swearing by my name, As the lives, just as they taught my people to swear by Baal, then they shall be built up in the midst of my people.
12:17 But if they do not obey, I will uproot and destroy that nation entirely—oracle of the .
13:1 The said to me: Go buy yourself a linen loincloth; wear it on your loins, but do not put it in water.
13:2 I bought the loincloth, as the commanded, and put it on.
13:3 A second time the word of the came to me thus:
13:4 Take the loincloth which you bought and are wearing, and go at once to the Perath; hide it there in a cleft of the rock.
13:5 Obedient to the s command, I went to the Perath and buried the loincloth.
13:6 After a long time, the said to me: Go now to the Perath and fetch the loincloth which I told you to hide there.
13:7 So I went to the Perath, looked for the loincloth and took it from the place I had hidden it. But it was rotted, good for nothing!
13:8 Then the word came to me from the :
13:9 Thus says the : So also I will allow the pride of Judah to rot, the great pride of Jerusalem.
13:10 This wicked people who refuse to obey my words, who walk in the stubbornness of their hearts and follow other gods, serving and worshiping them, will be like this loincloth, good for nothing.
13:11 For, as the loincloth clings to a mans loins, so I made the whole house of Israel and the whole house of Judah cling to me—oracle of the —to be my people, my fame, my praise, my glory. But they did not listen.
13:12 Now speak to them this word: Thus says the , the God of Israel: Every wineflask should be filled with wine. If they reply, Do we not know that every wineflask should be filled with wine?
13:13 say to them: Thus says the : Beware! I am making all the inhabitants of this land drunk, the kings who sit on Davids throne, the priests and prophets, and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
13:14 I will smash them against each other, parents and children together—oracle of the —showing no compassion, I will neither spare nor pity, but I will destroy them.
13:15 Listen and give ear, do not be arrogant, for the speaks.
13:16 Give glory to the , your God, before he brings darkness; Before your feet stumble on mountains at twilight; Before the light you look for turns to darkness, changes into black clouds.
13:17 If you do not listen to this in your pride, I will weep many tears in secret; My eyes will run with tears for the s flock, led away to exile.
13:18 Say to the king and to the queen mother: come down from your throne; From your heads your splendid crowns will fall.
13:19 The cities of the Negeb are besieged, with no one to relieve them; Judah is taken into exile—all of it— in total exile.
13:20 Lift up your eyes and see those coming in from the north. Where is the flock entrusted to you, your splendid sheep?
13:21 What will you say when rulers are appointed over you, those you taught to be allies? Will not pains seize you like those of a woman giving birth?
13:22 If you say to yourself: Why have these things happened to me? For your great guilt your skirts are stripped away and you are violated.
13:23 Can Ethiopians change their skin, leopards their spots? As easily would you be able to do good, accustomed to evil as you are.
13:24 I will scatter them like chaff that flies on the desert wind.
13:25 This is your lot, the portion I have measured out to you— oracle of the . Because you have forgotten me, and trusted in deception,
13:26 I now will strip away your skirts, so that your shame is visible.
13:27 Your adulteries, your neighings, your shameless prostitutions: On the hills, in the fields I see your detestable crimes. Woe to you, Jerusalem! How long will it be before you are clean?
14:1 The word of the that came to Jeremiah concerning the drought:
14:2 Judah mourns, her gates are lifeless; They are bowed to the ground, and the outcry of Jerusalem goes up.
14:3 The nobles send their servants for water, but when they come to the cisterns They find no water and return with empty jars. Confounded, despairing, they cover their heads
14:4 because of the ruined soil; Because there is no rain in the land the farmers are confounded, they cover their heads.
14:5 Even the doe in the field deserts her young because there is no grass.
14:6 The wild donkeys stand on the bare heights, gasping for breath like jackals; Their eyes grow dim; there is no grass.
14:7 Even though our crimes bear witness against us, act, , for your names sake— Even though our rebellions are many, and we have sinned against you.
14:8 Hope of Israel, , our savior in time of need! Why should you be a stranger in the land, like a traveler stopping only for a night?
14:9 Why are you like someone bewildered, a champion who cannot save? You are in our midst, , your name we bear: do not forsake us!
14:10 Thus says the about this people: They so love to wander that they cannot restrain their feet. The takes no pleasure in them; now he remembers their guilt, and will punish their sins.
14:11 Then the said to me: Do not intercede for the well-being of this people.
14:12 If they fast, I will not listen to their supplication. If they sacrifice burnt offerings or grain offerings, I will take no pleasure in them. Rather, I will destroy them with the sword, famine, and plague.
14:13 Ah! Lord , I replied, it is the prophets who say to them, You shall not see the sword; famine shall not befall you. Indeed, I will give you lasting peace in this place.
14:14 These prophets utter lies in my name, the said to me: I did not send them; I gave them no command, nor did I speak to them. They prophesy to you lying visions, foolish divination, deceptions from their own imagination.
14:15 Therefore, thus says the : Concerning the prophets who prophesy in my name, though I did not send them, and who say, Sword and famine shall not befall this land: by sword and famine shall these prophets meet their end.
14:16 The people to whom they prophesy shall be thrown out into the streets of Jerusalem because of famine and the sword. No one shall bury them, their wives, their sons, or their daughters, for I will pour out upon them their own wickedness.
14:17 Speak to them this word: Let my eyes stream with tears night and day, without rest, Over the great destruction which overwhelms the virgin daughter of my people, over her incurable wound.
14:18 If I walk out into the field, look! those slain by the sword; If I enter the city, look! victims of famine. Both prophet and priest ply their trade in a land they do not know.
14:19 Have you really cast Judah off? Is Zion loathsome to you? Why have you struck us a blow that cannot be healed? We wait for peace, to no avail; for a time of healing, but terror comes instead.
14:20 We recognize our wickedness, , the guilt of our ancestors: we have sinned against you.
14:21 Do not reject us, for your names sake, do not disgrace your glorious throne. Remember! Do not break your covenant with us.
14:22 Among the idols of the nations are there any that give rain? Or can the mere heavens send showers? Is it not you, , our God, to whom we look? You alone do all these things.
15:1 The said to me: Even if Moses and Samuel stood before me, my heart would not turn toward this people. Send them away from me and let them go.
15:2 If they ask you, Where should we go? tell them, Thus says the : Whoever is marked for death, to death; whoever is marked for the sword, to the sword; whoever is marked for famine, to famine; whoever is marked for captivity, to captivity.
15:3 Four kinds of scourge I have decreed against them—oracle of the —the sword to kill them; dogs to drag them off; the birds of the sky and the beasts of the earth to devour and destroy them.
15:4 And I will make them an object of horror to all the kingdoms of the earth because of what Manasseh, son of Hezekiah, king of Judah, did in Jerusalem.
15:5 Who will pity you, Jerusalem, who will grieve for you? Who will stop to ask about your welfare?
15:6 It is you who have disowned me—oracle of the — turned your back upon me; I stretched out my hand to destroy you, because I was weary of relenting.
15:7 I winnowed them with a winnowing fork at the gates of the land; I have bereaved, destroyed my people; they have not turned from their evil ways.
15:8 Their widows were more numerous before me than the sands of the sea. I brought against the mother of youths the destroyer at midday; Suddenly I struck her with anguish and terror.
15:9 The mother of seven faints away, breathing out her life; Her sun sets in full day, she is ashamed, abashed. Their survivors I will give to the sword in the presence of their enemies—oracle of the .
15:10 Woe to me, my mother, that you gave me birth! a man of strife and contention to all the land! I neither borrow nor lend, yet everyone curses me.
15:11 Tell me, , have I not served you for their good? Have I not interceded with you in time of misfortune and anguish?
15:12 Can one break iron, iron from the north, and bronze?
15:13 Your wealth and your treasures I give as plunder, demanding no payment, because of all your sins, throughout all your territory.
15:14 And I shall enslave you to your enemies in a land you do not know, For fire has broken out from my anger, it is kindled against you.
15:15 You know, : Remember me and take care of me, avenge me on my persecutors. Because you are slow to anger, do not banish me; know that for you I have borne insult.
15:16 When I found your words, I devoured them; your words were my joy, the happiness of my heart, Because I bear your name, , God of hosts.
15:17 I did not sit celebrating in the circle of merrymakers; Under the weight of your hand I sat alone because you filled me with rage.
15:18 Why is my pain continuous, my wound incurable, refusing to be healed? To me you are like a deceptive brook, waters that cannot be relied on!
15:19 Thus the answered me: If you come back and I take you back, in my presence you shall stand; If you utter what is precious and not what is worthless, you shall be my mouth. Then they will be the ones who turn to you, not you who turn to them.
15:20 And I will make you toward this people a fortified wall of bronze. Though they fight against you, they shall not prevail, For I am with you, to save and rescue you—oracle of the .
15:21 I will rescue you from the hand of the wicked, and ransom you from the power of the violent.
16:1 This word came to me from the :
16:2 Do not take a wife and do not have sons and daughters in this place,
16:3 for thus says the concerning the sons and daughters born in this place, the mothers who give them birth, the fathers who beget them in this land:
16:4 Of deadly disease they shall die. Unlamented and unburied they will lie like dung on the ground. Sword and famine will make an end of them, and their corpses will become food for the birds of the sky and the beasts of the earth.
16:5 Thus says the : Do not go into a house of mourning; do not go there to lament or grieve for them. For I have withdrawn my peace from this people—oracle of the —my love and my compassion.
16:6 They shall die, the great and the lowly, in this land, unburied and unlamented. No one will gash themselves or shave their heads for them.
16:7 They will not break bread with the bereaved to offer consolation for the dead; they will not give them the cup of consolation to drink over the death of father or mother.
16:8 Do not enter a house of feasting to sit eating and drinking with them.
16:9 For thus says the of hosts, the God of Israel: Before your eyes and in your lifetime, I will silence in this place the song of joy and the song of gladness, the song of the bridegroom and the song of the bride.
16:10 When you proclaim all these words to this people and they ask you: Why has the pronounced all this great disaster against us? What is our crime? What sin have we committed against the , our God?—
16:11 you shall answer them: It is because your ancestors have forsaken me—oracle of the —and followed other gods that they served and worshiped; but me they have forsaken, and my law they did not keep.
16:12 And you have done worse than your ancestors. Here you are, every one of you, walking in the stubbornness of your evil heart instead of listening to me.
16:13 I will throw you out of this land into a land that neither you nor your ancestors have known; there you can serve other gods day and night because I will not show you mercy.
16:14 Therefore, days are coming—oracle of the —when it will no longer be said, As the lives, who brought the Israelites out of Egypt;
16:15 but rather, As the lives, who brought the Israelites out of the land of the north and out of all the countries to which he had banished them. I will bring them back to the land I gave their ancestors.
16:16 Look!—oracle of the —I will send many fishermen to catch them. After that, I will send many hunters to hunt them out from every mountain and hill and rocky crevice.
16:17 For my eyes are upon all their ways; they are not hidden from me, nor does their guilt escape my sight.
16:18 I will at once repay them double for their crime and their sin because they profaned my land with the corpses of their detestable idols, and filled my heritage with their abominations.
16:19 , my strength, my fortress, my refuge in the day of distress! To you nations will come from the ends of the earth, and say, Our ancestors inherited mere frauds, empty, worthless.
16:20 Can human beings make for themselves gods? But these are not gods at all!
16:21 Therefore, I will indeed give them knowledge; this time I will make them acknowledge My strength and my power: they shall know that my name is .
17:1 The sin of Judah is written with an iron stylus, Engraved with a diamond point upon the tablets of their hearts, And the horns of their altars,
17:2 when their children remember their altars and their asherahs, beside the green trees, on the high hills,
17:3 the peaks in the country. Your wealth and all your treasures I give as plunder, As payment for all your sins throughout your territory,
17:4 You will relinquish your hold on your heritage which I have given you. I will enslave you to your enemies in a land you do not know: For a fire has broken out from my anger, burning forever.
17:5 Thus says the : Cursed is the man who trusts in human beings, who makes flesh his strength, whose heart turns away from the .
17:6 He is like a barren bush in the wasteland that enjoys no change of season, But stands in lava beds in the wilderness, a land, salty and uninhabited.
17:7 Blessed are those who trust in the ; the will be their trust.
17:8 They are like a tree planted beside the waters that stretches out its roots to the stream: It does not fear heat when it comes, its leaves stay green; In the year of drought it shows no distress, but still produces fruit.
17:9 More tortuous than anything is the human heart, beyond remedy; who can understand it?
17:10 I, the , explore the mind and test the heart, Giving to all according to their ways, according to the fruit of their deeds.
17:11 A partridge that broods but does not hatch are those who acquire wealth unjustly: In midlife it will desert them; in the end they are only fools.
17:12 A throne of glory, exalted from the beginning, such is our holy place.
17:13 O Hope of Israel, ! all who forsake you shall be put to shame; The rebels shall be enrolled in the netherworld; they have forsaken the , source of living waters.
17:14 Heal me, , that I may be healed; save me, that I may be saved, for you are my praise.
17:15 See how they say to me, Where is the word of the ? Let it come to pass!
17:16 Yet I did not press you to send disaster; the day without remedy I have not desired. You know what passed my lips; it is present before you.
17:17 Do not become a terror to me, you are my refuge in the day of disaster.
17:18 Let my persecutors be confounded—not me! let them be terrified—not me! Bring upon them the day of disaster, crush them with double destruction.
17:19 Thus said the to me: Go, stand at the Gate of Benjamin, where the kings of Judah enter and leave, and at the other gates of Jerusalem.
17:20 There say to them: Hear the word of the , you kings of Judah, and all Judah, and all you inhabitants of Jerusalem who enter these gates!
17:21 Thus says the : As you love your lives, take care not to carry burdens on the sabbath, to bring them in through the gates of Jerusalem.
17:22 Bring no burden from your homes on the sabbath. Do no work whatever, but keep holy the sabbath day, as I commanded your ancestors,
17:23 though they did not listen or give ear, but stiffened their necks so they could not hear or take correction.
17:24 If you truly obey me—oracle of the —and carry no burden through the gates of this city on the sabbath, keeping the sabbath day holy and abstaining from all work on it,
17:25 then, through the gates of this city, kings who sit upon the throne of David will continue to enter, riding in their chariots or upon their horses, along with their princes, and the people of Judah, and the inhabitants of Jerusalem. This city will remain inhabited forever.
17:26 To it people will come from the cities of Judah and the neighborhood of Jerusalem, from the land of Benjamin and from the Shephelah, from the hill country and the Negeb, to bring burnt offerings and sacrifices, grain offerings, incense, and thank offerings to the house of the .
17:27 But if you do not obey me and keep holy the sabbath day, if you carry burdens and come through the gates of Jerusalem on the sabbath, I will set fire to its gates—a fire never to be extinguished—and it will consume the palaces of Jerusalem.
18:1 This word came to Jeremiah from the :
18:2 Arise and go down to the potters house; there you will hear my word.
18:3 I went down to the potters house and there he was, working at the wheel.
18:4 Whenever the vessel of clay he was making turned out badly in his hand, he tried again, making another vessel of whatever sort he pleased.
18:5 Then the word of the came to me:
18:6 Can I not do to you, house of Israel, as this potter has done?—oracle of the . Indeed, like clay in the hand of the potter, so are you in my hand, house of Israel.
18:7 At one moment I may decree concerning a nation or kingdom that I will uproot and tear down and destroy it;
18:8 but if that nation against whom I have decreed turns from its evil, then I will have a change of heart regarding the evil which I have decreed.
18:9 At another moment, I may decree concerning a nation or kingdom that I will build up and plant it;
18:10 but if that nation does what is evil in my eyes, refusing to obey my voice, then I will have a change of heart regarding the good with which I planned to bless it.
18:11 And now, tell this to the people of Judah and the inhabitants of Jerusalem: Thus says the : Look, I am fashioning evil against you and making a plan. Return, all of you, from your evil way; reform your ways and your deeds.
18:12 But they will say, No use! We will follow our own devices; each one of us will behave according to the stubbornness of our evil hearts!
18:13 Therefore thus says the : Ask among the nations— who has ever heard the like? Truly horrible things virgin Israel has done!
18:14 Does the snow of Lebanon desert the rocky heights? Do the gushing waters dry up that flow fresh down the mountains?
18:15 Yet my people have forgotten me: they offer incense in vain. They stumble off their paths, the ways of old, Traveling on bypaths, not the beaten track.
18:16 Their land shall be made a waste, an object of endless hissing: All passersby will be horrified, shaking their heads.
18:17 Like the east wind, I will scatter them before their enemies; I will show them my back, not my face, in their day of disaster.
18:18 Come, they said, let us devise a plot against Jeremiah, for instruction will not perish from the priests, nor counsel from the wise, nor the word from the prophets. Come, let us destroy him by his own tongue. Let us pay careful attention to his every word.
18:19 Pay attention to me, O , and listen to what my adversaries say.
18:20 Must good be repaid with evil that they should dig a pit to take my life? Remember that I stood before you to speak on their behalf, to turn your wrath away from them.
18:21 So now, give their children to famine, deliver them to the power of the sword. Let their wives be childless and widows; let their husbands die of pestilence, their youths be struck down by the sword in battle.
18:22 May cries be heard from their homes, when suddenly you send plunderers against them. For they have dug a pit to capture me, they have hidden snares for my feet;
18:23 But you, , know all their planning for my death. Do not forgive their crime, and their sin do not blot out from your sight! Let them stumble before you, in the time of your anger act against them.
19:1 Thus said the : Go, buy a potters earthenware flask. Take along some of the elders of the people and some of the priests,
19:2 and go out toward the Valley of Ben-hinnom, at the entrance of the Potsherd Gate; there proclaim the words which I will speak to you:
19:3 You shall say, Listen to the word of the , kings of Judah and inhabitants of Jerusalem: Thus says the of hosts, the God of Israel: I am going to bring such evil upon this place that the ears of all who hear of it will ring.
19:4 All because they have forsaken me and profaned this place by burning incense to other gods which neither they nor their ancestors knew; and because the kings of Judah have filled this place with innocent blood,
19:5 building high places for Baal to burn their children in fire as offerings to Baal—something I never considered or said or commanded.
19:6 Therefore, days are coming—oracle of the —when this place will no longer be called Topheth, or the Valley of Ben-hinnom, but rather, the Valley of Slaughter.
19:7 In this place I will foil the plan of Judah and Jerusalem; I will make them fall by the sword before their enemies, at the hand of those who seek their lives. Their corpses I will give as food to the birds of the sky and the beasts of the earth.
19:8 I will make this city a waste and an object of hissing. Because of all its wounds, every passerby will be horrified and hiss.
19:9 I will have them eat the flesh of their sons and daughters; they shall eat one anothers flesh during the harsh siege under which their enemies and those who seek their lives will confine them.
19:10 And you shall break the flask in the sight of the men who went with you,
19:11 and say to them: Thus says the of hosts: Thus will I smash this people and this city, as one smashes a clay pot so that it cannot be repaired. And Topheth shall be its burial place, for there will be no other place for burial.
19:12 Thus I will do to this place and to its inhabitants—oracle of the ; I will make this city like Topheth.
19:13 And the houses of Jerusalem and the houses of the kings of Judah shall be defiled like the place of Topheth, all the houses upon whose roofs they burnt incense to the whole host of heaven and poured out libations to other gods.
19:14 When Jeremiah returned from Topheth, where the had sent him to prophesy, he stood in the court of the house of the and said to all the people:
19:15 Thus says the of hosts, the God of Israel: I will bring upon this city all the evil I have spoken against it, because they have become stubborn and have not obeyed my words.
20:1 Now the priest Pashhur, son of Immer, chief officer in the house of the , heard Jeremiah prophesying these things.
20:2 So he struck the prophet and put him in the stocks at the upper Gate of Benjamin in the house of the .
20:3 The next morning, after Pashhur had released Jeremiah from the stocks, the prophet said to him: Instead of Pashhur, the names you Terror on every side.
20:4 For thus says the : Indeed, I will hand you over to terror, you and all your friends. Your own eyes shall see them fall by the sword of their enemies. All Judah I will hand over to the power of the king of Babylon, who shall take them captive to Babylon or strike them down with the sword.
20:5 All the wealth of this city, all its resources and its valuables, all the treasures of the kings of Judah, I will hand over to their enemies, who will plunder it and carry it away to Babylon.
20:6 You, Pashhur, and all the members of your household shall go into exile. To Babylon you shall go; there you shall die and be buried, you and all your friends, because you have prophesied lies to them.
20:7 You seduced me, , and I let myself be seduced; you were too strong for me, and you prevailed. All day long I am an object of laughter; everyone mocks me.
20:8 Whenever I speak, I must cry out, violence and outrage I proclaim; The word of the has brought me reproach and derision all day long.
20:9 I say I will not mention him, I will no longer speak in his name. But then it is as if fire is burning in my heart, imprisoned in my bones; I grow weary holding back, I cannot!
20:10 Yes, I hear the whisperings of many: Terror on every side! Denounce! let us denounce him! All those who were my friends are on the watch for any misstep of mine. Perhaps he can be tricked; then we will prevail, and take our revenge on him.
20:11 But the is with me, like a mighty champion: my persecutors will stumble, they will not prevail. In their failure they will be put to utter shame, to lasting, unforgettable confusion.
20:12 of hosts, you test the just, you see mind and heart, Let me see the vengeance you take on them, for to you I have entrusted my cause.
20:13 Sing to the , praise the , For he has rescued the life of the poor from the power of the evildoers!
20:14 Cursed be the day on which I was born! May the day my mother gave me birth never be blessed!
20:15 Cursed be the one who brought the news to my father, A child, a son, has been born to you! filling him with great joy.
20:16 Let that man be like the cities which the relentlessly overthrew; Let him hear war cries in the morning, battle alarms at noonday,
20:17 because he did not kill me in the womb! Then my mother would have been my grave, her womb confining me forever.
20:18 Why did I come forth from the womb, to see sorrow and pain, to end my days in shame?
21:1 The word which came to Jeremiah from the when King Zedekiah sent Pashhur, son of Malchiah, and the priest Zephaniah, son of Maaseiah, to him with this request:
21:2 Inquire for us of the , because Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, is attacking us. Perhaps the will act for us in accord with his wonderful works by making him withdraw from us.
21:3 But Jeremiah answered them: This is what you shall report to Zedekiah:
21:4 Thus says the , the God of Israel: I will turn against you the weapons with which you are fighting the king of Babylon and the Chaldeans who besiege you outside the walls. These weapons I will pile up in the midst of this city,
21:5 and I myself will fight against you with outstretched hand and mighty arm, in anger, wrath, and great rage!
21:6 I will strike down the inhabitants of this city, human being and beast; they shall die in a great pestilence.
21:7 After that—oracle of the —I will hand over Zedekiah, king of Judah, and his ministers and the people in this city who survive pestilence, sword, and famine, to Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, to their enemies and those who seek their lives. He shall strike them down with the edge of the sword, without quarter, without mercy or compassion.
21:8 And to this people you shall say: Thus says the : See, I am giving you a choice between the way to life and the way to death.
21:9 Whoever remains in this city shall die by the sword or famine or pestilence. But whoever leaves and surrenders to the Chaldeans who are besieging you shall live and escape with his life.
21:10 I have set my face against this city, for evil and not for good—oracle of the . It shall be given into the power of the king of Babylon who shall set it on fire.
21:11 To the royal house of Judah: Hear the word of the ,
21:12 house of David! Thus says the : Each morning dispense justice, rescue the oppressed from the hand of the oppressor, Or my fury will break out like fire and burn with no one to quench it because of your evil deeds.
21:13 Beware! I am against you, Ruler of the Valley, Rock of the Plain—oracle of the . You say, Who will attack us, who can storm our defenses?
21:14 I will punish you—oracle of the — as your deeds deserve! I will kindle a fire in its forest that shall devour all its surroundings.
22:1 Thus says the : Go down to the palace of the king of Judah and there deliver this word:
22:2 You shall say: Listen to the word of the , king of Judah, who sit on the throne of David, you, your ministers, and your people who enter by these gates!
22:3 Thus says the : Do what is right and just. Rescue the victims from the hand of their oppressors. Do not wrong or oppress the resident alien, the orphan, or the widow, and do not shed innocent blood in this place.
22:4 If you carry out these commands, kings who succeed to the throne of David will continue to enter the gates of this house, riding in chariots or mounted on horses, with their ministers, and their people.
22:5 But if you do not obey these commands, I swear by myself—oracle of the : this house shall become rubble.
22:6 For thus says the concerning the house of the king of Judah: Though you be to me like Gilead, like the peak of Lebanon, I swear I shall turn you into a waste, with cities uninhabited.
22:7 Against you I will send destroyers, each with their tools: They shall cut down your choice cedars, and cast them into the fire.
22:8 Many nations will pass by this city and ask one another: Why has the done this to so great a city?
22:9 And they will be told: Because they have deserted their covenant with the , their God, by worshiping and serving other gods.
22:10 Do not weep for him who is dead, nor mourn for him! Weep rather for him who is going away; never again to see the land of his birth.
22:11 Thus says the concerning Shallum, son of Josiah, king of Judah, his fathers successor, who left this place: He shall never return,
22:12 but in the place where they exiled him, there he shall die; he shall never see this land again.
22:13 Woe to him who builds his house on wrongdoing, his roof-chambers on injustice; Who works his neighbors without pay, and gives them no wages.
22:14 Who says, I will build myself a spacious house, with airy rooms, Who cuts out windows for it, panels it with cedar, and paints it with vermilion.
22:15 Must you prove your rank among kings by competing with them in cedar? Did not your father eat and drink, And act justly and righteously? Then he prospered.
22:16 Because he dispensed justice to the weak and the poor, he prospered. Is this not to know me?— oracle of the .
22:17 But your eyes and heart are set on nothing except your own gain, On shedding innocent blood and practicing oppression and extortion.
22:18 Therefore, thus says the concerning Jehoiakim, son of Josiah, king of Judah: They shall not lament him, Alas! my brother; Alas! sister. They shall not lament him, Alas, Lord! alas, Majesty!
22:19 The burial of a donkey he shall be given, dragged forth and cast out beyond the gates of Jerusalem.
22:20 Climb Lebanon and cry out, in Bashan lift up your voice; Cry out from Abarim, for all your lovers are crushed.
22:21 I spoke to you when you were secure, but you answered, I will not listen. This has been your way from your youth, not to listen to my voice.
22:22 The wind shall shepherd all your shepherds, your lovers shall go into exile. Surely then you shall be ashamed and confounded because of all your wickedness.
22:23 You who dwell on Lebanon, who nest in the cedars, How you shall groan when pains come upon you, like the pangs of a woman in childbirth!
22:24 As I live—oracle of the —even if you, Coniah, son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, were a signet ring on my right hand, I would snatch you off.
22:25 I will hand you over to those who seek your life, to those you dread: Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, and the Chaldeans.
22:26 I will cast you out, you and the mother who bore you, into a land different from the land of your birth; and there you will die;
22:27 Neither shall return to the land for which they yearn.
22:28 Is this man Coniah a thing despised, to be broken, a vessel that no one wants? Why are he and his offspring cast out? why thrown into a land they do not know?
22:29 O land, land, land, hear the word of the —
22:30 Thus says the : Write this man down as childless, a man who will never prosper in his life! Nor shall any of his descendants prosper, to sit upon the throne of David, to rule again over Judah.
23:1 Woe to the shepherds who destroy and scatter the flock of my pasture—oracle of the .
23:2 Therefore, thus says the , the God of Israel, against the shepherds who shepherd my people: You have scattered my sheep and driven them away. You have not cared for them, but I will take care to punish your evil deeds.
23:3 I myself will gather the remnant of my flock from all the lands to which I have banished them and bring them back to their folds; there they shall be fruitful and multiply.
23:4 I will raise up shepherds for them who will shepherd them so that they need no longer fear or be terrified; none shall be missing—oracle of the .
23:5 See, days are coming—oracle of the — when I will raise up a righteous branch for David; As king he shall reign and govern wisely, he shall do what is just and right in the land.
23:6 In his days Judah shall be saved, Israel shall dwell in security. This is the name to be given him: The our justice.
23:7 Therefore, the days are coming—oracle of the —when they shall no longer say, As the lives, who brought the Israelites out of the land of Egypt;
23:8 but rather, As the lives, who brought the descendants of the house of Israel up from the land of the north—and from all the lands to which I banished them; they shall again live on their own soil.
23:9 Concerning the prophets: My heart is broken within me, all my bones tremble; I am like a drunk, like one overcome by wine, Because of the , because of his holy words.
23:10 The land is filled with adulterers; because of the curse the land mourns, the pastures of the wilderness are withered. Theirs is an evil course, theirs is unjust power.
23:11 Both prophet and priest are godless! In my very house I find their wickedness— oracle of the .
23:12 Hence their way shall become for them slippery ground. Into the darkness they shall be driven, and fall headlong; For I will bring disaster upon them, the year of their punishment—oracle of the .
23:13 Among Samarias prophets I saw something unseemly: They prophesied by Baal and led my people Israel astray.
23:14 But among Jerusalems prophets I saw something more shocking: Adultery, walking in deception, strengthening the power of the wicked, so that no one turns from evil; To me they are all like Sodom, its inhabitants like Gomorrah.
23:15 Therefore, thus says the of hosts against the prophets: Look, I will give them wormwood to eat, and poisoned water to drink; For from Jerusalems prophets ungodliness has gone forth into the whole land.
23:16 Thus says the of hosts: Do not listen to the words of your prophets, who fill you with emptiness; They speak visions from their own fancy, not from the mouth of the .
23:17 They say to those who despise the word of the , Peace shall be yours; And to everyone who walks in hardness of heart, No evil shall overtake you.
23:18 Now, who has stood in the council of the , to see him and to hear his word? Who has heeded his word so as to announce it?
23:19 See, the storm of the ! His wrath breaks forth In a whirling storm that bursts upon the heads of the wicked.
23:20 The anger of the shall not abate until he has carried out completely the decisions of his heart. In days to come you will understand fully.
23:21 I did not send these prophets, yet they ran; I did not speak to them, yet they prophesied.
23:22 Had they stood in my council, they would have proclaimed my words to my people, They would have brought them back from their evil ways and from their wicked deeds.
23:23 Am I a God near at hand only—oracle of the — and not a God far off?
23:24 Can anyone hide in secret without my seeing them?—oracle of the . Do I not fill heaven and earth?—oracle of the .
23:25 I have heard the prophets who prophesy lies in my name say, I had a dream! I had a dream!
23:26 How long? Will the hearts of the prophets who prophesy lies and their own deceitful fancies ever turn back?
23:27 By the dreams they tell each other, they plan to make my people forget my name, just as their ancestors forgot my name for Baal.
23:28 Let the prophets who have dreams tell their dreams; let those who have my word speak my word truthfully! What has straw to do with wheat? —oracle of the .
23:29 Is not my word like fire—oracle of the — like a hammer shattering rock?
23:30 Therefore I am against the prophets—oracle of the —those who steal my words from each other.
23:31 Yes, I am against the prophets—oracle of the —those who compose their own speeches and call them oracles.
23:32 Yes, I am against the prophets who tell lying dreams—oracle of the —those who lead my people astray by recounting their reckless lies. It was not I who sent them or commanded them; they do this people no good at all—oracle of the .
23:33 And when this people or a prophet or a priest asks you, What is the burden of the ? you shall answer, You are the burden, and I cast you off—oracle of the .
23:34 If a prophet or a priest or anyone else mentions the burden of the , I will punish that man and his household.
23:35 Thus you shall ask, when speaking to one another, What answer did the give? or What did the say?
23:36 But the burden of the you shall mention no more. For each of you, your own word becomes the burden so that you pervert the words of the living God, the of hosts, our God.
23:37 Thus shall you ask the prophet, What answer did the give? or What did the say?
23:38 But if you ask about the burden of the , then thus says the : Because you use this phrase, the burden of the , though I forbade you to use it,
23:39 therefore I will lift you on high and cast you from my presence, you and the city which I gave to you and your ancestors.
23:40 And I will bring upon you eternal reproach, eternal shame, never to be forgotten.
24:1 The showed me two baskets of figs placed before the temple of the . This was after Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, had exiled from Jerusalem Jeconiah, son of Jehoiakim, king of Judah, and the princes of Judah, the artisans and smiths, and brought them to Babylon.
24:2 One basket contained excellent figs, those that ripen early. But the other basket contained very bad figs, so bad they could not be eaten.
24:3 Then the said to me: What do you see, Jeremiah? Figs, I replied; the good ones are very good, but the bad ones very bad, so bad they cannot be eaten.
24:4 Thereupon this word of the came to me:
24:5 Thus says the , the God of Israel: Like these good figs, I will also regard with favor Judahs exiles whom I sent away from this place into the land of the Chaldeans.
24:6 I will look after them for good and bring them back to this land, to build them up, not tear them down; to plant them, not uproot them.
24:7 I will give them a heart to know me, that I am the . They shall be my people and I will be their God, for they shall return to me with their whole heart.
24:8 But like the figs that are bad, so bad they cannot be eaten—yes, thus says the —even so will I treat Zedekiah, king of Judah, and his princes, the remnant of Jerusalem remaining in this land and those who have settled in the land of Egypt.
24:9 I will make them an object of horror to all the kingdoms of the earth, a reproach and a byword, a taunt and a curse, in all the places to which I will drive them.
24:10 I will send upon them sword, famine, and pestilence, until they have disappeared from the land which I gave them and their ancestors.
25:1 The word that came to Jeremiah concerning all the people of Judah, in the fourth year of Jehoiakim, son of Josiah, king of Judah (the first year of Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon).
25:2 This word the prophet Jeremiah spoke to all the people of Judah and all the inhabitants of Jerusalem:
25:3 Since the thirteenth year of Josiah, son of Amon, king of Judah, to this day—that is, twenty-three years—the word of the has come to me and I spoke to you untiringly, but you would not listen.
25:4 The kept sending you all his servants the prophets, but you refused to listen or pay attention
25:5 to this message: Turn back, each of you, from your evil way and from your evil deeds; then you shall remain in the land which the gave you and your ancestors, from of old and forever.
25:6 Do not follow other gods to serve and bow down to them; do not provoke me with the works of your hands, or I will bring evil upon you.
25:7 But you would not listen to me—oracle of the —and so you provoked me with the works of your hands to your own harm.
25:8 Hence, thus says the of hosts: Since you would not listen to my words,
25:9 I am about to send for and fetch all the tribes from the north—oracle of the —and I will send for Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, my servant; I will bring them against this land, its inhabitants, and all these neighboring nations. I will doom them, making them an object of horror, of hissing, of everlasting reproach.
25:10 Among them I will put to an end the song of joy and the song of gladness, the voice of the bridegroom and the voice of the bride, the sound of the millstone and the light of the lamp.
25:11 This whole land shall be a ruin and a waste. Seventy years these nations shall serve the king of Babylon;
25:12 but when the seventy years have elapsed, I will punish the king of Babylon and that nation and the land of the Chaldeans for their guilt—oracle of the . Their land I will turn into everlasting waste.
25:13 Against that land I will fulfill all the words I have spoken against it, all that is written in this book, which Jeremiah prophesied against all the nations.
25:14 They also shall serve many nations and great kings, and thus I will repay them according to their own deeds and according to the works of their hands.
25:15 For thus said the , the God of Israel, to me: Take this cup of the wine of wrath from my hand and have all the nations to whom I will send you drink it.
25:16 They shall drink, and retch, and go mad, because of the sword I will send among them.
25:17 I took the cup from the hand of the and gave it as drink to all the nations to whom the sent me:
25:18 to Jerusalem, the cities of Judah, its kings and princes, to make them a ruin and a waste, an object of hissing and cursing, as they are today;
25:19 to Pharaoh, king of Egypt, and his servants, princes, all his people
25:20 and those of mixed ancestry; all the kings of the land of Uz; all the kings of the land of the Philistines: Ashkelon, Gaza, Ekron, and the remnant of Ashdod;
25:21 Edom, Moab, and the Ammonites;
25:22 all the kings of Tyre, of Sidon, and of the shores beyond the sea;
25:23 Dedan and Tema and Buz, all the desert dwellers who shave their temples;
25:24 all the kings of Arabia;
25:25 all the kings of Zimri, of Elam, of the Medes;
25:26 all the kings of the north, near and far, one after the other; all the kingdoms upon the face of the earth and after them the king of Sheshach shall drink.
25:27 Tell them: Thus says the of hosts, the God of Israel: Drink! Get drunk and vomit! Fall, never to rise, before the sword that I will send among you!
25:28 If they refuse to take the cup from your hand and drink, say to them: Thus says the of hosts: You must drink!
25:29 Now that I am inflicting evil on this city, called by my name, how can you possibly escape? You shall not escape! I am calling down the sword upon all the inhabitants of the earth—oracle of the of hosts.
25:30 As for you, prophesy against them all these words and say to them: The roars from on high, from his holy dwelling he raises his voice; Mightily he roars over his sheepfold, a shout like that of vintagers echoes over all the inhabitants of the earth.
25:31 The uproar spreads to the end of the earth; For the has an indictment against the nations, he enters into judgment against all flesh: The wicked shall be given to the sword— oracle of the .
25:32 Thus says the of hosts: Look! disaster stalks nation after nation; A violent storm surges from the recesses of the earth.
25:33 On that day, those whom the has slain will be strewn from one end of the earth to the other. They will not be mourned, they will not be gathered, they will not be buried; they shall lie like dung upon the ground.
25:34 Howl, you shepherds, and wail! roll on the ground, leaders of the flock! The time for your slaughter has come; like choice rams you shall fall.
25:35 There is no flight for the shepherds, no escape for the leaders of the flock.
25:36 Listen! Wailing from the shepherds, howling from the leaders of the flock! For the lays waste their grazing place;
25:37 desolate are the peaceful pastures, from the burning wrath of the .
25:38 Like a lion he leaves his lair, and their land is made desolate By the sweeping sword, and the burning wrath of the .
26:1 In the beginning of the reign of Jehoiakim, son of Josiah, king of Judah, this word came from the :
26:2 Thus says the : Stand in the court of the house of the and speak to the inhabitants of all the cities of Judah who come to worship in the house of the ; whatever I command you, tell them, and hold nothing back.
26:3 Perhaps they will listen and turn, all of them from their evil way, so that I may repent of the evil I plan to inflict upon them for their evil deeds.
26:4 Say to them: Thus says the : If you do not obey me, by walking according to the law I set before you
26:5 and listening to the words of my servants the prophets, whom I kept sending you, even though you do not listen to them,
26:6 I will treat this house like Shiloh, and make this city a curse for all the nations of the earth.
26:7 Now the priests, the prophets, and all the people heard Jeremiah speaking these words in the house of the .
26:8 When Jeremiah finished speaking all that the commanded him to speak to all the people, then the priests, the prophets, and all the people laid hold of him, crying, You must die!
26:9 Why do you prophesy in the name of the : This house shall become like Shiloh, and This city shall be desolate, without inhabitant? And all the people crowded around Jeremiah in the house of the .
26:10 When the princes of Judah heard about these things, they came up from the house of the king to the house of the and convened at the New Gate of the house of the .
