12:15 Then they shall know that I am the , when I disperse them among the nations and scatter them throughout the lands.
12:16 But I will let a few of them escape the sword, starvation, and plague, so that they may recount all their abominations among the nations to which they go. Thus they may know that I am the .
12:17 The word of the came to me:
12:18 Son of man, eat your bread trembling and drink your water shaking with fear.
12:19 And say to the people of the land: Thus says the Lord about the inhabitants of Jerusalem in the land of Israel: they shall eat their bread in fear and drink their water in horror, because the land will be emptied of what fills it—the lawlessness of all its inhabitants.
12:20 Inhabited cities shall be in ruins, the land a desolate place. Then you shall know that I am the .
12:21 The word of the came to me:
12:22 Son of man, what is this proverb you have in the land of Israel: The days drag on, and every vision fails?
12:23 Say to them therefore: Thus says the Lord : I will put an end to that proverb; they shall never use it again in Israel. Say to them instead: The days are at hand and every vision fulfilled.
12:24 No longer shall there be any false visions or deceitful divinations within the house of Israel,
12:25 for whatever word I speak shall happen without delay. In your days, rebellious house, whatever I speak I will bring about—oracle of the Lord .
12:26 The word of the came to me:
12:27 Son of man, listen! The house of Israel is saying, The vision he sees is a long time off; he prophesies for distant times!
12:28 Say to them therefore: Thus says the Lord : None of my words shall be delayed any longer. Whatever I say is final; it shall be done—oracle of the Lord .
13:1 The word of the came to me:
13:2 Son of man, prophesy against the prophets of Israel, prophesy! Say to those who prophesy their own thoughts: Hear the word of the !
13:3 Thus says the Lord : Woe to those prophets, the fools who follow their own spirit and see nothing.
13:4 Like foxes among ruins are your prophets, Israel!
13:5 You did not step into the breach, nor repair the wall around the house of Israel so it would stand firm against attack on the day of the .
13:6 False visions! Lying divinations! They say, The oracle of the , even though the did not send them. Then they expect their word to be confirmed!
13:7 Was not the vision you saw false? Did you not report a lying divination when you said, Oracle of the , even though I never spoke?
13:8 Therefore thus says the Lord : Because you have spoken falsehood and seen lying visions, therefore, for certain I am coming at you—oracle of the Lord .
13:9 My hand is against the prophets who see false visions and who make lying divinations. They shall not belong to the community of my people. They shall not be written in the register of the house of Israel, nor shall they enter the land of Israel. Thus you shall know that I am the .
13:10 Because they led my people astray, saying, Peace! when there is no peace, and when a wall is built, they cover it with whitewash,
13:11 say then to the whitewashers: I will bring down a flooding rain; hailstones shall fall, and a stormwind shall break forth.
13:12 When the wall has fallen, will you not be asked: Where is the whitewash you spread on it?
13:13 Therefore thus says the Lord : In my fury I will let loose stormwinds; because of my anger there will be flooding rain, and hailstones will fall with destructive wrath.
13:14 I will tear down the wall you whitewashed and level it to the ground, laying bare its foundations. When it falls, you shall be crushed beneath it. Thus you shall know that I am the .
13:15 When I have poured out my fury on the wall and its whitewashers, it will fall. Then I will say to you: No wall! No whitewashers—
13:16 the prophets of Israel who prophesy to Jerusalem and see visions of peace for it when there is no peace—oracle of the Lord .
13:17 As for you, son of man, now set your face against the daughters of your people who play the prophet from their own thoughts, and prophesy against them.
13:18 You shall say, Thus says the Lord : Woe to those who sew amulets for the wrists of every arm and make veils for every head size to snare lives! You ensnare the lives of my people, even as you preserve your own lives!
13:19 You have profaned me among my people for handfuls of barley and crumbs of bread, slaying those who should not be slain, and keeping alive those who should not live, lying to my people, who listen to lies.
13:20 Therefore thus says the Lord : See! I am coming after your amulets by which you ensnare lives like prey. I will tear them from your arms and set free the lives of those you have ensnared like prey.
13:21 I will tear off your veils and deliver my people from your power, so that they shall never again be ensnared by your hands. Thus you shall know that I am the .
13:22 Because you discourage the righteous with lies when I did not want them to be distressed, and encourage the wicked so they do not turn from their evil ways and save their lives,
13:23 therefore you shall no longer see false visions or practice divination again. I will deliver my people from your hand. Thus you shall know that I am the .
14:1 Some elders of Israel came and sat down before me.
14:2 Then the word of the came to me:
14:3 Son of man, these men keep the memory of their idols alive in their hearts, setting the stumbling block of their sin before them. Should I allow myself to be consulted by them?
14:4 Therefore say to them: Thus says the Lord : If any of the house of Israel who keep the memory of their idols in their hearts, setting the stumbling block of their sin before them, come to a prophet, I the will answer in person because of their many idols,
14:5 in order to catch the hearts of the house of Israel, estranged from me because of all their idols.
14:6 Therefore say to the house of Israel: Thus says the Lord : Return, turn away from your idols; from all your abominations, turn your faces.
14:7 For if anyone of the house of Israel or any alien residing in Israel who are estranged from me and who keep their idols in their hearts, setting the stumbling block of their sin before them, come to ask a prophet to consult me on their behalf, I the will answer them in person.
14:8 I will set my face against them and make them a sign and a byword, and cut them off from the midst of my people. Thus you shall know that I am the .
14:9 As for the prophet, if he speaks a deceiving word, I the am the one who deceives that prophet. I will stretch out my hand against him and destroy him from the midst of my people Israel.
14:10 They will be punished for their own sins, the inquirer and the prophet alike,
14:11 so that the house of Israel may no longer stray from me, no longer defile themselves by all their sins. Then they shall be my people, and I shall be their God—oracle of the Lord . 
14:12 The word of the came to me:
14:13 Son of man, if a land sins against me by breaking faith, and I stretch out my hand against it, breaking its staff of bread and setting famine loose upon it, cutting off from it human being and beast alike—
14:14 even if these three were in it, Noah, Daniel, and Job, they could only save themselves by their righteousness—oracle of the Lord .
14:15 If I summoned wild beasts to prowl the land, depopulating it so that it became a wasteland which no one would cross because of the wild beasts,
14:16 and these three were in it, as I live—oracle of the Lord —I swear they could save neither sons nor daughters; they alone would be saved, but the land would become a wasteland.
14:17 Or if I bring the sword upon this land, commanding the sword to pass through the land cutting off from it human being and beast alike,
14:18 and these three were in it, as I live—oracle of the Lord —they could save neither sons nor daughters; they alone would be saved.
14:19 Or if I send plague into this land, pouring out upon it my bloody wrath, cutting off from it human being and beast alike,
14:20 even if Noah, Daniel, and Job were in it, as I live—oracle of the Lord —they could save neither son nor daughter; they would save only themselves by their righteousness.
14:21 Thus says the Lord : Even though I send against Jerusalem my four evil punishments—sword, famine, wild beasts, and plague—to cut off from it human being and beast alike,
14:22 there will still be some survivors in it who will bring out sons and daughters. When they come out to you and you see their ways and their deeds, you shall be consoled regarding the evil I brought on Jerusalem, everything I brought upon it.
14:23 They shall console you when you see their ways and their deeds, and you shall know that not without reason did I do to it everything I did—oracle of the Lord .
15:1 The word of the came to me:
15:2 Son of man, what makes the wood of the vine Better than the wood of branches found on the trees in the forest?
15:3 Can wood be taken from it to make something useful? Can someone make even a peg out of it on which to hang a vessel?
15:4 Of course not! If it is fed to the fire for fuel, and the fire devours both ends of it, Leaving the middle charred, is it useful for anything then?
15:5 Even when it is whole it cannot be used for anything; So when fire has devoured and charred it, how useful can it be?
15:6 Therefore, thus says the Lord : Like vine wood among forest trees, which I have given as fuel for fire, So I will give the inhabitants of Jerusalem.
15:7 I will set my face against them: Although they have escaped the fire, the fire will still devour them; You shall know that I am the , when I set my face against them.
15:8 Yes, I will make the land desolate, because they are so unfaithful— oracle of the Lord .
16:1 The word of the came to me:
16:2 Son of man, make known to Jerusalem her abominations.
16:3 You shall say, Thus says the Lord to Jerusalem: By origin and birth you belong to the land of the Canaanites; your father was an Amorite, your mother a Hittite.
16:4 As for your birth, on the day you were born your navel cord was not cut; you were not washed with water or anointed; you were not rubbed with salt or wrapped in swaddling clothes.
16:5 No eye looked on you with pity or compassion to do any of these things for you. Rather, on the day you were born you were left out in the field, rejected.
16:6 Then I passed by and saw you struggling in your blood, and I said to you in your blood, Live!
16:7 I helped you grow up like a field plant, so that you grew, maturing into a woman with breasts developed and hair grown; but still you were stark naked.
16:8 I passed by you again and saw that you were now old enough for love. So I spread the corner of my cloak over you to cover your nakedness; I swore an oath to you and entered into covenant with you—oracle of the Lord —and you became mine.
16:9 Then I bathed you with water, washed away your blood, and anointed you with oil.
16:10 I clothed you with an embroidered gown, put leather sandals on your feet; I gave you a fine linen sash and silk robes to wear.
16:11 I adorned you with jewelry, putting bracelets on your arms, a necklace about your neck,
16:12 a ring in your nose, earrings in your ears, and a beautiful crown on your head.
16:13 Thus you were adorned with gold and silver; your garments made of fine linen, silk, and embroidered cloth. Fine flour, honey, and olive oil were your food. You were very, very beautiful, fit for royalty.
16:14 You were renowned among the nations for your beauty, perfected by the splendor I showered on you—oracle of the Lord .
16:15 But you trusted in your own beauty and used your renown to serve as a prostitute. You poured out your prostitution on every passerby—let it be his.
16:16 You took some of your garments and made for yourself gaudy high places, where you served as a prostitute. It has never happened before, nor will it happen again!
16:17 You took the splendid gold and silver ornaments that I had given you and made for yourself male images and served as a prostitute with them.
16:18 You took your embroidered garments to cover them; my oil and my incense you set before them;
16:19 the food I had given you, the fine flour, the oil, and the honey with which I fed you, you set before them as a pleasant odor, says the Lord .
16:20 The sons and daughters you bore for me you took and offered as sacrifices for them to devour! Was it not enough that you had become a prostitute?
16:21 You slaughtered and immolated my children to them, making them pass through fire.
16:22 In all your abominations and prostitutions you did not remember the days of your youth when you were stark naked, struggling in your blood.
16:23 Then after all your evildoing—woe, woe to you! oracle of the Lord —
16:24 you built yourself a platform and raised up a dais in every public place.
16:25 At every intersection you built yourself a dais so that you could degrade your beauty by spreading your legs for every passerby, multiplying your prostitutions.
16:26 You served as a prostitute with the Egyptians, your big-membered neighbors, and multiplied your prostitutions to provoke me.
16:27 Therefore I stretched out my hand against you and reduced your allotment, and delivered you over to the whim of your enemies, the Philistines, who were revolted by your depraved conduct.
16:28 You also served as a prostitute for the Assyrians, because you were not satisfied. Even after serving as a prostitute for them, you were still not satisfied.
16:29 You increased your prostitutions again, now going to Chaldea, the land of traders; but despite this, you were still not satisfied.
16:30 How wild your lust!—oracle of the Lord —that you did all these works of a shameless prostitute,
16:31 when you built your platform at every intersection and set up your high place in every public square. But unlike a prostitute, you disdained payment.
16:32 Adulterous wife, taking strangers in place of her husband!
16:33 Prostitutes usually receive gifts. But you bestowed gifts on all your lovers, bribing them to come to you for prostitution from every side.
16:34 Thus in your prostitution you were different from any other woman. No one solicited you for prostitution. Instead, you yourself offered payment; what a reversal!
16:35 Therefore, prostitute, hear the word of the !
16:36 Thus says the Lord : Because you poured out your lust and exposed your nakedness in your prostitution with your lovers and your abominable idols, because you gave the life-blood of your children to them,
16:37 therefore, I will now gather together all your lovers with whom you found pleasure, both those you loved and those you hated; I will gather them against you from all sides and expose you naked for them to see.
16:38 I will inflict on you the sentence of adultery and murder; I will bring on you bloody wrath and jealous anger.
16:39 I will hand you over to them to tear down your platform and demolish your high place, to strip you of your garments and take away your splendid ornaments, leaving you stark naked.
16:40 They shall lead an assembly against you to stone you and hack you to pieces with their swords.
16:41 They shall set fire to your homes and inflict punishments on you while many women watch. Thus I will put an end to your prostitution, and you shall never again offer payment.
16:42 When I have spent my fury upon you I will stop being jealous about you, and calm down, no longer angry.
16:43 Because you did not remember the days of your youth but enraged me with all these things, see, I am bringing down your ways upon your head—oracle of the Lord . Have you not added depravity to your other abominations?
16:44 See, everyone who makes proverbs will make this proverb about you, Like mother, like daughter.
16:45 Yes, you are truly the daughter of your mother who rejected her husband and children: you are truly a sister to your sisters who rejected their husbands and children—your mother was a Hittite and your father an Amorite.
16:46 Your elder sister was Samaria with her daughters to the north of you; and your younger sister was Sodom and her daughters, south of you.
16:47 Not only did you walk in their ways and act as abominably as they did, but in a very short time you became more corrupt in all your ways than they were.
16:48 As I live—oracle of the Lord —I swear that your sister Sodom with her daughters have not done the things you and your daughters have done!
16:49 Now look at the guilt of your sister Sodom: she and her daughters were proud, sated with food, complacent in prosperity. They did not give any help to the poor and needy.
16:50 Instead, they became arrogant and committed abominations before me; then, as you have seen, I removed them.
16:51 Samaria did not commit half the sins you did. You have done more abominable things than they did. You even made your sisters look righteous, with all the abominations you have done.
16:52 You, then, must bear your disgrace, for you have made a case for your sisters! Because your sins are more abominable than theirs, they seem righteous compared to you. Blush for shame, and bear the disgrace of having made your sisters appear righteous.
16:53 I will restore their fortunes, the fortunes of Sodom and her daughters, the fortunes of Samaria and her daughters—and your fortunes along with them.
16:54 Thus you must bear your disgrace and be ashamed of all you have done to bring them comfort.
16:55 Yes, your sisters, Sodom and her daughters, Samaria and her daughters, shall return to the way they were, and you and your daughters shall return to the way you were.
16:56 Did you not hold your sister Sodom in bad repute while you felt proud of yourself,
16:57 before your evil was exposed? Now you are like her, reproached by the Arameans and all their neighbors, despised on all sides by the Philistines.
16:58 The penalty of your depravity and your abominations—you must bear it all—oracle of the .
16:59 For thus says the Lord : I will deal with you for what you did; you despised an oath by breaking a covenant.
16:60 But I will remember the covenant I made with you when you were young; I will set up an everlasting covenant with you.
16:61 Then you shall remember your ways and be ashamed when you receive your sisters, those older and younger than you; I give them to you as daughters, but not by reason of your covenant.
16:62 For I will re-establish my covenant with you, that you may know that I am the ,
16:63 that you may remember and be ashamed, and never again open your mouth because of your disgrace, when I pardon you for all you have done—oracle of the Lord .
17:1 The word of the came to me:
17:2 Son of man, propose a riddle, and tell this proverb to the house of Israel:
17:3 Thus says the Lord : The great eagle, with wide wingspan and long feathers, with thick plumage, many-hued, came to Lebanon. He plucked the crest of the cedar,
17:4 broke off its topmost branch, And brought it to a land of merchants, set it in a city of traders.
17:5 Then he took some native seed and planted it in fertile soil; A shoot beside plentiful waters, like a willow he planted it,
17:6 That it might sprout and become a vine, dense and low-lying, With its branches turned toward him, its roots beneath it. Thus it became a vine, produced branches, and put forth shoots.
17:7 Then another great eagle appeared, with wide wingspan, rich in plumage, And see! This vine bent its roots to him, sent out branches for him to water. From the bed where it was planted,
17:8 it was transplanted to a fertile field By abundant waters, to produce branches, to bear fruit, to become a majestic vine.
17:9 Say: Thus says the Lord : Can it thrive? Will he not tear up its roots and strip its fruit? Then all its green leaves will wither— neither strong arm nor mighty nation is needed to uproot it.
17:10 True, it is planted; but will it thrive? Will it not wither up When the east wind strikes it, wither in the very bed where it sprouted?
17:11 The word of the came to me:
17:12 Now say to the rebellious house: Do you not understand this? Tell them! The king of Babylon came to Jerusalem and took away its king and officials and brought them to him in Babylon.
17:13 After removing the nobles from the land, he then took one of the royal line And made a covenant with him, binding him under oath,
17:14 To be a humble kingdom, without high aspirations, to keep his covenant and so survive.
17:15 But this one rebelled against him by sending envoys to Egypt To obtain horses and a mighty army. Can he thrive? Can he escape if he does this? Can he break a covenant and go free?
17:16 As I live—oracle of the Lord — in the house of the king who set him up to rule, Whose oath he ignored and whose covenant he broke, there in Babylon I swear he shall die!
17:17 Pharaoh shall not help him on the day of battle, with a great force and mighty horde, When ramps are thrown up and siege works built for the cutting down of many lives.
17:18 He ignored his oath, breaking his covenant; even though he gave his hand, he did all these things— he shall not escape!
17:19 Therefore, thus says the Lord : As I live, my oath which he spurned, And my covenant which he broke, I will bring down on his head.
17:20 I will spread my net over him, and he will be caught in my snare. I will bring him to Babylon to judge him there because he broke faith with me.
17:21 Any among his forces who escape will fall by the sword, And whoever might survive will be scattered to the winds. Thus you will know that I the have spoken.
17:22 Thus says the Lord : I, too, will pluck from the crest of the cedar the highest branch. From the top a tender shoot I will break off and transplant on a high, lofty mountain.
17:23 On the mountain height of Israel I will plant it. It shall put forth branches and bear fruit, and become a majestic cedar. Every small bird will nest under it, all kinds of winged birds will dwell in the shade of its branches.
17:24 Every tree of the field will know that I am the . I bring low the high tree, lift high the lowly tree, Wither up the green tree, and make the dry tree bloom. As I, the , have spoken, so will I do!
18:1 The word of the came to me: Son of man,
18:2 what is the meaning of this proverb you recite in the land of Israel: Parents eat sour grapes, but the childrens teeth are set on edge?
18:3 As I live—oracle of the Lord : I swear that none of you will ever repeat this proverb in Israel.
18:4 For all life is mine: the life of the parent is like the life of the child, both are mine. Only the one who sins shall die!
18:5 If a man is just—if he does what is right,
18:6 if he does not eat on the mountains, or raise his eyes to the idols of the house of Israel; if he does not defile a neighbors wife, or have relations with a woman during her period;
18:7 if he oppresses no one, gives back the pledge received for a debt, commits no robbery; gives food to the hungry and clothes the naked;
18:8 if he does not lend at interest or exact usury; if he refrains from evildoing and makes a fair judgment between two opponents;
18:9 if he walks by my statutes and is careful to observe my ordinances, that man is just—he shall surely live—oracle of the Lord .
18:10 But if he begets a son who is violent and commits murder, or does any of these things,
18:11 even though the father does none of them—a son who eats on the mountains, defiles the wife of his neighbor,
18:12 oppresses the poor and needy, commits robbery, does not give back a pledge, raises his eyes to idols, does abominable things,
18:13 lends at interest and exacts usury—this son certainly shall not live. Because he practiced all these abominations, he shall surely be put to death; his own blood shall be on him.
18:14 But, in turn, if he begets a son who sees all the sins his father commits, yet fears and does not imitate him—
18:15 a son who does not eat on the mountains, or raise his eyes to the idols of the house of Israel, or defile a neighbors wife;
18:16 who does not oppress anyone, or exact a pledge, or commit robbery; who gives his food to the hungry and clothes the naked;
18:17 who refrains from evildoing, accepts no interest or usury, but keeps my ordinances and walks in my statutes—this one shall not die for the sins of his father. He shall surely live!
18:18 Only the father, since he committed extortion and robbed his brother, and did what was not good among his people—he will die because of his sin!
18:19 You ask: Why is not the son charged with the guilt of his father? Because the son has done what is just and right and has been careful to observe all my statutes—he shall surely live!
18:20 Only the one who sins shall die. The son shall not be charged with the guilt of his father, nor shall the father be charged with the guilt of his son. Justice belongs to the just, and wickedness to the wicked.
18:21 But if the wicked man turns away from all the sins he has committed, if he keeps all my statutes and does what is just and right, he shall surely live. He shall not die!
18:22 None of the crimes he has committed shall be remembered against him; he shall live because of the justice he has shown.
18:23 Do I find pleasure in the death of the wicked—oracle of the Lord ? Do I not rejoice when they turn from their evil way and live?
18:24 And if the just turn from justice and do evil, like all the abominations the wicked do, can they do this evil and still live? None of the justice they did shall be remembered, because they acted treacherously and committed these sins; because of this, they shall die.
18:25 You say, The s way is not fair! Hear now, house of Israel: Is it my way that is unfair? Are not your ways unfair?
18:26 When the just turn away from justice to do evil and die, on account of the evil they did they must die.
18:27 But if the wicked turn from the wickedness they did and do what is right and just, they save their lives;
18:28 since they turned away from all the sins they committed, they shall live; they shall not die.
18:29 But the house of Israel says, The Lords way is not fair! Is it my way that is not fair, house of Israel? Is it not your ways that are not fair?
18:30 Therefore I will judge you, house of Israel, all of you according to your ways—oracle of the Lord . Turn, turn back from all your crimes, that they may not be a cause of sin for you ever again.
18:31 Cast away from you all the crimes you have committed, and make for yourselves a new heart and a new spirit. Why should you die, house of Israel?
18:32 For I find no pleasure in the death of anyone who dies—oracle of the Lord . Turn back and live!
19:1 As for you, raise a lamentation over the princes of Israel,
19:2 and say: What a lioness was your mother, a lion among lions! She made her lair among young lions, to raise her cubs;
19:3 One cub she raised up, a young lion he became; He learned to tear apart prey, he devoured people.
19:4 Nations heard about him; in their pit he was caught; They took him away with hooks to the land of Egypt.
19:5 When she realized she had waited in vain, she lost hope. She took another of her cubs, and made him a young lion.
19:6 He prowled among the lions, became a young lion; He learned to tear apart prey, he devoured people.
19:7 He ravaged their strongholds, laid waste their cities. The earth and everything in it were terrified at the sound of his roar.
19:8 Nations laid out against him snares all around; They spread their net for him, in their pit he was caught.
19:9 They put him in fetters and took him away to the king of Babylon, So his roar would no longer be heard on the mountains of Israel.
19:10 Your mother was like a leafy vine planted by water, Fruitful and full of branches because of abundant water.
19:11 One strong branch grew into a royal scepter. So tall it towered among the clouds, conspicuous in height, with dense foliage.
19:12 But she was torn out in fury and flung to the ground; The east wind withered her up, her fruit was plucked away; Her strongest branch dried up, fire devoured it.
19:13 Now she is planted in a wilderness, in a dry, parched land.
19:14 Fire flashed from her branch, and devoured her shoots; Now she does not have a strong branch, a royal scepter! This is a lamentation and serves as a lamentation.
20:1 In the seventh year, on the tenth day of the fifth month, some of the elders of Israel came to consult the and sat down before me.
20:2 Then the word of the came to me:
20:3 Son of man, speak to the elders of Israel and say to them: Thus says the Lord : Have you come to consult me? As I live, I will not allow myself to be consulted by you!—oracle of the Lord .
20:4 Will you judge them? Will you judge, son of man? Tell them about the abominations of their ancestors,
20:5 and say to them: Thus says the Lord : The day I chose Israel, I swore to the descendants of the house of Jacob; I revealed myself to them in the land of Egypt and swore to them, saying: I am the , your God.
20:6 That day I swore to bring them out of the land of Egypt to the land I had searched out for them, a land flowing with milk and honey, a jewel among all lands.
20:7 Then I said to them: Throw away, each of you, the detestable things that held your eyes; do not defile yourselves with the idols of Egypt: I am the , your God.
20:8 But they rebelled and refused to listen to me; none of them threw away the detestable things that held their eyes, nor did they abandon the idols of Egypt. Then I considered pouring out my fury and spending my anger against them there in the land of Egypt.
20:9 I acted for the sake of my name, that it should not be desecrated in the eyes of the nations among whom they were: in the eyes of the nations I had made myself known to them, to bring them out of the land of Egypt.
20:10 Therefore I led them out of the land of Egypt and brought them into the wilderness.
20:11 Then I gave them my statutes and made known to them my ordinances, so that everyone who keeps them has life through them.
20:12 I also gave them my sabbaths to be a sign between me and them, to show that it is I, the , who makes them holy.
20:13 But the house of Israel rebelled against me in the wilderness. They did not observe my statutes, and they rejected my ordinances that bring life to those who keep them. My sabbaths, too, they desecrated grievously. Then I considered pouring out my fury on them in the wilderness to put an end to them,
20:14 but I acted for the sake of my name, so it would not be desecrated in the eyes of the nations in whose sight I had brought them out.
20:15 Nevertheless in the wilderness I swore to them that I would not bring them into the land I had given them—a land flowing with milk and honey, a jewel among all the lands.
20:16 Their hearts followed after their idols so closely that they did not live by my statutes, but rejected my ordinances and desecrated my sabbaths.
20:17 But I looked on them with pity, not wanting to destroy them, so I did not put an end to them in the wilderness.
20:18 Then I said to their children in the wilderness: Do not follow the statutes of your parents. Do not keep their ordinances. Do not defile yourselves with their idols.
20:19 I am the , your God: follow my statutes and be careful to observe my ordinances;
20:20 keep holy my sabbaths as a sign between me and you so that you may know that I am the , your God.
20:21 But their children rebelled against me: they did not follow my statutes or keep my ordinances that bring life to those who observe them; my sabbaths they desecrated. Then I considered pouring out my fury on them, spending my anger against them in the wilderness;
20:22 but I stayed my hand, acting for the sake of my name, lest it be desecrated in the eyes of the nations, in whose sight I had brought them out.
20:23 Nevertheless I swore to them in the wilderness that I would disperse them among the nations and scatter them in other lands,
20:24 because they did not carry out my ordinances, but rejected my statutes and desecrated my sabbaths, having eyes only for the idols of their ancestors.
20:25 Therefore I gave them statutes that were not good, and ordinances through which they could not have life.
20:26 I let them become defiled by their offerings, by having them make a fiery offering of every wombs firstborn, in order to ruin them so they might know that I am the .
20:27 Therefore speak to the house of Israel, son of man, and tell them: Thus says the Lord : In this way also your ancestors blasphemed me, breaking faith with me.
20:28 When I brought them to the land I had sworn to give them, and they saw all its high hills and leafy trees, there they offered sacrifices, there they made offerings to provoke me, there they sent up sweet-smelling oblations, there they poured out their libations.
20:29 So I said to them, What is this high place to which you go? Thus its name became high place even to this day.
20:30 Therefore say to the house of Israel: Thus says the Lord : Will you defile yourselves in the way your ancestors did? Will you lust after their detestable idols?
20:31 By offering your gifts, by making your children pass through the fire, you defile yourselves with all your idols even to this day. Shall I let myself be consulted by you, house of Israel? As I live—oracle of the Lord —I swear I will not let myself be consulted by you!
20:32 What has entered your mind shall never happen: You are thinking, We shall be like the nations, like the peoples of foreign lands, serving wood and stone.
20:33 As I live—oracle of the Lord —with mighty hand and outstretched arm, with wrath poured out, I swear I will be king over you!
20:34 With mighty hand and outstretched arm, with wrath poured out, I will bring you out from the nations and gather you from the countries over which you are scattered;
20:35 I will lead you to the wilderness of the peoples and enter into judgment with you face to face.
20:36 Just as I entered into judgment with your ancestors in the wilderness of the land of Egypt, so will I enter into judgment with you—oracle of the Lord .
20:37 Thus I will make you pass under the staff and will impose on you the terms of the covenant.
20:38 I will sort out from you those who defied me and rebelled against me; from the land where they resided as aliens I will bring them out, but they shall not return to the land of Israel. Thus you shall know that I am the .
20:39 As for you, house of Israel, thus says the Lord : Go! each of you, and worship your idols. Listen to me! You shall never again desecrate my holy name with your offerings and your idols!
20:40 For on my holy mountain, on the highest mountain in Israel—oracle of the Lord —there the whole house of Israel shall worship me; there in the land I will accept them all, there I will claim your tributes, the best of your offerings, from all your holy things.
20:41 As a sweet-smelling oblation I will accept you, when I bring you from among the nations and gather you out of the lands over which you were scattered; and through you I will manifest my holiness in the sight of the nations.
20:42 Thus you shall know that I am the , when I bring you back to the soil of Israel, the land I swore to give your ancestors.
20:43 There you shall remember your ways, all the deeds by which you defiled yourselves; and you shall loathe yourselves because of all the evil you did.
20:44 And you shall know that I am the when I deal with you thus, for the sake of my name, not according to your evil ways and wanton deeds, house of Israel—oracle of the Lord .
21:1 The word of the came to me:
21:2 Son of man, turn your face to the south: preach against the south, prophesy against the forest land in the south.
21:3 Say to the forest in the south: Hear the word of the ! Thus says the Lord : See! I am kindling a fire in you that shall devour every green tree as well as every dry tree. The blazing flame shall not be quenched so that from south to north every face shall be scorched by it.
21:4 All flesh shall see that I, the , have kindled it; it shall not be quenched.
21:5 But I said, Ah! Lord , they are saying about me, Is not this the one who is forever spinning parables?
21:6 Then the word of the came to me:
21:7 Son of man, turn your face toward Jerusalem: preach against its sanctuary, prophesy against the land of Israel.
21:8 Say to the land of Israel: Thus says the : See! I am coming against you; I will draw my sword from its scabbard and cut off from you the righteous and the wicked.
21:9 Thus my sword shall come out from its scabbard against all flesh from south to north
21:10 and all flesh shall know that I, the , have drawn my sword from its scabbard. It cannot return again.
21:11 As for you, son of man, groan! with shattered loins and bitter grief, groan in their sight.
21:12 When they ask you, Why are you groaning? you shall say: Because of what I heard! When it comes every heart shall melt, every hand fall helpless; every spirit will grow faint, and every knee run with water. See, it is coming, it is here!—oracle of the Lord .
21:13 The word of the came to me:
21:14 Son of man, prophesy! say: Thus says the : A sword, a sword has been sharpened, a sword, a sword has been burnished:
21:15 Sharpened to make a slaughter, burnished to flash lightning! Why should I stop now? You have rejected the rod and every judgment!
21:16 I have given it over to the burnisher that he might hold it in his hand, A sword sharpened and burnished to be put in the hands of an executioner.
21:17 Cry out and howl, son of man, for it is destined for my people, For all the princes of Israel, victims of the sword with my people. Therefore, slap your thigh,
21:18 for it is tested, and why not? Since you rejected my staff, should it not happen?— oracle of the Lord .
21:19 As for you, son of man, prophesy, and clap your hands! Let the sword strike twice, a third time. It is a sword of slaughter, A sword for slaughtering, whirling around them all,
21:20 That every heart may tremble; for many will be made to stumble. At all their gates I have stationed the sword for slaughter, Made it flash lightning, drawn for slaughter.
21:21 Slash to the right! turn to the left, Wherever your edge is directed!
21:22 Then I, too, shall clap my hands, and spend my fury. I, the , have spoken.
21:23 The word of the came to me:
21:24 Son of man, make for yourself two roads over which the sword of the king of Babylon can come. Both roads shall start out from the same land. Then put a signpost at the head of each road
21:25 so the sword can come to Rabbah of the Ammonites or to Judah and its fortress, Jerusalem.
21:26 For the king of Babylon is standing at the fork of the two roads to read the omens: he shakes out the arrows, inquires of the teraphim, inspects the liver.
21:27 Into his right hand has fallen the lot marked Jerusalem: to order the slaughter, to raise the battle cry, to set the battering rams against the gates, to throw up a ramp, to build siege works.
21:28 In the eyes of those bound by oath this seems like a false omen; yet the lot taken in hand exposes the wickedness for which they, still bound by oath, will be taken in hand.
21:29 Therefore thus says the Lord : Because your guilt has been exposed, your crimes laid bare, your sinfulness revealed in all your deeds—because you have been exposed, you shall be taken in hand.
21:30 And as for you, depraved and wicked prince of Israel, a day is coming to end your life of crime.
21:31 Thus says the Lord : Off with the turban and away with the crown! Nothing shall be as it was! Exalt the lowly and bring the exalted low!
21:32 A ruin, a ruin, a ruin, I shall make it! Nothing will be the same until the one comes to whom I have given it for judgment. 
21:33 As for you, son of man, prophesy: Thus says the Lord to the Ammonites and their insults: O sword, sword drawn for slaughter, burnished to consume, to flash lightning!
21:34 Your false visions and lying omens, Set you over the necks of the slain, the wicked whose day had come— an end to their life of crime.
21:35 Return to your scabbard! In the place you were created, In the land of your origin, I will judge you.
21:36 I will pour out my anger upon you, breathing my fiery wrath against you; I will hand you over to ravagers, artisans of destruction!
21:37 You shall be fuel for the fire, your blood shall flow throughout the land; You shall not be remembered, for I, the , have spoken.
22:1 The word of the came to me:
22:2 You, son of man, will you judge? will you judge the city of bloodshed? Then make known all its abominations,
22:3 and say: Thus says the Lord : O city that sheds blood within itself so that its time has come, that has made idols for its own defilement:
22:4 By the blood you shed you have become guilty, and by the idols you made you have become defiled. You have brought on your day, you have come to the end of your years. Therefore I make you an object of scorn for the nations and a laughingstock for all lands.
22:5 Those near and those far off will mock you: Defiled of Name! Queen of Tumult!
22:6 See! the princes of Israel within you use their power to shed blood.
22:7 Within you, father and mother are dishonored; they extort the resident alien in your midst; within you, they oppress orphans and widows.
22:8 What I consider holy you have rejected, and my sabbaths you have desecrated.
22:9 In you are those who slander to cause bloodshed; within you are those who feast on the mountains; in your midst are those whose actions are depraved.
22:10 In you are those who uncover the nakedness of their fathers; in you those who coerce women to intercourse during their period.
22:11 There are those in you who do abominable things with their neighbors wives, men who defile their daughters-in-law by incest, men who coerce their sisters to intercourse, the daughters of their own fathers.
22:12 There are those in you who take bribes to shed blood. You exact interest and usury; you extort profit from your neighbor by violence. But me you have forgotten—oracle of the Lord .
22:13 See, I am clapping my hands because of the profits you extorted and the blood shed in your midst.
22:14 Will your heart remain firm, will your hands be strong, in the days when I deal with you? I am the ; I have spoken, and I will act!
22:15 I will disperse you among the nations and scatter you over other lands, so that I may purge your filth.
22:16 In you I will allow myself to be desecrated in the eyes of the nations; thus you shall know that I am the .
22:17 The word of the came to me:
22:18 Son of man, the house of Israel has become dross to me. All of them are copper, tin, iron, and lead within a furnace; they have become the dross from silver.
22:19 Therefore thus says the Lord : Because all of you have become dross, See! I am gathering you within Jerusalem.
22:20 Just as silver, copper, iron, lead, and tin are gathered within a furnace to be blasted with fire to smelt it, so I will gather you together in my furious wrath, put you in, and smelt you.
22:21 When I have assembled you, I will blast you with the fire of my anger and smelt you with it.
22:22 Just as silver is smelted in a furnace, so you shall be smelted in it. Thus you shall know that I, the , have poured out my fury on you.
22:23 The word of the came to me:
22:24 Son of man, say to her: You are an unclean land receiving no rain at the time of my fury.
22:25 A conspiracy of its princes is like a roaring lion tearing prey; they devour people, seizing their wealth and precious things, making many widows within her.
22:26 Her priests violate my law and desecrate what I consider holy; they do not distinguish between holy and common, nor teach the difference between unclean and clean; they pay no attention to my sabbaths, so that I have been desecrated in their midst.
22:27 Within her, her officials are like wolves tearing prey, shedding blood and destroying lives to extort profit.
22:28 And her prophets cover them with whitewash, seeing false visions and performing lying divinations, saying, Thus says the Lord , although the has not spoken.
22:29 The people of the land practice extortion and commit robbery; they wrong the poor and the needy, and oppress the resident alien without justice.
22:30 Thus I have searched among them for someone who would build a wall or stand in the breach before me to keep me from destroying the land; but I found no one.
22:31 Therefore I have poured out my fury upon them; with my fiery wrath I have consumed them, bringing down their ways upon their heads—oracle of the Lord .
23:1 The word of the came to me:
23:2 Son of man, there were two women, daughters of the same mother.
23:3 Even as young girls, they were prostitutes, serving as prostitutes in Egypt. There the Egyptians fondled their breasts and caressed their virgin nipples.
23:4 Oholah was the name of the elder, and the name of her sister was Oholibah. They became mine and gave birth to sons and daughters. As for their names: Samaria was Oholah and Jerusalem, Oholibah.
23:5 Oholah became a prostitute while married to me and lusted after her lovers, the Assyrians: warriors
23:6 dressed in purple, governors and officers, all of them handsome young soldiers, mounted on horses.
23:7 She gave herself as a prostitute to them, to all the Assyrian elite; with all those for whom she lusted, she also defiled herself with their idols.
23:8 She did not abandon the prostitution she had begun with the Egyptians, who had lain with her when she was young, fondling her virgin breasts and pouring out their lust upon her.
23:9 Therefore I handed her over to her lovers, to the Assyrians for whom she lusted.
23:10 They exposed her nakedness; her sons and daughters they took away, and her they killed with the sword. She became a byword for women because of the sentence carried out against her.
23:11 Although her sister Oholibah saw all this, her lust was more depraved than her sisters; she outdid her in prostitution.
23:12 She too lusted after the Assyrians, governors and officers, warriors impeccably clothed, mounted on horses, all of them handsome young soldiers.
23:13 I saw that she had defiled herself—now both had gone down the same path.
23:14 She went further in her prostitution: She saw male figures drawn on the wall, images of Chaldeans drawn with vermilion,
23:15 with sashes tied about their waists, flowing turbans on their heads, all looking like chariot warriors, images of Babylonians, natives of Chaldea.
23:16 As soon as she set eyes on them she lusted for them, and she sent messengers to them in Chaldea.
23:17 The Babylonians came to her, to her love couch; they defiled her with their impurities. But as soon as they had defiled her, she recoiled from them.
23:18 When her prostitution was discovered and her shame revealed, I recoiled from her as I had recoiled from her sister.
23:19 But she increased her prostitution, recalling the days of her youth when she had served as a prostitute in the land of Egypt.
23:20 She lusted for the lechers of Egypt, whose members are like those of donkeys, whose thrusts are like those of stallions.
23:21 You reverted to the depravity of your youth, when Egyptians fondled your breasts, caressing your young nipples.
23:22 Therefore, Oholibah, thus says the Lord : I will now stir up your lovers against you, those from whom you recoiled, and I will bring them against you from every side:
23:23 the men of Babylon and all of Chaldea, Pekod, Shoa and Koa, along with all the Assyrians, handsome young soldiers, all of them governors and officers, charioteers and warriors, all of them horsemen.
23:24 They shall invade you with armor, chariots and wagons, a horde of peoples; they will array against you on every side bucklers and shields and helmets. I will give them the right of judgment, and they will judge you according to their standards.
23:25 I will direct my jealousy against you, so that they deal with you in fury, cutting off your nose and ears; what is left of you shall fall by the sword. They shall take away your sons and daughters, and what is left of you shall be devoured by fire.
23:26 They shall strip off your clothes and seize your splendid jewelry.
23:27 I will put an end to your depravity and to your prostitution from the land of Egypt; you shall no longer look to them, nor even remember Egypt again.
23:28 For thus says the Lord : I am now handing you over to those whom you hate, to those from whom you recoil.
23:29 They shall treat you with hatred, seizing all that you worked for and leaving you stark naked, so that your indecent nakedness is exposed. Your depravity and prostitution
23:30 brought these things upon you because you served as a prostitute for the nations, defiling yourself with their idols.
23:31 Because you followed your sisters path, I will put her cup into your hand.
23:32 Thus says the Lord : The cup of your sister you shall drink, deep and wide; It brings ridicule and mockery, it holds so much;
23:33 You will be filled with drunkenness and grief— A cup of horror and devastation, the cup of your sister Samaria;
23:34 You shall drink it dry, its very sherds you will gnaw; And you shall tear out your breasts; for I have spoken—oracle of the Lord .
23:35 Therefore thus says the Lord : You have forgotten me and cast me behind your back; now suffer for your depravity and prostitution.
23:36 Then the said to me: Son of man, would you judge Oholah and Oholibah? Then make known to them their abominations.
23:37 For they committed adultery, and blood covers their hands. They committed adultery with their idols; even the children they bore for me they burnt as food for them.
23:38 And they also did this to me: on that day, they defiled my sanctuary and desecrated my sabbaths.
23:39 On the very day they slaughtered their children for their idols, they entered my sanctuary to desecrate it. Thus they acted within my house!
23:40 Moreover, they sent for men who had to come from afar; when a messenger was sent to them, they came. On their account you bathed, painted your eyes, and put on jewelry.
23:41 You sat on a magnificent couch, set before it a table, on which to lay my incense and oil.
23:42 The cries of a mob! The shouts of men coming in from the wilderness! They put bracelets on the womens arms and splendid crowns on their heads.
23:43 I said: That worn-out one still has adulteries in her! Now they engage her as a prostitute and she
23:44 And indeed they did come in to her as men come in to a prostitute. Thus they came to Oholah and Oholibah, the depraved women.
23:45 The righteous shall certainly punish them with sentences given to adulterers and murderers, for they committed adultery, and blood is on their hands.
23:46 Indeed, thus says the Lord : Raise up an army against them and hand them over to terror and plunder.
23:47 The army will stone them and hack them to pieces with their swords. They will kill their sons and daughters and set fire to their houses.
23:48 Thus I will put an end to depravity in the land, and all women will be warned not to imitate your depravity.
23:49 They shall inflict on you the penalty of your depravity, and you shall pay for your sins of idolatry. Then you shall know that I am the Lord .
24:1 On the tenth day of the tenth month, in the ninth year, the word of the came to me:
24:2 Son of man, write down todays date this very day, for on this very day the king of Babylon lays siege to Jerusalem.
24:3 Propose this parable to the rebellious house and say to them: Thus says the Lord : Put the pot on, put it on! Pour in some water;
24:4 Add to it pieces of meat, all choice pieces; With thigh and shoulder, with choice cuts fill it.
24:5 Choose the pick of the flock, then pile logs beneath it; Bring it to a boil, cook all the pieces in it.
24:6 Therefore thus says the Lord : Woe to the city full of blood! A pot containing filth, whose filth cannot be removed! Take out its pieces one by one, for no lot has fallen on their behalf.
24:7 For her blood is still in her midst; on a bare rock she left it; She did not pour it on the ground to be covered with dirt.
24:8 To arouse wrath, to exact vengeance, I have left her blood on bare rock not to be covered.
24:9 Therefore, thus says the Lord : Woe to the city full of blood! I will make the pyre great!
24:10 Pile on the wood, kindle the fire. Cook the meat, stir the spicy mixture, char the bones!
24:11 Then set it empty on the coals, to heat up until its copper glows, So its impurities melt, its filth disappears.
24:12 The toil is exhausting, but the great filth will not come out— Filth, even with fire.
24:13 Even in defiling yourself with depravity I would still have cleansed you, but you would not have your impurity cleansed. You will not be cleansed now until I wreak my fury on you.
24:14 I, the , have spoken; it will happen! I will do it and not hold back! I will not have pity or relent. By your conduct and deeds you shall be judged— oracle of the Lord .
24:15 The word of the came to me:
24:16 Son of man, with a sudden blow I am taking away from you the delight of your eyes, but do not mourn or weep or shed any tears.
24:17 Groan, moan for the dead, but make no public lament; bind on your turban, put your sandals on your feet, but do not cover your beard or eat the bread of mourners.
24:18 I spoke to the people in the morning. In the evening my wife died. The next morning I did as I had been commanded.
24:19 Then the people asked me, Will you not tell us what all these things you are doing mean for us?
24:20 I said to them, The word of the came to me:
24:21 Say to the house of Israel: Thus says the Lord : I will now desecrate my sanctuary, the pride of your strength, the delight of your eyes, the concern of your soul. The sons and daughters you left behind shall fall by the sword.
24:22 Then you shall do as I have done, not covering your beards nor eating the bread of mourning.
24:23 Your turbans shall remain on your heads, your sandals on your feet. You shall not mourn or weep, but you shall waste away because of your sins and groan to one another.
24:24 Ezekiel shall be a sign for you: everything he did, you shall do. When it happens, you shall know that I am the Lord .
24:25 As for you, son of man, truly, on the very day I take away from them their strength, their glorious joy, the delight of their eyes, the desire of their soul, the pride of their hearts, their sons and daughters,
24:26 on that day a survivor will come to you so that you may hear it with your own ears.
24:27 On that day, with the survivor, your mouth shall be opened; you shall speak and be mute no longer. You shall be a sign to them, and they shall know that I am the .
25:1 The word of the came to me:
25:2 Son of man, turn toward the Ammonites and prophesy against them.
25:3 Say to the Ammonites: Hear the word of the ! Thus says the Lord : Because you jeered at my sanctuary when it was desecrated, at the land of Israel when it was destroyed, and at the house of Judah when they went into exile,
25:4 therefore I am giving you to people from the east as a possession. They shall set up their encampments among you and pitch their tents in your midst; they shall eat your produce and drink your milk.
25:5 And I will turn Rabbah into a pasture for camels and all of Ammon into a grazing place for flocks. Then you shall know that I am the .
25:6 For thus says the Lord : Because you rejoiced over the land of Israel with scorn in your heart, clapping your hands and stamping your feet,
25:7 therefore, see, I am stretching out my hand against you and giving you up as plunder to the nations. I will cut you off from the peoples and wipe you out of the lands. I will destroy you, and you shall know that I am the .
25:8 Thus says the Lord : Because Moab said, See! the house of Judah is like all the other nations,
25:9 therefore, I am exposing the whole flank of Moab with its cities, the jewels of its land: Beth-jesimoth, Baalmeon, and Kiriathaim.
25:10 I will hand it over, along with the Ammonites, to the people from the east that it may not be remembered among the nations.
25:11 I will execute judgment upon Moab that they may know that I am the .
25:12 Thus says the Lord : Because Edom took vengeance on the house of Judah and incurred terrible guilt by taking vengeance on them,
25:13 therefore thus says the Lord : I will stretch out my hand against Edom and cut off from it human being and beast alike. I will turn it into ruins from Teman to Dedan; they shall fall by the sword.
25:14 I will put my vengeance against Edom into the hands of my people Israel; they will deal with Edom in accord with my furious anger. Thus they shall know my vengeance!—oracle of the Lord .
25:15 Thus says the Lord : Because the Philistines acted vengefully and exacted vengeance with intentional malice, destroying with undying hostility,
25:16 therefore thus says the Lord : See! I am stretching out my hand against the Philistines, and I will cut off the Cherethites and wipe out the remnant on the seacoast.
25:17 Thus I will execute great acts of vengeance on them, punishing them furiously. Then they shall know that I am the , when I wreak my vengeance on them.
26:1 On the first day of the eleventh month of the eleventh year, the word of the came to me:
26:2 Son of man, because Tyre said of Jerusalem: Aha! The gateway of the peoples is smashed! It has been turned over to me; I will be enriched by its ruin!
26:3 therefore thus says the Lord : See! I am coming against you, Tyre; I will churn up against you many nations, just as the sea churns up its waves.
26:4 They will destroy the walls of Tyre and tear down its towers; I will scrape off its debris and leave it a bare rock.
26:5 It will become a place for drying nets in the midst of the sea. For I have spoken—oracle of the Lord : she will become plunder for the nations.
26:6 Her daughter cities on the mainland will be slaughtered by the sword; then they shall know that I am the .
26:7 Indeed thus says the Lord : I am bringing up against Tyre from the north, Nebuchadnezzar, King of Babylon, king of kings, with horses and chariots, with cavalry, and a mighty horde of troops.
26:8 Your daughter cities on the mainland he shall slay with the sword. He shall build a siege wall around you, throw up a ramp against you, and raise his shields about you.
26:9 He shall pound your walls with battering-rams and break down your towers with his axes.
26:10 From the surging of his horses he will cover you with dust; from the noise of warhorses, wheels and chariots. Your walls will shake when he enters your gates, even as one enters a city that is breached.
26:11 With the hooves of his horses he will trample all your streets; Your people he will slay by the sword; your mighty pillars will collapse.
26:12 They shall plunder your wealth and pillage your goods; They will tear down your walls and demolish your splendid houses. Your stones, timbers, and debris they will cast into the sea.
26:13 I will bring an end to the noise of your songs; the music of your lyres will be heard no more.
26:14 I will turn you into bare rock, you will become a place for drying nets. You shall never be rebuilt, for I the have spoken— oracle of the Lord .
26:15 Thus says the Lord to Tyre: At the sound of your downfall, at the groaning of the wounded, When victims are slain within you, will the islands not quake?
26:16 All the princes of the sea will step down from their thrones, Lay aside their robes, and strip off their embroidered garments. Clothed in mourning, they will sit on the ground And tremble, horror-struck and appalled at you.
26:17 They will raise lament over you and say to you: How you have perished, gone from the seas, Renowned City! Once she was mighty on the sea, she and her inhabitants, Those who spread their terror to all who dwelt nearby.
26:18 On this, the day of your fall, the islands quake! The islands in the sea are terrified at your passing.
26:19 Indeed thus says the Lord : When I make you a ruined city like cities no longer inhabited, When I churn up the deep and its mighty waters cover you,
26:20 Then I will thrust you down with those who go down to the pit, to those of the bygone age; I will make you dwell in the netherworld, in the everlasting ruins, with those who have gone down to the pit, So you will never return or have a place in the land of the living.
26:21 I will make you a horror, and you shall be no more; You shall be sought for, but never found again— oracle of the Lord .
27:1 The word of the came to me:
27:2 You, son of man, raise a lament over Tyre,
27:3 and say to Tyre, who sits at the entrance to the sea, trader to peoples on many coastlands, Thus says the Lord : Tyre, you said, I am a ship, perfect in beauty;
27:4 In the heart of the sea was your territory; your builders perfected your beauty.
27:5 With juniper wood from Senir they built all your decks; A cedar from Lebanon they took to make you a mast.
27:6 With oaks of Bashan they fashioned your oars, Your bridge, of ivory-inlaid cypress wood from the coasts of Kittim.
27:7 Fine embroidered linen from Egypt became your sail; Your awnings were made of purple and scarlet from the coasts of Elishah.
27:8 Inhabitants of Sidon and Arvad were your oarsmen; Your own sages, Tyre, were on board, serving as your sailors.
27:9 The elders and sages of Gebal were with you to caulk your seams. Every ship and sailor on the sea came to you to carry on trade.
27:10 Persia and Lud and Put were warriors in your army; Shield and helmet they hung on you to enhance your splendor.
27:11 The men of Arvad and Helech were on your walls all around And Gamadites on your towers; they hung their shields around your walls, they made your beauty perfect.
27:12 Tarshish traded with you, so great was your wealth, Exchanging for your wares silver, iron, tin, and lead.
27:13 Javan, Tubal, and Meshech also traded with you, Exchanging slaves and bronze vessels for your merchandise.
27:14 Horses, steeds, and mules from Beth-togarmah were exchanged for your wares.
27:15 Men of Rhodes trafficked with you; many coastlands were your agents; Ivory tusks and ebony wood they brought back as your payment.
27:16 Edom traded with you for your many wares: garnets, purple dye, embroidered cloth, Fine linen, coral, and rubies they gave you as merchandise.
27:17 Judah and the land of Israel trafficked with you: Minnith wheat, grain, honey, oil, and balm they gave you as merchandise.
27:18 Damascus traded with you for your many wares, so great was your wealth, exchanging Helbon wine and Zahar wool.
27:19 Javan exchanged wrought iron, cassia, and aromatic cane from Uzal for your wares.
27:20 Dedan traded with you for riding gear.
27:21 Arabia and the sheikhs of Kedar were your agents, dealing in lambs, rams, and goats.
27:22 The merchants of Sheba and Raamah also traded with you, exchanging for your wares the very best spices, all kinds of precious stones, and gold.
27:23 Haran, Canneh, and Eden, the merchants of Sheba, Asshur, and Chilmad,
27:24 Traded with you, marketing rich garments, purple cloth, embroidered fabric, varicolored carpets, and braided cords.
27:25 The ships of Tarshish sailed for you with your goods; You were full and heavily laden in the heart of the sea.
27:26 Out into deep waters your oarsmen brought you; The east wind shattered you in the heart of the sea.
27:27 Your wealth, your goods, your wares, your sailors, your crew, The caulkers of your seams, those who traded for your goods, All the warriors with you, the whole crowd with you Sank into the heart of the sea on the day of your downfall.
27:28 At the sound of your sailors shouts the waves shudder,
27:29 Down from their ships come all who ply the oars; Sailors, all the seafaring crew, stand on the shore.
27:30 They raise their voices over you and shout their bitter cries; They pour dust on their heads and cover themselves with ashes.
27:31 For you they shave their heads bald and put on sackcloth; For you they weep bitterly, in anguished lament.
27:32 They raise a lament for you; they wail over you: Who was ever destroyed like Tyre in the midst of the sea?
27:33 By exporting your goods by sea you satisfied many peoples, With your great wealth and merchandise you enriched the kings of the earth.
27:34 Now you are wrecked in the sea, in the watery depths; Your wares and all your crew have fallen down with you.
27:35 All who dwell on the coastlands are aghast over you; Their kings are terrified, their faces distorted.
27:36 The traders among the peoples now hiss at you; You have become a horror, you shall be no more.
28:1 The word of the came to me:
28:2 Son of man, say to the prince of Tyre: Thus says the Lord : Because you are haughty of heart, you say, I am a god! I sit on a gods throne in the heart of the sea! But you are a man, not a god; yet you pretend you are a god at heart!
28:3 Oh yes, you are wiser than Daniel, nothing secret is too obscure for you!
28:4 By your wisdom and intelligence you made yourself rich, filling your treasuries with gold and silver.
28:5 Through your great wisdom in trading you heaped up riches for yourself— your heart is haughty because of your riches.
28:6 Therefore thus says the Lord : Because you pretend you are a god at heart,
28:7 Therefore, I will bring against you strangers, the most bloodthirsty of nations. They shall draw their swords against your splendid wisdom, and violate your radiance.
28:8 They shall thrust you down into the pit: you shall die a violent death in the heart of the sea.
28:9 Then, face to face with your killers, will you still say, I am a god? No, you are a man, not a god, handed over to those who slay you.
28:10 You shall die the death of the uncircumcised handed over to strangers, for I have spoken—oracle of the Lord .
28:11 The word of the came to me:
28:12 Son of man, raise a lament over the king of Tyre, and say to him: Thus says the Lord : You were a seal of perfection, full of wisdom, perfect in beauty.
28:13 In Eden, the garden of God, you lived; precious stones of every kind were your covering: Carnelian, topaz, and beryl, chrysolite, onyx, and jasper, sapphire, garnet, and emerald. Their mounts and settings were wrought in gold, fashioned for you the day you were created.
28:14 With a cherub I placed you; I put you on the holy mountain of God, where you walked among fiery stones.
28:15 Blameless were you in your ways from the day you were created, Until evil was found in you.
28:16 Your commerce was full of lawlessness, and you sinned. Therefore I banished you from the mountain of God; the cherub drove you out from among the fiery stones.
28:17 Your heart had grown haughty because of your beauty; You corrupted your wisdom because of your splendor. I cast you to the ground, I made you a spectacle in the sight of kings.
28:18 Because of the enormity of your guilt, and the perversity of your trade, you defiled your sanctuary. I brought fire out of you; it devoured you; I made you ashes on the ground in the eyes of all who see you.
28:19 All the nations who knew you are appalled on account of you; You have become a horror, never to be again.
28:20 The word of the came to me:
28:21 Son of man, turn your face toward Sidon and prophesy against it.
28:22 Thus says the Lord : Watch out! I am against you, Sidon; I will win glory for myself in your midst. They shall know that I am the , when I deliver judgment upon it and manifest my holiness in it.
28:23 I will send disease into it; blood will fill its streets, Within it shall fall those slain by the sword raised against it on every side. Then they shall know that I am the .
28:24 No longer will there be a thorn that tears or a brier that scratches for the house of Israel From the surrounding neighbors who despise them; thus they shall know that I am the .
28:25 Thus says the Lord : When I gather the house of Israel from the peoples among whom they are scattered, and I manifest my holiness through them in the sight of the nations, then they shall live on the land I gave my servant Jacob.
28:26 They shall dwell on it securely, building houses and planting vineyards. They shall dwell securely while I execute judgment on all their neighbors who treated them with contempt; then they shall know that I, the , am their God.
29:1 In the tenth year, on the twelfth day of the tenth month, the word of the came to me:
29:2 Son of man, turn your face toward Pharaoh, king of Egypt, and prophesy against him and against all Egypt.
29:3 Say to him: Thus says the Lord : Pay attention! I am against you, Pharaoh, king of Egypt, Great dragon crouching in the midst of the Nile, Who says, The Nile belongs to me; I made it myself!
29:4 I will put hooks in your jaws and make all the fish of your Nile Cling to your scales; I will drag you up from your Nile, With all the fish of your Nile clinging to your scales.
29:5 I will hurl you into the wilderness, you and all the fish of your Nile. You will fall into an open field, you will not be picked up or gathered together. To the beasts of the earth and the birds of the sky I give you as food.
29:6 Then all the inhabitants of Egypt will know that I am the . Because you were a staff of reeds for the house of Israel:
29:7 When they took hold of you, you would splinter, throwing shoulders out of joint. When they leaned on you, you would break, pitching them down headlong.
29:8 Therefore thus says the Lord : Look! I am bringing the sword against you to cut off from you people and animals.
29:9 The land of Egypt shall become a desolate waste; then they shall know that I am the . Because you said, The Nile belongs to me; I made it!
29:10 Beware! I am against you and against your Nile. I will turn the land of Egypt into ruins, into a dry, desolate waste, From Migdol to Syene, up to the border of Ethiopia.
29:11 No foot shall pass through it, no human being or beast cross it; it will remain uninhabited for forty years.
29:12 I will make the land of Egypt the most desolate among desolate lands; Its cities, the most deserted among deserted cities for forty years; I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations and disperse them throughout other lands.
29:13 But thus says the Lord : At the end of forty years I will gather the Egyptians from among the peoples where they are scattered;
29:14 I will restore Egypts fortunes, bringing them back to the land of Pathros, the land of their origin. But there it will be a lowly kingdom,
29:15 lower than any other kingdom, no longer able to set itself above the nations. I will make them few in number, so they cannot rule other nations.
29:16 No longer shall they be security for the house of Israel, But a reminder of its iniquity in turning away to follow them. Then they shall know that I am the Lord .
29:17 In the twenty-seventh year on the first day of the first month, the word of the came to me:
29:18 Son of man, Nebuchadnezzar, the king of Babylon, has made his army wage a hard campaign against Tyre; their heads grew bald, their shoulders rubbed raw, yet neither he nor his army received compensation from Tyre for all the effort they expended against it.
29:19 Therefore thus says the Lord : See! I am giving to Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon, the land of Egypt! He will carry off its wealth, plundering and pillaging whatever he can find to provide pay for his army.
29:20 As payment for his toil I give him the land of Egypt—oracle of the Lord .
29:21 On that day I will make a horn sprout for the house of Israel, and I will let you again open your mouth in their midst; then they shall know that I am the .
30:1 The word of the came to me:
30:2 Son of man, prophesy and say: Thus says the Lord : Wail: Alas the day!
30:3 Yes, a day approaches, a day of the Lord approaches: A day of dark cloud, a time appointed for the nations.
30:4 A sword will come against Egypt, there will be anguish in Ethiopia, When the slain fall in Egypt when its hordes are seized, its foundations razed.
30:5 Ethiopia, Put, and Lud, all the mixed rabble and Kub, and the people of allied lands shall fall by the sword with them.
30:6 Thus says the : The pillars of Egypt shall fall, and its proud strength sink; From Migdol to Syene, its people will fall by the sword— oracle of the Lord .
30:7 It shall be the most desolate among desolate lands, Its cities the most ruined among ruined cities.
30:8 They shall know that I am the , when I set fire to Egypt, and all its allies are shattered.
30:9 On that day, messengers from me will go forth in ships to terrorize confident Ethiopia. Anguish will be among them on Egypts day—it is certainly coming!
30:10 Thus says the Lord : I will put an end to Egypts hordes by the hand of Nebuchadnezzar, king of Babylon:
30:11 He and his army with him, the most ruthless of nations, will be brought in to devastate the land. They will draw their swords against Egypt and fill the land with the slain.
30:12 Then I will dry up the streams of the Nile, and sell the land into evil hands; By the hand of foreigners I will devastate the land and everything in it. I, the , have spoken.
30:13 Thus says the Lord : I will destroy idols, and put an end to images in Memphis. There will never again be a prince over the land of Egypt. Instead, I will spread fear throughout the land of Egypt.
30:14 I will devastate Pathros, set fire to Zoan, and execute judgment against Thebes.
30:15 I will pour out my wrath on Pelusium, the fortress of Egypt, and cut off the troops of Thebes.
30:16 I will set fire to Egypt; Pelusium will writhe in anguish, Thebes will be breached, and Memphis besieged in daylight.
30:17 The warriors of On and Pi-beseth will fall by the sword, the cities taken captive.
30:18 In Tahpanhes, the day will turn dark when I break the scepter of Egypt there and put an end to its proud strength. Dark clouds will cover it, and its women will go into captivity.
30:19 I will execute judgment against Egypt that they may know that I am the .
30:20 On the seventh day of the first month in the eleventh year, the word of the came to me:
30:21 Son of man, I have broken the arm of Pharaoh, king of Egypt. See! It has not been immobilized for healing, nor set with a splint to make it strong enough to grasp a sword.
30:22 Therefore thus says the Lord : See! I am coming against Pharaoh, king of Egypt. I will break both his arms, the strong one and the broken one, making the sword fall from his hand.
30:23 I will scatter the Egyptians among the nations and disperse them throughout other lands.
30:24 I will, however, strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon and put my sword in his hand so he can bring it against Egypt for plunder and pillage.
30:25 When I strengthen the arms of the king of Babylon, and the arms of Pharaoh collapse, they shall know that I am the , because I put my sword into the hand of the king of Babylon to wield against the land of Egypt.
30:26 When I scatter the Egyptians among the nations and disperse them throughout other lands, they shall know that I am the .
31:1 On the first day of the third month in the eleventh year, the word of the came to me:
31:2 Son of man, say to Pharaoh, the king of Egypt, and to his hordes: In your greatness, whom do you resemble?
31:3 Assyria! It is Assyria! A cedar of Lebanon— Beautiful branches, thick shade, Towering heights, its crown in the clouds!
31:4 The waters made it grow, the deep made it tall, Letting its currents flow around the place it was planted, Then sending its channels to all the other trees of the field.
31:5 Thereupon it towered in height above all the trees in the field; Its branches were numerous and its boughs long, Because of the many waters sent to its shoots.
31:6 In its branches nested all the birds of the sky; Under its boughs all the wild animals gave birth, And in its shade dwelt all the mighty nations.
31:7 It was magnificent in size and in the length of its branches, For its roots reached down to the many waters.
31:8 In the garden of God, no cedars could rival it, No juniper could equal its branches, no plane tree match its boughs. No tree in the garden of God could match its beauty.
31:9 I made it beautiful with abundant foliage, So that all the trees in Eden were envious of it.
31:10 Therefore, thus says the Lord : Because it was arrogant about its height, lifting its crown among the clouds and exalting itself because of its size,
31:11 I handed it over to a ruler of nations to deal with it according to its evil. I have cast it off,
31:12 and foreigners have cut it down, The most ruthless nations, have hurled it on the mountains. Its boughs fell into every valley and its branches lay broken in every ravine in the land. All the peoples of the earth departed from its shade when it was hurled down.
31:13 On its fallen trunk sit all the birds of the sky; Beside its fallen branches, are found all the beasts of the field.
31:14 This has happened so no well-watered tree will gain such lofty height, or lift its crown to the clouds. Not one of those fed by water will tower in height over the rest. For all of them are destined for death, for the underworld, among mere mortals, with those who go down to the pit.
31:15 Thus says the Lord : On the day it went down to Sheol, I made the deep close up in mourning for it. I restrained the currents of the deep, and held back the many waters. I darkened Lebanon because of it, and all the trees of the field languished because of it.
31:16 At the sound of its fall, I made nations shudder, When I cast it down to Sheol with those who go down to the pit. In the underworld all the trees of Eden took comfort: Lebanons choicest and best, all that were fed by the waters.
31:17 They too will go down to Sheol, to those slain by the sword, Its allies who dwelt in its shade among the nations.
31:18 To whom among the trees of Eden do you compare in glory and greatness? You will be brought down with the trees of Eden to the underworld, And lie among the uncircumcised, with those slain by the sword. Such is Pharaoh and all his hordes— oracle of the Lord .
32:1 On the first day of the twelfth month in the twelfth year, the word of the came to me:
32:2 Son of man, utter a lament over Pharaoh, the king of Egypt, and say to him: You liken yourself to a lion among nations, but you are like the monster in the sea! Thrashing about in your streams, churning the water with your feet, polluting the streams.
32:3 Thus says the Lord : I will cast my net over you by assembling many armies, and I will hoist you up in my mesh.
32:4 I will hurl you onto the land, cast you into an open field. I will make all the birds of the sky roost upon you, The beasts of the whole earth gorge themselves on you.
32:5 I will strew your flesh on the mountains, and fill the valleys with your corpse.
32:6 I will drench the land, pouring out your blood on the mountain; filling up the ravines with you.
32:7 When I extinguish you, I will cover the heavens and darken all its stars. The sun I will cover with clouds; the moon will not give light.
32:8 All the shining lights in the heavens I will darken over you; I will spread darkness over your land— oracle of the Lord .
32:9 I will trouble the hearts of many peoples, When I bring you captive among the nations, to lands you do not know.
32:10 I will fill many nations with horror; their kings will shudder at you, when I brandish my sword in their faces. They will tremble violently fearing for their lives on the day of your fall.
32:11 For thus says the Lord : The sword of the king of Babylon will come against you.
32:12 I will cut down your hordes with the swords of warriors, all of them, ruthless nations; They will lay waste the glory of Egypt, and all its hordes will be destroyed.
32:13 I will wipe out all the livestock from the banks of its many waters; No human foot will disturb them again, no animal hoof stir them up.
32:14 Then I will make their waters clear and their streams flow like oil— oracle of the Lord .
